title: Project Executive - Consumer Interactive
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Project Executive - Consumer Interactive  TransUnion Limited Tsim Sha Tsui Salary negotiable Posted on 08 Apr 2019 Project Executive - Consumer Interactive  TransUnion Limited Job Highlights Job Description Dynamics of the Role  TransUnion Interactive (TUI) requires an Executive in Project Management to support the Project Manager in executing projects to achieve business’ objectives in Hong Kong and other countries in Asia-Pacific. The potential candidate requires to assist in project planning, resource planning, project tracking, and overseeing scrum process. The Project Executive will need to have capability to demonstrate organizational skills. He/She needs to have the ability to collaborate within a team to delight customers with TUI’s technology solutions. How You’ll Contribute:  Supporting Project Manager by coordinating with Scrum Team, and providing status reporting on key performance indicators (KPIs), schedules, resources and milestone delivery  Support Project Manager throughout the entire project process (vision statement/scope, user stories creation, design, development, QA & test, release) using appropriate tools, particularly Confluence, Jira, and MS Project  Supporting Product Owners by utilizing collaborative techniques and communication strategies for efficient backlog management  Promoting self-organizing, cross-functional techniques in the production of high-value products  Supporting Scrum Team by removing impediments to protect sprint goals  Facilitating Scrum ceremonies as requested or needed as well as maintaining time-box ceremonies  Practicing the core agile principles in collaboration, prioritization, and accountability  Promoting continuous improvement throughout the product and software development life-cycle  Facilitating sprint demos, planning and retrospectives  Monitoring project deliverables and progress through continuous communication and coordination with project team members such as Sales, Marketing, Product, Customer Services & Operations, IT, external partners and service providers, etc.  Identifying and managing project issues, risks, and action items, and work to close and mitigate as appropriate  Tackle other assigned duties  What You’ll Bring:  The duties and responsibilities described above are the essential functions of the job. The qualifications below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. A Bachelor’s degree and 3+ years project management experience, particularly agile/scrum methodology within software/IT environment  Proven communication and organizational skills are required  Strong analytical, mediation, negotiation, and stakeholder management skills  Self-motivated and positive  Flexible, resilient, and resourceful in addressing project issues  Detailed oriented  Good oral and written communication skills in English Who We Are   A global leader in credit information and information management services, TransUnion gives businesses, consumers and the global community the power to achieve their goals. Businesses count on us to better manage risk and customer relationships. Consumers are able to better manage credit to achieve their financial goals. And in communities around the world we help build strong economies and give people the power to achieve their dreams. Exceptional opportunities are coming as we build on this strong foundation. Our ambitious growth strategy includes substantial new investment worldwide, a wide range of new solutions to help our customers succeed like never before, and new ideas for expanding our reach in every part of our dynamic and fast-moving industry. We’re on an exciting journey and you can be a part of it. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Interested candidates, please forward your resume and indicate current and expected salary by clicking apply now below Data collected will be treated in strict confidence and used for recruitment purposes only. You can also visit our LinkedIN career page at     Additional Information Career Level Entry Level Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 3 years Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Dental insurance, Double pay, Five-day work week, Flexible working hours, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus, Work from home Company details TransUnion  is a global leader in credit information and information management services. For more than 40 years, we have worked with businesses and consumers to gather, analyze and deliver the critical information needed to build strong economies throughout the world. Our dedicated associates provide solutions to approximately 45,000 businesses and approximately 500 million consumers worldwide.  We are  seeking to engage top talents to join our workforce in aggressive expansion of new Business Lines.  We pride ourselves in our corporate culture of multi-dimensional people management and development and have many employees enjoy a long term, satisfying and enriching career with us! description:

 Understands local business and growth strategy and how the O&T team fits into the big picture and supports these initiatives.
 Plan resource requirements, and work with local stakeholders to identify, mobilise and deploy resources. Align with local business on budgeting and financial
 objectives for the team. Manage the country operations & technology team (over 50 FTE’s), both on-shore and in the KL Shared Services Hub. Key responsibilities are recruiting, staffing,
 coaching, and continuous colleague engagement to ensure optimal performance and colleague satisfaction. Build and maintain strong, collaborative relationships with local and regional project sponsors/business leaders. Managing the operational governance framework – metrics reporting and fact based performance management Plan and Execute on Hong Kong Target Operating Model Work with the regional team on refining Hong Kong’s Target Operating Model, including clarifying team scope, capacity / capability requirement, IT landscape,
 process re-engineering, and change management  Partner with the KL Shared Services Hub to implement potential scope expansion in the KL hub Partner with regional Transformation Team to drive process improvements through methodologies such as Six Sigma, Lean or other efficiency measures Work with Marsh Asia IT team to identify technology upgrade or digital innovation opportunities. Responsibilities include liaison with business in requirement
 gathering and change management  Co-ordinate cross-functional (e.g. Finance, Legal, Compliance) inputs and resolution of issues related to projects or initiatives. 
 
 Minimum 10 years of relevant working experience in operations management or implementation of TOM, insurance industry experience will be an advantage Fluency (spoken and written) in English, Cantonese & Mandarin Good understanding of business strategy and role of operations to support growth Strong communication skills – able to communicate at various levels in the organization Strong influencing skills Strong analytical and data-presentation skills Good skills in software applications such as Excel, Work, PowerPoint, Microsoft Project. Strong organisational and time management skills. 
 
 Attractive remuneration and incentives will be offered to the right candidate. Job applications should be sent in confidence with details in education, working history and salary expectation to the Human Resources Manager via the application
 button below. 
 We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Visit us at www.marsh-asia.com All information received will be kept in strict confidence and only for employment-related purposes.  is a global leader in insurance broking and risk management. Marsh helps clients succeed by defining, designing, and delivering innovative industry-specific solutions that help them effectively manage risk. Marsh’s approximately 30,000 colleagues work together
 to serve clients in more than 130 countries. Marsh is a wholly owned subsidiary of
 Marsh & McLennan Companies 
 (NYSE: MMC), a global professional services firm offering clients advice and solutions in the areas of risk, strategy, and people. With annual revenue of US$13 billion and approximately 60,000 colleagues worldwide, Marsh & McLennan Companies is also the parent
 company of  Guy Carpenter ,
 a leader in providing risk and reinsurance intermediary services;  Mercer ,
 a leader in talent, health, retirement, and investment consulting; and  Oliver Wyman ,
 a leader in management consulting. Follow Marsh on Twitter,  @MarshGlobal ;

title: Senior IT Architect (Application)
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Senior IT Architect (Application) Bank of China (Hong Kong) Limited Not Specified Posted on 15 Apr 2019 Senior IT Architect (Application) Bank of China (Hong Kong) Limited Job Highlights Job Description  494210  Full time  Information Technology Department  Information Technology Job Description: The Senior IT Architect (Application) is responsible for delivering architecture intent to the bank, especially focus on the design and definition of the enterprise application architecture.
 It is the technical authority on application architecture in the Bank. Responsibilities: Works collaboratively to addresses the conceptual/planning level of the technology in collaboration with other architects and subject matters experts Ensures that the application portfolio evolves at an appropriate rate and does not become unviable as the other related architectures change The application architect is the SME focused on designing application interfaces and software services to maximize reuse based on the business processes and governance rules for sharing Provide guidance and coaching to Application Development team in the development of the application solutions Ensures there are reusable standards, guidelines, patterns and frameworks for application development projects Utilizes capability modeling to align collaboration strategy and planning with business strategy and goals Prototypes and demonstrates innovative and effective solutions that align with organization's mission Conduct analysis of technology industry and market trends to determine the strategies on the bank's architecture Oversees the documentation of all architecture design and analysis work Verifies that technology strategies and architectures are in regulatory compliance Propose changes to methodologies, procedures, and software development lifecycle to ensure continuous improvement Research, identify, and evaluate current and upcoming application and development technologies 
 
 Requirements: Undergraduate degree in Information Technology or related discipline 10+ years of experience in IT industry, in which 5+ years of experience in related role 5+ years of experience as a technology leader with proven record(s) in practicing the associated application technologies as well as their incorporation into enterprise IT solutions Experience in software development and coding in various languages (Java, C#, Python, .NET etc.) Knowledge of application design in OO programming, API, UML, Tiered architecture, Relational Databases and Web development Experience in developing and implementing strategic IT technologies and related processes, procedures, and decision support Experience with business requirements gathering/analysis Excellent technical knowledge of up-to-date infrastructure systems and standards Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Good command of both written and spoken English and Chinese (Cantonese and Mandarin) Proven strategic thinker to provide big picture and visions for future technology development Experience in managing projects is preferred Related professional certificates are definitely an added advantage Candidates with less experience will be considered as IT Architect 
 
 We offer competitive remuneration package and comprehensive fringe benefits including medical and life insurance, and different types of allowances
 to the right candidates. Interested parties, please submit your application by clicking Apply Now. For details, please visit our website
 http://www.bochk.com Data collected would be used for recruitment purposes only. Applicants who do not hear from us within 8 weeks may consider their application unsuccessful
 and their data will be destroyed within 24 months of receipt. Additional Information Career Level Senior Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 10 years Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Life insurance, Medical insurance Company details Join Bank of China (Hong Kong) 
Be a dynamic member of our team  We commit to excellence and professionalism
 We value people
 We offer challenging and rewarding careers that will further your personal development.

title: Software Engineer (Multiple Levels)
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Software Engineer (Multiple Levels)  Clover Health HK Limited Central & Western Area Salary provided Posted on 12 Apr 2019 Software Engineer (Multiple Levels)  Clover Health HK Limited Job Highlights Job Description Clover is reinventing health insurance by working to keep people healthier.   We value diversity — in backgrounds and in experiences. Healthcare is a universal concern, and we need people from all backgrounds and swaths of life to help build the future of healthcare. Clover's engineering team is empathetic, caring, and supportive. We are deliberate and self-reflective about the kind of engineering team and culture that we are building, seeking engineers that are not only strong in their own aptitudes but care deeply about supporting each other's growth.   We are looking for software engineers that want to solve many different kinds of problems. You will work with other engineers, data scientists, and healthcare professionals building tools to improve the health of real people. As a Software Engineer, you will: Commit to simplifying the complexities of healthcare by building systems that multiply human efforts. Learn about new tools and technologies to solve problems and move our goals forward. Help the team define and maintain development practices that let us iterate quickly while maintaining quality — including writing tests and documenting key implementations. Work with Product Managers and operational staff to conceptualize new features . If you qualify as a Senior Engineer, you will also:  Dig into projects in order to build robust and easy to use APIs. Be a pragmatic voice, collaborating across multiple teams and areas of concern. Mentor people around you, helping the entire team level up in skills. You will love this job if: You are excited by big, complicated problems and try to solve them with pragmatic, well-engineered solutions. You have a natural  intellectual curiosity  that drives you to find out how things work and if they can work better. You enjoy working in a  fluid, collaborative  environment, defining and owning priorities that adapt to our larger goals. You can bring clarity to ambiguity while remaining open-minded to new information that might change your mind. You are  not hesitant  to jump in to help fix things that are broken and you feel great responsibility to make sustainable systems. You are happy to fill in the gaps to reach a goal where necessary, even if it does not always fit your job description. You have a  genuine  interest in what good technology can do to help people and have a positive attitude about tackling hard problems in an important industry. You should get in touch if: You have experience with functional or imperative programming languages -- e.g., Python, Ruby, Go, C, or Java. You approach building and maintaining systems with maturity and rigor. You are able to work in different technical systems and concerns. For being considered the role of Senior Software Engineer, you should also have: Built and refactored complex (often distributed) systems. Scaled the impact of other engineers through mentorship, development of reusable libraries, and documentation. Lead development projects, but have also value created space and opportunity for other people to become leaders. *********************************************************** About Clover International:  Leveraging our expertise in the US health insurance business, we are reinventing health care by combining the power of data with human empathy to help our clients and partners to improve health care to their members. We believe the healthcare solutions can be made better, so we've created custom software and analytics to empower our clients and partners to intervene and provide personalized care to the people who need it most. Our success as a team is measured by the quality of life of the people served by our clients and partners. Those who work at Clover are passionate and mission-driven individuals with diverse areas of expertise, working together to solve the most complicated problem in the world: healthcare.     Additional Information Career Level Not Specified Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 3 years Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Dental insurance, Five-day work week, Medical insurance, Work from home More Jobs from this employer Machine Learning Specialist Posted on  21-Mar-19 View all jobs from this employer About JobsDB About jobsDB FAQ Career @ jobsDB Contact us Contact us International partners Bdjobs (Bandladesh) Brighter Monday (East Africa) Catho (Brazil) Jobberman (West Africa) JobStreet (S.E. Prepare training data, develop machine learning / deep learning algorithms. Develop data analytics algorithms supporting financial applications. PhD holder in Computer Science, Electronic Engineering, Information Engineering or relevant disciplines, including non-local applicant. Experience in programming using Java, Python, R, C/C++. Experience/knowledge in machine learning packages (e.g., scikit-learn, Tensorflow, caffe, PyTorch). Experience in time series data analysis is a plus. Experience in big data / distributed system is a plus. To apply,
  by clicking 'APPLY NOW'  with your resume  (word format) with attaching the PhD certificate / supporting document from the University;
 you must quote the  Job Ref  and include the following information:  Name of University PhD obtained/expecting and when Have you participated in ITF Project Internship Program before? Yes/No If you answer Yes in item 3, please state the period Have you been employed by ASTRI before? If yes, please state the period Academic referee Your R&D skills Your work experience, if applicable Only short-listed candidates will
 be notified. Personal data provided by applicants will be used for consideration of an application only. ASTRI reserves the right not to fill the position. Additional Information Career Level Not Specified Qualification Postgraduate Industry Job Function Years of Experience Not Specified Employment Type Contract, Full Time Benefits Dental insurance, Five-day work week, Medical insurance Company Website Company details Hong Kong Applied Science and Technology Research Institute Company Limited (ASTRI) 
 was set up by the Hong Kong SAR Government in 2000 with the mission of enhancing Hong Kong’s competitiveness in technology-based industries through applied research. Our R&D strategic focus covers five areas of applications: Financial Technologies, Intelligent
 Manufacturing, Health Technologies, Smart City, and Application Specific Integrated Circuits through our mandate as the Hong Kong branch of the Chinese National Engineering Research Centre (CNERC).
 ASTRI’s core R&D competence in various areas is organised under seven Technology Divisions: Mixed Signal Systems IC, Advanced Digital Systems, Electronics
 Components, Intelligent Sensing Technology System, Intelligent Software and Systems, Security and Data Sciences, and Communications Technologies.

title: Associate Vice President, UX and UI (FinTech & Innovation)
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs  Associate Vice President, UX and UI (FinTech & Innovation) United Asia Finance Limited Not Specified Salary negotiable Posted on 03 Apr 2019  Associate Vice President, UX and UI (FinTech & Innovation) United Asia Finance Limited Job Highlights Job Description As the AM, UX and UI you will be working with stakeholders across departments to identify the business requirements, experience enhancements, and usability improvements,
 to drive and manage the continued success of a holistic online experience and loan system.
 
 The right candidate is a customer experience expertise in particularly with a strong passion and deep understanding of digital touchpoints management to drives customer behavior online. This
 role is a strong collaborator and be comfortable reconciling the big picture with the details in achieving business goals. This role will own, develop and prioritize the ongoing customer experience development to maximize value for the business, leveraging
 insights and data to inform all prioritization decisions. Responsibilities: Accountability for the digital proposition (roadmap)
 Plan and prioritize product feature
 Leverage customer research, usability studies, and market studies to drive consumer delight
 Define, measure, and analyze key success metrics Act as the bridge between business and technology to ensure all are unified around a shared direction
 Support ideation, prototyping, POCs to drive innovation and customer-centric experiences Preferably having Project Management Skill 
 
 Requirements: Minimum 8 years’ digital product/platform/marketing experience Strong communication, presentation and influencing skills
 Attention to detail - strong analytical and problem-solving skills
 Ability to think both strategically and tactically
 Creative thinker - willing to challenge the status quo
 Team player and able to work with cross-functional workgroups 
 
 We offer attractive remuneration package which includes double pay and discretionary bonus. Interested parties please send your CV indicating your current salary,
 expected salary and availability to HR Department, by clicking “Apply Now” (Personal data collected will be treated in the strictest confidence and will be handled by authorized personnel for recruitment-related purposes only. Applicants who do not hear from
 us within 3 months may consider their application unsuccessful and their data will be destroyed within 24 months of receipt.) Additional Information Career Level Senior Qualification Not Specified Industry Job Function Years of Experience 8 years Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Double pay, Performance bonus Company details United Asia Finance Limited (亞洲聯合財務有限公司) is the market leader specializes in consumer lending in Hong Kong and PRC via a mix of business channels including network
 of branches, Internet and mobile. We strive to maintain our market leadership by continuous uplift of professionalism and creation of new market practices and standards through innovation. We have 48 branches in Hong Kong and coverage in 15 main cities in
 PRC.   Join us if you are talented with the matched skillset and experience and want more: Regain work-life balance and regular work pattern Learn the best market practices and standards Enrich your career professionalism in an innovative environment Explore personal interests in company activities, outings and classes Earn a competitive remuneration package comparable to the market   You may visit
  to know more about United Asia Finance Limited. Do act now and send us your application and CV. Under the guidance of Regional Security Manager-APACx (Asia Pacific excluding India), coordinate response and incident management to address
 threats towards company staff, assets & operations. Educate key stakeholders on security principles and implementation. Implement the Physical Security strategy in your region in alignment with the business goals. Implement processes and metrics – use data to make decisions. Maintain strong relationships and effective communication across all regional business operations.
 Develop strong relationships with local law enforcement agencies as well as private sector peers. Develop security awareness and education programs and materials.   What You’ll Need
 5+ years experience in a security management role. Recent hands-on experience throughout Japan and the wider region is mandatory. Military or law enforcement background is a big plus. Creative ‘can do’ attitude towards problem solving. Attention to detail in both written and oral communication. Ability to manage security challenges in a constantly changing fast paced environment. Comfortable with ambiguity. Able to scale with the business and thrive in a rapid growth environment. Experience managing contract security services. A well established professional network of security contacts within the region. Capable of fostering a culture of Trust, Honesty and Integrity. Travel required as needed to get things done. title: Finance Analyst
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Finance Analyst Johnson Electric Industrial Manufactory Limited Shatin Area Salary provided Posted on 29 Mar 2019 Finance Analyst Johnson Electric Industrial Manufactory Limited Job Highlights Job Description Additional Information Career Level Entry Level Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 2 years Employment Type Full Time Benefits Five-day work week, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus, Transportation allowance Company Website Company details Established in 1959, Johnson Electric Group is a global leader in motion products, control systems and flexible interconnects. It serves a broad range of industries including automotive, building automation and security, business machines, defense and aerospace, food and beverage, home technologies, HVAC, industrial equipment, medical devices, personal care, power equipment and power tools. The Group’s business strategy is based on the twin pillars of providing “technology leadership” and being the “safe choice” for its customers. The Company supports its long term customers through complete product life from new product introduction to mature high volume production.  Johnson Electric offers a comprehensive combination of application knowledge, breadth of technology, design engineering, manufacturing and logistics excellence. Our unique “Productizing Process” and the “Johnson Electric Production System” (JEPS) combine to deliver product differentiation and supply chain performance to our customers. The JEPS for each product is created in parallel with Research & Development to create a seamless flow from design to production, resulting in defect free and on time start-up of manufacturing. JE’s global footprint positions its engineering and manufacturing resources close to where its customers are doing their businesses. Engineering proximity with customers enhances collaboration and the creation of product differentiation. Local technical and customer support throughout the world increases the quality of communication, resulting in on-time project completion, scheduling flexibility and assurance of supply. The Group employs more than 40,000 employees and subcontract workers in over 23 countries. Its innovation and product design centers are located in Hong Kong, China, Switzerland, Germany, Italy, Israel, Japan, UK and USA.  JE has strong presence in China, with multiple manufacturing sites located in various cities, including Shenzhen, Beihai, Shanghai and Nanjing. The Company has established sizable manufacturing operations in Shenzhen where we hire 22,000 employees and workers. In  2016,  JE Hong Kong was recognized as a Caring Company by the Hong Kong Council of Social Service and one of Asia’s Best Companies To Work For by HR  Asia  Magazine.   In  the  same  year,  JE  won 2 Gold Awards on Talent Acquisition  and  Employee  Relations  awarded  by  the American Chamber of Commerce  China  HR  Best Practices Management Association.  The Group will continue  to live its core values by attracting and retaining top talent in support of the Company’s ambitious growth strategy. Johnson Electric Holdings Limited is listed on the Stock Exchange of Hong Kong. (Stock Code: 179) . Company Web Address: http://www.johnsonelectric.com US$3.2 Billion in 2017   40,000 employees and subcontract workers in over 23 countries. title: Research Analyst / Senior Research Analyst
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Research Analyst / Senior Research Analyst GfK Retail and Technology Hong Kong Limited Kowloon Bay Salary negotiable Posted on 30 Mar 2019 Research Analyst / Senior Research Analyst GfK Retail and Technology Hong Kong Limited Job Highlights Job Description About Boutique Research GfK Boutique Research is amongst the first market research firms to develop an analyst team in-house to add value to ‘big data’ specifically for institutional investors. Analysis and forecasts leverage proprietary point-of-sale and partner data complimented with financial results of publically listed companies. Research reports are syndicated and deliver impactful and concise written conclusions as well as captivating data visualization. GfK analysts are in a unique position to help clients cut through noisy data and find meaningful ways to incorporate alternative data into the investment process for securities listed worldwide. The Research Analyst works on a growing international team conducting research on publically traded companies derived from GfK’s proprietary data assets. We are looking for an energetic and motivated individual seeking to develop their critical thinking skills to serve the audience in the institutional investment space.    Mining through GfK’s proprietary global PoS database using SQL, Power Pivot and Power  Effectively communicating our research messages and conclusions to clients, which are top tier hedge funds and mutual funds.  You will be a client-facing analyst covering multiple companies and engaging in challenging two-way conversations.  Creating thoughtful and conclusive research reports on publicly traded companies across select consumer technology categories.  Comparing the signals coming from GfK’s proprietary dataset with other external data points, such as company quarterly earnings reports, news stories, investor road shows, etc…  Mentor Research Associates and Analysts in the best practice for data analysis, forecasting, modelling, and crafting short and impactful notes for the management team at GfK Boutique.  Liaison amongst satellite GfK offices, globally, and GfK Boutique’s primary Business Intelligence team to ensure accuracy of data extraction and extrapolation.  Travel as necessary to represent GfK Boutique at industry and GfK events.   As a Research Analyst, you will have the opportunity to: A rewarding experience. GfK Boutique is a growing, entrepreneurial company with a flat organizational structure. Analysts are not only focused on research but are also considered key contributors to the growth of the business. You will be positively surprised by how significant a contribution you can make towards both the direction and success of the company. Exposure to top investment managers globally. With this role one can gain a clearer understanding of the investment research process through i) the team’s regular client interactions and ii) the context building that is required for you to be successful. A truly global experience and perspective. Our team, companies under coverage, and client base are all global in nature, which yields plenty of opportunities for those who are looking for such a multinational/multicultural experience. The role requires top-rate analysis skills, problem solving aptitude, intellectual rigor as well as self-motivation. We value ingenuity, simplicity, and dedication to the achievement of team objectives.    5+ years of relevant work experience with at least 2+ as an analyst, with significant  experience in a client facing role  Solid analytical skills and an experience reporting (verbally and in print) on point-of-sale data.  Strong oral and written communication skills to convey our messages to clients as clearly  and concisely as possible.  Proven exceptional analytical skills and appetite for knowledge  A willingness to dive into large, complex data sets to create unique, actionable analysis for our clients.  High proficiency of Microsoft excel (Pivot Tables, Macros, Formulas)  Advanced data visualization (charts, data tables etc)  A keen eye for quality control. The ability to recognize data errors, likely the result of human error in the database.  Coordinate and execute process improvement efforts  The ability to think on your feet when being challenged, being responsive to client needs, and work extended hours.  Set objectives and development plans for the analyst team. Maintain regular dialogue with  remote analysts and teams.  We are all working together towards a common goal and thus, teamwork is essential. Less experienced candidates will be considered as Research Analyst Other responsibilities may be allocated by the line manager to ensure the effectiveness of the group. All employees within GfK are expected to promote the image of the company. This will be done in part, by adopting a professional appearance and maintaining an efficient and effective working environment.  It is expected that employees adhere to any specific deadlines set with respect to Company issues relating to professional servicing (internal and external) and objectives.  The detail and scope of this Job Description may be altered to take into account any changes in company needs Additional Information Career Level Middle Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 2 years Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Dental insurance, Five-day work week, Medical insurance, Performance bonus Company Website Company details  is the trusted source of relevant market and consumer information that enables its clients to make smarter decisions. More than 13,000 market research experts combine their passion with GfK’s 80 years of data science experience. This allows GfK to deliver vital global insights matched with local market intelligence from more than 100 countries. By using innovative technologies and data sciences, GfK turns big data into smart data, enabling its clients to improve their competitive edge and enrich consumers’ experiences and choices. With an aggressive growth plan, the role has arisen

  categories. Understanding consumer needs, science breakthroughs and market trends, being able to spot emerging dynamics and breaks which will structurally alter the fabric
 of our categories Understanding the brand equity, maturity and legitimacy and conduct a sound diagnosis of existing portfolio, innovation pipeline and projects to identify
 global & local gaps and opportunities Working with the extended team to vividly bring new idea and concepts to life in a manner that generate intuitive understanding and team-wide engagement Making clear priorities based on barriers to entry and permission to play, business goals globally and locally, idea scale and go to market costs assessment The candidate is able to: Stay curious and read, research, explore all topics related to the category and its underlying needs Connect with stakeholders inside and outside of the organisation Work effectively & influence (without authority) numerous stakeholders across the business.

Have business acumen and a robust business assessment of portfolio and projects. Able to get under the skin of consumers and influencers Strong drive to achieve results
 Exceptionally proactive and initiates action
 Flexible and able to adapt to an ever-changing work environment Comfortable working autonomously and is self-motivating
 Shares feedback positively and with good intent Strategic and solutions-focused Organised and able to manage multiple projects and competing priorities effectively Excited to understand the worlds of today and tomorrow in relation to our categories Creative in exploring and bringing to life new ideas and concepts Master connector, building a solid network inside and outside of H&H Displays confidence in directing the project team to achieve common goal Adopting a ‘big picture’ view and thinking outside of the square Enjoys facilitating and taking others on a journey Comfortable navigating challenges and tackles them with a solutions-focused approach Extensive understanding of innovation management – including the ability to forms ideas and bring these ideas through to life Demonstrated track record in consumer and insights, concept ideation and validation, Demonstrated track record in multi-functional, multi-stakeholder engagement and alignment. Degree Holder A background in FMCG/Wellness/Baby preferred, with minimum 6 years brand marketing and innovation experience, and clear international exposure. Deep consumer understanding and trend forecasting / monitoring Exceptional learning agility
 Stakeholder management, including the ability to influence without authority
 Ability to articulate & resolve complex challenges Experience in Innovation Management International / Global project experience
 Strong team player Excellent command of spoken & written English Job Offer: Dynamic & multicultural environment with teamwork culture Co-working spaces with coffee, fresh fruits & snacks 5 Days Work Medical & Dental Insurance Onsite Yoga Classes Product allowance   We offer competitive salary package and career development opportunity to the successful candidate.  Interested parties please apply with full resume by stating the
 . To learn more about
 , please visit our website at  .  a global leader in advance baby nutrition and care, and premium quality vitamins and supplements, which are the two core business of the group. Website:  At H&H we have a passion for human wellbeing.  Our mission to make people healthier and happier unites us. We believe the secret to a happy life lies in the connection with wellness. We aspire to bring the relationship
 between health and happiness closer together.  Just as we nurture our families and friends we believe in caring for our whole being. We can create positive social impacts by sharing our principles of mindfulness, nutrition
 and movement. We advocate healthier lifestyles so people can live better and do more.  We recognize our origins and remain true to our heritage while shaping the future for generational wellness.  We are passionate and we care. Our culture is the single most important part of our business and without this we cannot be successful in our mission. We inspire each other
 and share knowledge and ideas. We help each other to flourish, and remind ourselves that life is precious and should be celebrated every day. As one team, we stand for ‘possibility’.   Our vision is focused on premium nutrition and lifetime wellness. Where

The job holder will be responsible for the development and enhancement of existing practices across areas such as recruitment, training and development, compensation and benefits, employee relations, as well as HR & Administration policies in line with the forecast growth of the Group’s business. The growth
 of HYPEBEAST has seen its focus transcend from its initial roots to encompass all forms of fashion, arts, design and culture. This makes HYPEBEAST a premier network and destination for cultural enthusiasts, tastemakers and influencers alike. Responsibilities: Assist manager and editors for our Traditional/Simplified chinese sites in developing digital marketing strategies and campaigns to achieve traffic and business goals. Analyse data, trends and insights to fully optimise all digital platforms. Translating findings into workable strategies to develop Editorial content and Traffic to sites. Prepare regular marketing and performance reports. Provide expert advice to optimize digital platforms to maximise sales. Facilitate in expanding Social Media community and traffic through data minded approaches. Regular industry and competitor research. Translating research into workable insight. Digital marketing campaigns to grow Mobile App downloads and usability. Developing creative approaches to promote HYPEBEAST as a brand on Chinese platforms. Requirements: Degree holder in Marketing, Business Administration or related disciplines. 1 year of experience in the Digital field. Prior experience in social media marketing in China, a great understanding of WeChat, Weibo, Douyin and other key Chinese social media platforms. High proficiency in Google Analytics, Baidu Analytics, Search Engine Marketing, and Social Media Marketing. Proficiency in Microsoft Excel. Knowledge in SQL is a big advantage. High proficiency in both written and verbal communication in Mandarin and English. An affable personality to be able to work well in a team setting. Passionate about digital marketing and working in the fashion/contemporary culture industry.   If you think you’ve got what it takes, please provide your cover letter, CV, and expected salary. This position is based and located in Hong Kong. Candidate must be eligible to work in Hong Kong. Personal data collected is for recruitment purpose only.   Additional Information Career Level Entry Level Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 1 year Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Dental insurance, Five-day work week, Medical insurance, Performance bonus Company details HYPEBEAST was launched in 2005 as a one-stop news source for internet savvy fashion enthusiasts and continues to inform and inspire trendsetters

title: IT Manager / Assistant IT Manager (CMS193/J01)
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs IT Manager / Assistant IT Manager (CMS193/J01) VTECH COMMUNICATIONS LTD  Tai Po Area Salary negotiable Posted on 01 Apr 2019 IT Manager / Assistant IT Manager (CMS193/J01) VTECH COMMUNICATIONS LTD  Job Highlights Job Description Responsibilities : Oversee IT projects development and delivery process, ensure project quality and abide to time schedule. Review existing software applications and architect to devise innovative solutions
 while adhering to industrie 4.0 intelligence. Facilitate functional teams for new SAP implementation and on-going application update and enhancement. Work closely with internal customers to gather and analyse functional requirement
 and transform into technical specification in compliance with Corporate Internal Audit regulations. Research on latest IT technology and participate in proof-of-concepts of emerging technologies which fit in the business operation in fulfilment of business goals. Coach internal developers
 and project leaders for proactive solution delivery, through data analysis and interpretation for continuous improvement of performance. Investigate, troubleshoot, isolate technical problems including network, hardware and software, resolving user technical issues. Consolidate the technical know-how into Knowledge-Base
 and IT Policy. Perform preventative maintenance to improve system service level. Requirements : Degree holder in Computer Science / Engineering / IS / IT or relevant discipline; Minimum 5 years experience in system development and end-to-end project delivery ; Possess technical knowledge covering the following areas is an added advantage : Deployment of SAP functional modules ( FICO / SD / MM / PP) and customization report. Experience with SAP ABAP Programming for R/3 System and code-level performance optimization. Technical proficiency in Lotus Script, Java / J2EE , XPages Workflows, backend processes development in Lotus Domino environment and interfacing with various systems (SAP / Oracle / MES).
 External and internal checks along with controls and outputs. Experience to develop front-end user interface such as dashboard, intelligent form, staff / customer portal by using HTML5, CSS3, bootstrap, AJAX, XML/SOAP,JQuery and pCharts/highcharts
 modules. Familiar with Open-sourced frameworks such as LAMP stack (Linux, Apache, PHP, MySQL), Tomcat / JSP. Experience in artificial neural network (ANN) machine learning algorithm design, big-data analysis, complexity analysis, decision supporting, optimization, problem solving and diagnosis.
 Familiarity with open source AI libraries including OpenCV, OpenCL, Caffe, Tensorflow, PyTorch or Matlab. Hands on experience of cable-based / WIFI network topology design, failover/failback, redundancy / high availability, load balance and disaster recovery. Sound knowledge in LAN/WAN standards
 and protocols (e.g. VLAN, OSPF, SNA, DSLW, BSTUN, IPSec, MPLS) and servers-based software solutions included MSSQL, Oracle, IIS, Active Directory, VMware / Hyper-V virtual environments). Exposure in Electronic Manufacturing Service industry Strong communication and interpersonal skills with Can-Do Attitude and passionate on new technologies. Proficient in English, Cantonese and Mandarin; Travel to PRC 2 to 3 days per week is required. Candidates with less experience will be considered as Assistant IT Manager We offer attractive remuneration package including 5-day work, flexible work hours and other benefits to the right candidates. Interested parties please forward full resume
 with expected salary and quote job reference number to     For more information about us, please visit our website at:
 http://www.vtech.com/       All applications will be used for the purpose of recruitment only. Applicants not invited for interview within 4 weeks may consider their applications unsuccessful. We will
 retain the applications for a maximum period of six months and may refer them to suitable openings within our Group.   Additional Information Career Level Middle Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 5 years Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Double pay, Education allowance, Five-day work week, Flexible working hours, Free shuttle bus, Medical insurance, Performance bonus Company Website Company details More Jobs from this employer Sustainability Officer (VTT168/J01) Posted on  1 hour ago Program Management Executive (EMS Industry) (CMS177/J16) Posted on  6 hours ago Senior Internal Auditor (VCO150/J02) Posted on  12-Apr-19 View all jobs from this employer About JobsDB About jobsDB FAQ Career @ jobsDB Contact us Contact us International partners Bdjobs (Bandladesh) Brighter Monday (East Africa) Catho (Brazil) Jobberman (West Africa) JobStreet (S.E.  and transform their businesses. We ensure the highest levels of certainty and satisfaction through a deep-set commitment to our clients, comprehensive industry expertise and a global network of innovation and delivery centers. TCS has been recognized by Brand
 Finance as one of the Big 4 Global IT Services Brands. Our continued industry-leading growth is a testament to the certainty our clients experience every day. TCS has 289 offices
 across 46 countries and 147 delivery centers in 21 countries. Job Description : Application Support Engineer   We are looking for a talented support engineer to join our IT team. You will be in a part of our existing team for supporting our customer's operations
 critical service support, carrying out data research, liaising with technology and other internal teams on workflow improvements, data interpretation and data improvements and help in providing solutions that drive ongoing improvements to the quality.   Department :
 Information Technology   Eligibility Criteria: Aggregate 70% 
 Bachelor’s  degree holder in 
 Engineering or Technology ( Computer Science, Information Systems ,
 Electronics & Communication System  or equivalent) Fluency in spoken 
 and  written English and Chinese Knowledge in programming languages such as Java, J2EE, Webservices, UnixShellScript, PLSQL/SQL and database in

 issue case / incident report  document ‘To Innovate’ bent of mind Should have good Analytical and Problem solving skills
 and ability to work in a diverse team   Job Location:

 document Stay up-to-date on emerging technologies Flexibility to operate in shifts   Additional Information Career Level Not Specified Qualification Not Specified Industry Job Function Years of Experience Not Specified Employment Type Full Time Company Website Company details Tata Consultancy Services is an IT services, consulting and business solutions organization that delivers real results to global business, ensuring a level
 of certainty no other firm can match. TCS offers a consulting-led, integrated portfolio of IT, BPS, infrastructure, engineering and assurance services. This is delivered through its unique Global Network Delivery Model™, recognized as the benchmark of excellence
 in software development. A part of the Tata group, India’s largest industrial conglomerate, TCS has over 389,000 of the world’s best-trained consultants in 46 countries. The company generated consolidated revenues of U.S. $17.6 billion for year ended March
 31, 2017 and is listed on the BSE Limited and National Stock Exchange of India Limited. For more information, visit us at www.tcs.com. In terms of MDRT members, our family’s
 performance is equivalent to some big insurance companies. Challenge family is a brand amongst the insurance industry, known for quality of service and utmost professionalism. The Premier Association of Financial Professional awards MDRT (Million Dollar Round Table) membership, only to honor to the top 1% of financial planners worldwide.
 In Challenge district, our MDRT ratio is 95.9% out of 100+ staff members. Challenge Family aims to raise the standards in the industry to new heights. Being highly educated individuals comprised of a group of Bachelor and Master degree
 graduates. Members of Challenge district are from diversified backgrounds including elite institutions worldwide and locally, some of us are from Imperial College of London, UC Berkeley, London School of Economics, HKU, HKUST and CUHK. Management Associate, Wealth Management  Job Descriptions: Provide comprehensive wealth management advice to High Net Worth individuals and corporate clients Design tailor-made financial plans for individuals, to build portfolios while maximizing their interest through a range of investment vehicles Develop and expand existing network through customer relationship management            
 Lead team and implement strategic planning for team management Requirement: University degree holder or equivalent (Welcome IANG visa and dependent visa holders) Fresh graduates are welcome to join the Premier Academy program Entrepreneurship vision and self-motivated mindset Excellent interpersonal, communication and presentations skills Good command of written and spoken English and Chinese, preferably fluent in Putonghua   We offer: Monthly Allowance + attractive commission and performance bonus  (MDRT Annual income is
 over HK$500,000+) Overseas trips & conventions One-year fast track management path Comprehensive in-depth training with personal coaching Well-structured development program to help you become a member of Million Dollar Round Professional designations training e.g.
 MDRT, CFP, CFA, RFP, RFC, FchFp   You’ll discover more about our program on 
 All personal data collected will be used for recruitment purpose only and will be treated in accordance with Personal Data Policy, which is available upon request. AIA reserves the
 right to modify the terms and conditions of package offered.   Hong Kong Permanent resident / HKID Holders / valid work permits (IANG & dependent visa) in Hong Kong only Fresh Graduates are welcome 挑战区财富管理春季实习计划 由 12 年香港百万圆桌 (MDRT) 人数比例冠绝香港的挑战区域举办，拥有成熟、完善的新人培训平台。专为有志投身金融行业的初职人士、应届大学或硕士毕业生匠心打造财富管理体验课程， 2019-2020 年度，现在正式招生了 ! 课程内容 ： 投资市场分析 财务策划概念 实战个案分析 人际沟通技巧 最新税改后高端客户的资产配置 提供福利 : 优秀学员会被推荐去友邦精英学院，晋身财富管理经理 百万圆桌会员每月收入达 5 万以上 佣金 ( 每月 ) 和年终奖金 提供专业，全面的培训 优秀和明确的升职阶梯（例如 MDRT / COT / TOT 成员） 赞助 和 出席年度海外会议的机会 定期举办各种团队技能活动 医疗 津贴 和学习津贴 需要条件 : 持有大学本科学位（任何学科） / 留港内地大学生 / 毕业生 / 研究生 欢迎刚毕业生 / IANG / 本科或以上 的 学生 精通英语和普通话 外向 的 ，自我驱动的，具有目标 的 , 自我激励 的 具有 优秀的人际关系和沟通技巧 为学员提供福利 ，包括参观投资银行、拍摄专业证件照、夏日船趴等等 **实习完成将会获派发实习证书 Additional Information Career Level Entry Level Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience N/A Employment Type Full Time, Internship, Permanent Benefits Education allowance, Flexible working hours, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus, Travel allowance Company details About Us AIA Challenge District We are Challenge District, the No.1 district for 12 years in the past 13 years among 250+ districts in AIA, possessing the highest percentage and number of MDRT members. In terms of MDRT members,
 our family’s performance is equivalent to some big insurance companies. Challenge family is a brand amongst the insurance industry, known for quality of service and utmost professionalism. The Premier Association of Financial Professional awards MDRT (Million Dollar Round Table) membership, only to honor to the top 1% of financial planners worldwide. In Challenge district, our MDRT
 ratio is 95.9% out of 100+ staff members. Challenge Family aims to raise the standards in the industry to new heights. Being highly educated individuals comprised of a group of Bachelor and Master degree graduates. Members of Challenge
 district are from diversified backgrounds including elite institutions worldwide and locally, some of us are from Imperial College of London, UC Berkeley, London School of Economics, HKU, HKUST and CUHK. AIA International Limited AIA Group Limited and its subsidiaries (collectively “AIA" or “the Group") comprise the largest independent publicly listed pan-Asian life insurance group. It has operations in 16 markets in Asia-Pacific
 –wholly-owned branches and subsidiaries in Hong Kong, Thailand, Singapore, Malaysia, China, Korea, the Philippines, Australia, Indonesia, Taiwan, Vietnam, New Zealand, Macau, Brunei, a 92 per cent subsidiary in Sri Lanka and a 26 per cent joint-venture in
 India. AIA meets the savings and protection needs of individuals by offering a range of products and services including retirement savings plans, life insurance and accident and health insurance. The Group also provides employee benefits, credit life and pension services to corporate clients. Through an extensive network of agents and employees across Asia-Pacific, AIA serves the holders
 of more than 25 million individual policies and over 13 million participating members of group insurance schemes. As the market leader, we are looking for the best candidate like you to become the best of the world. MDRT (Million Dollar Round Table) is The

Watson Retail (HK) Limited Job Highlights Job Description This position will be responsible for  implementing
 both tactical and strategic business transformation, change and continuous improvement through big data initiatives. Also, it is required to i ntroduce actionable insights through data analysis to Business units
 to improve availability, quality and timeliness of business insights Responsibilities:  Consult with business units and data scientists on the team to analyze and insights discovery. Work with huge volume of data and complex analysis into quantitatively proficient and
 actionable insights Work with data scientists to apply advanced statistic and analytics to insights discovery Participate in data visualization of data analytics with reporting analysts Develop consistent, efficient and repeatable data processing required to support data analysis across business units Validation of data science related products. Working with large data sets via SQL, Python or R. May participate in testing for data science projects or any ad-hoc duties Job Requirements Bachelor degree in Computer Science, MIS, Statistics, Business or related discipline Strong background and passion in data analysis and insights discovery. Past analysis portfolio is highly desired Extensive knowledge and skills in SQL and dealing with large data sets. Python and R experience is highly preferred Deep understanding of analytics, including data management, business intelligence and insights discovery Able to prioritize and co-ordinate work streams/projects to drive delivery of overall programme Excellent verbal and written communication skills with
 the ability to work with diverse groups of people We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from all qualified candidates. The information provided will be treated in strict confidence and be used only
 for consideration of your application for relevant / similar posts within the A.S. Watson Group. Applicants not hearing from us within 6 weeks from the date of advertisement may consider their applications unsuccessful. All
 personal data of unsuccessful applicants will be destroyed within 12 months from the date of application.  Additional Information Career Level Not Specified Qualification Not Specified Industry Job Function Years of Experience Not Specified Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Five-day work week, Medical insurance, Performance bonus Company Website Company details is what we bring to life, every single day.  has set the standard since 1841 – and we’ve only just begun. A.S. Watson (ASW) is the largest international health and beauty retailer in Asia and Europe with over 14,100 stores in 24 markets. Each year, over three billion customers and members shop with our well-known retail brands. Everyday, we bring   to
 life through our 12 retail brands including Watsons, Kruidvat, Trekpleister, Rossmann, Superdrug, Savers, Drogas, ICI PARIS XL, The Perfume Shop, PARKnSHOP, FORTRESS and Watson’s Wine. At ASW, it is our vision to be the world’s leading health, beauty and lifestyle retailer, and with such ambition in mind we work tirelessly to put a smile on
 our customers’ faces, in order to deliver our commitment “We bring   to life” – to our customers, colleagues, communities and shareholders. Inspired by our passionate commitment “ ”
 is at the heart of the movement at ASW connecting brilliant talent around the world by inspiring them with the higher purpose of working at ASW – “Bringing   to
 life” by making people healthy and beautiful.  isn’t just a job. It’s your share in the global success of our brands. Together we’re   than you can imagine.  When the Hong Kong Dispensary opened its doors to customers 175 years ago, nobody could’ve imagined it would one day grow into the A.S. Watson Group we know today. The A.S. Watson Group story is already an extraordinary one. But there’s much more to come. Help us write the next chapter. title: Data Analyst / Data Scientist – Technology & Digital Services
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Data Analyst / Data Scientist – Technology & Digital Services New World China Land Limited Central Salary negotiable Posted on 02 Apr 2019 Data Analyst / Data Scientist – Technology & Digital Services New World China Land Limited Job Highlights Job Description Responsibilities:  Collaborate with business teams and senior management
 to  ideate and introduce new data science innovations into business areas; Prepare visualizations and present key analytical insights to business team and senior management to facilitate
 buy-in with actionable recommendation; Plan and facilitate the implementation of enterprise wide big data / analytics projects and related integration
 with enterprise solutions; Analyze structured and unstructured data, visualize findings to uncover patterns and discover insights for
 operation improvement, services optimization, predictive maintenance and business model enhancements; Facilitate data architecture design including data definition, data modeling and data re-architect; Conduct training and sharing session to facilitate awareness of best practices, know-how in data discovery; Engage external strategic partners for evaluation, collaborative development of innovative solutions from
 proof-of-concept to realization; Collaborate with application & technology infrastructure teams for addressing seamless integration and protection
 of business data;  Drive the rollout of analytic solutions as Group standard to all NWCL business units.
   Requirements: Bachelor or higher degree
 in Quantitative Analysis, Statistics, Decision Science, Mathematics or Computer Science or related discipline, degree holder with strong association with data science, machine learning and analytics will
 also be considered; At least
 2  years  relating to data analysis, data mining, statistical modeling, predictive analytics, machine learning
 or data science related work; Experience working with complex data from multiple sources, database marketing and database management; Proficiency in Python, R, SAS or other statistical / data science language; Experience with statistical modeling tools and data visualization tools; Strong understanding of the key trends in technology innovations, particularly real estates and customer services; Strong communication, negotiation, influencing skills, with the ability to interact with senior management
 and external partners; Hands-on experience in Microsoft SQL, BI, Hadoop, Cloud based tools an advantage; Well organized, independent, self-motivated and good team player; Proficient in both written and spoken English and Chinese, including Putonghua; and occasional
 PRC travel is required; Candidate
 with higher qualification will be considered as Data Scientist.   We offer competitive remuneration, 5 days work, life insurance, hospitalization and outpatient medical schemes, and other fringe benefits to the
 right candidate. Interested candidates, please forward your full resume with current and expected salary to Human Resources Department at 9/F, New World Tower 1, 18 Queen’s Road Central, Hong Kong or by e-mail. (Personal data collected will be used for recruitment purpose only. All collected information will be kept on our files for 24 months.) Additional Information Career Level Not Specified Qualification Not Specified Industry Job Function Years of Experience Not Specified Employment Type Full Time Benefits Education allowance, Five-day work week, Medical insurance Company details New World China Land Limited (“NWCL”) is the flagship Mainland China property arm of Hong Kong-listed New World Development
 Company Limited (“NWD”; Hong Kong Stock Code: 00017) and an early Hong Kong pioneer entering the China property market. The NWCL vision is embodied by a humanistic spirit inspiring us to create fulfilling places and thriving cities that people love to call
 home. Guided by insight, we inject innovation into large-scale mixed-use commercial landmarks, offices, shopping centres, residential neighbourhoods and hotels while preserving local heritage, creating sustainable developments that allow people, city and nature
 to flourish in harmony. We bring the “Soul of the City” to life. title: Senior Campaign Manager
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Senior Campaign Manager Schneider Electric Asia Pacific Limited Quarry Bay Salary provided Posted on 02 Apr 2019 Senior Campaign Manager Schneider Electric Asia Pacific Limited Job Highlights Job Description To be part of the Campaign team in driving the Marketing Transformation along the marketing value chain of attract, engage & convert from digital and display advertising to social media to offline channels into sales orders through campaigns. He or she is the focal point of communication between the GM BU strategic marketing partners, Creative Studios, Agencies, and other functional marketing teams (Thought leadership, Digital Customer Experience, Media, Social Media, etc) to lead the development of campaign creative assets, starting from creative brief development to defining project scope and timelines, to creating campaign kits for deployment.   Roles & Responsibilities   Develops Campaign Creative brief to include objectives, expected outcomes, target audience, etc.. in alignment with inputs from GMBU Strategic Marketing Partners or Segment Marketing Partners. Collaborate with GMBU Content Managers to plan the types of creative assets needed to support an effective customer journey and lead the development of campaign creative assets by personas and customer type.    Assess requirements of the campaign project to build and drive projects’ plan including project scope/deliverables/timelines, milestones (from scoping to design to final approvals), estimates to actual costs and invoicing, document & timely flow of information with project stakeholders including communicate updates if there is a change in project statement of work, schedule and estimate.  Facilitates approval process (BME, GM BU Plug-in and also CMO for new campaign concepts) and ensure Campaign Assets are ready for execution (proof reading, testing, etc) Ensure consistency of assets and organization’s brand & identity is adhered to in campaigns across all communication channels. Support GMBU Strategic Campaign Managers with campaign communication with country marcom team by providing campaign creative asset kits to be part of overall campaign guidance. Monitor and analyze campaign performance to maximize ROI, and make recommendations on changes needed.   Requirements More than 10 years of extensive experience working on a variety of B2B global marketing campaigns from inception to completion Knowledge of IoT Marketing Ability to think like a customer and advocate for customers and the community Superb written and verbal communications skills. Ability to  persuade senior audience, of the wisdom of proposed campaigns. Creativity and ability to generate big, new ideas and take (smart) risks  to deliver on unique campaign ideas that creates buzz in the market Ability to manage large-scale, complex projects across functional teams with discipline and precision  Experience in the use of digital marketing & social media for lead generation and content marketing Speed, flexibility, adaptability and ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment Outstanding judgment, problem-solving ability and resourcefulness Collaborative mind-set: You will have to work with multiple stakeholders to plan, implement & measure all campaign activations across multiple markets. Ability to work independently with little direction, and self-motivate Data and results driven with exceptional knowledge around metrics, KPI, ROI analysis and A/B testing Additional Information Career Level Not Specified Qualification Not Specified Industry Job Function Years of Experience Not Specified Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Dental insurance, Double pay, Education allowance, Five-day work week, Flexible working hours, Gratuity, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus, Work from home Company Website Company details About Schneider Electric Schneider Electric is leading the Digital Transformation of Energy Management and Automation in Homes, Buildings, Data Centers, Infrastructure and Industries. With global presence in over 100 countries, Schneider is the undisputable leader in Power Management – Medium Voltage, Low Voltage and Secure Power, and in Automation Systems. We provide integrated efficiency solutions, combining energy, automation and software. In our global Ecosystem, we collaborate with the largest Partner, Integrator and Developer Community on our Open Platform to deliver real-time control and operational efficiency. We believe that great people and partners make Schneider a great company and that our commitment to Innovation, Diversity and Sustainability ensures that Life Is On everywhere, for everyone and at every moment. www.schneider-electric.com     More Jobs from this employer Finance Analyst Posted on  15-Apr-19 Sales Engineer Posted on  15-Apr-19 Global Strategic Account Director Posted on  10-Apr-19 View all jobs from this employer About JobsDB About jobsDB FAQ Career @ jobsDB Contact us Contact us International partners Bdjobs (Bandladesh) Brighter Monday (East Africa) Catho (Brazil) Jobberman (West Africa) JobStreet (S.E. title: Material Planning Executive (1 year renewable contract)
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Material Planning Executive (1 year renewable contract)  Philip Morris Asia Ltd Southern Area Salary negotiable Posted on 02 Apr 2019 Material Planning Executive (1 year renewable contract)  Philip Morris Asia Ltd Job Highlights Job Description OUR VISION
 You may have heard of Philip Morris International (PMI), the world’s leading Tobacco Company and the maker of Marlboro – the undisputed number one cigarette
 brand in the world.  But PMI is about more than cigarettes. We’ve made a significant or momentum business decision to go “smoke-free” and work towards a world where non-combustible
 tobacco and nicotine products may one day replace cigarettes. Find out more on https://www.pmiscience.com/
 We’re now laying the foundation to make our smoke-free vision a reality (read about our transformation here: https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2017-03-08/big-tobacco-has-caught-startup-fever),
 and we are looking for a talented Manager Device Product and Process Improvement to work at our Hong Kong office to make it happen. YOU You will be employed in Hong Kong under Philip Morris Asia Limited (PMAL). PMAL operates as a subsidiary of Philip Morris International, Inc.
 RISE TO THE CHALLENGE
 You will be monitoring component planning performance execute EMS with the key objective to ensure component inventory level is optimized. Act as the point
 of escalation for EMS and Tier 2 suppliers. Ensure accuracy of E&O reporting and flag inventory risk to management. Constant review of E&O to identify ways to deplete inventory in the most efficient manner. Continuous improvement and simplification of processes
 to report and monitor component inventory level.  Key Accountabilities
 Monitor overall suppliers' material planning performance.  Ensure all Finished Goods shipment plan can be met by weekly CTB review with EMS to ensure component
 readiness for production. Partner with SC NPI lead to address all issues in CTB meeting and properly escalate to management to avoid interruption in supply plan.
 Be the gatekeeper for inventory replenishment to avoid excess inventory build-up.  Coordinate with EMS to buy Excess item(s) among different EMSs. Partner with Procurement team to establish process for Strategic Inventory management to ensure all T2 liabilities are made visible to management. Be the owner of the E&O and scrapping process for his/her category.  Work with Procurement and Technical function to minimize scrap by exploring solutions
 to deplete excess inventory with EMSs Standardize E&O report with EMS.  Ensure data integrity.  Report unusual purchasing activities and follow up actions in monthly management meeting. Support the Hong Kong Hub E&O reporting function to communicate and to explain root cause and action plan for excess items.
 Continuous process improvement.
 Support / Lead assigned projects Essential Skills and competencies: Minimum 5 years of experience in Material Planning with exposure to a multinational environment preferable in the electronic business environment.
 A College/ University degree in Business Administration / Supply chain/procurement specialty
 Project Management Experience, Action oriented, Priority Setting, Problem Solving, Standing Alone, Learning on the fly, Listening, Organizational Agility Functional skills: MRP experience, Good knowledge of SAP, Excellent MS Office skills [particularly Excel – including creation & analysis of large database]
 and Workpoint 
 Displaying the following traits would be an advantage: Detail-oriented Action oriented, and bring strong analytical skills and good problem solving skills Team player Pro-active   JOIN A GLOBAL MARKET LEADER PMI is the world's leading international tobacco company, with six of the world's top 15 international brands and products sold in more than 180 markets.
 In addition to the manufacture and sale of cigarettes, including the number one global cigarette brand, and other tobacco products, PMI is engaged in the development and commercialization of Reduced-Risk Products ("RRPs"). RRPs is the term we use to refer to products that present, are likely to present, or have the potential to present less risk of harm to smokers who switch
 to these products versus continued smoking. We have a range of RRPs in various stages of development, scientific assessment and commercialization. Because our RRPs do not burn tobacco, they produce far lower quantities of harmful and potentially harmful compounds
 than found in cigarette smoke. For more information, see www.pmi.com and www.pmiscience.com. FIND A NEW PATH Our company offers you a fresh perspective. Here, you will never stop exploring and discovering. We take on-the-job learning to another level, giving you
 every opportunity to develop your career and reach your full potential. With innovative technologies, services and processes, backed by a competitive salary and compensation package, you will work in a professional setting with clients and team members from
 all over the world.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender,
 sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status. If you believe you would be a good fit to the requirements of the role, and you would like to explore further a career path within PMI, please apply now so that we can start the conversation.         Additional Information Career Level Not Specified Qualification Not Specified Industry Job Function Years of Experience Not Specified Employment Type Contract Benefits Dental insurance, Double pay, Flexible working hours, Medical insurance, Travel allowance Company details More Jobs from this employer Manufacturing Integration Manager Posted on  5 hours ago Failure Analysis Senior Engineer Posted on  08-Apr-19 Senior Devices Process Development Engineer Posted on  08-Apr-19 View all jobs from this employer About JobsDB About jobsDB FAQ Career @ jobsDB Contact us Contact us International partners Bdjobs (Bandladesh) Brighter Monday (East Africa) Catho (Brazil) Jobberman (West Africa) JobStreet (S.E.
