title: Siri International Quality Engineer (Working Location: Beijing)
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Siri International Quality Engineer (Working Location: Beijing) Apple Others - China Salary negotiable Posted on 02 Apr 2019 Siri International Quality Engineer (Working Location: Beijing) Apple Job Highlights Job Description Play a part in the next revolution in human-computer interaction. Contribute to a product that is redefining mobile computing. Create groundbreaking technology for large scale
 systems, natural language, big data, and artificial intelligence. And work with the people who created the intelligent assistant that helps millions of people get things done — just by asking. Come join the Siri International Language Engineering team at Apple. We are a diverse, international and passionate group about quality engineering and creating innovative test
 and automation strategies to help us understand the quality of Siri while every part of the system is advancing. We are looking for highly motivated Quality Engineers who can own and drive test planning and automation development for Hong Kong Cantonese to join our team. Join the team
 responsible for ensuring the quality of Siri languages across all Apple Products, and other cloud based services. Native speaker fluency (or comparable) in Hong Kong Cantonese and ability to work in an English speaking environment Excellent knowledge of software test methodologies and passion for improving quality processes Experienced in developing test strategies and tools Proven experience in developing and executing quality plans for complex systems Strong automation development skills Creative thinker and strong problem solver Clear and compelling communication skills Proficiency in Java, C or C++ As a Siri International Quality Engineer for Hong Kong Cantonese, you will be primarily responsible for designing and executing the quality plan needed to help us understand
 the quality of features and technologies for Siri in your language.  We are passionate about the international user experience and crafting best in class products. That obsession extends to ensuring our quality plans are engineered to be rock
 solid and user focused.  Specific responsibilities include: Own all aspects the development and execution of quality plans across the development phases Define test strategies and metrics to qualify Siri’s underlying technologies including NLP, large data and machine learning features Define and implement the automation coverage and tooling needed Work closely with engineering and cross-functional quality teams
 Advocate for the international user experience and relevancy of features for your language To succeed in this role, you must be a creative problem solver with strong technical skills who thrives in a fast-paced environment, working across teams and organizations.
 You are passionate about quality engineering, innovative test strategies, and relying heavily on tooling and automation development. B.S or M.S in Computer Science, or equivalent experience Experience in natural language processing, internationalization, machine learning or related sub-fields. Experience with web services development Experience with iOS, macOS development Familiarity with additional scripting languages such as Shell, Javascript. Interested parties click "APPLY NOW" to submit your application. Personal data collected will be used for recruitment purpose only. Additional Information Career Level Entry Level Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience Not Specified Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Company Website Company details Apple is a place where extraordinary people gather to do their best work. Our community is made up of every kind of individual: artists and designers, engineers
 and scientists, thinkers and doers. Together we create things and experiences people once couldn't have imagined — and now can't imagine living without. So if you're excited by the idea of making a real impact, a career with Apple might be your dream job.
 Just be ready to dream big. title: Market Research Analyst
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Market Research Analyst The Nielsen Company (Hong Kong) Limited Quarry Bay Salary provided Posted on 02 Apr 2019 Market Research Analyst The Nielsen Company (Hong Kong) Limited Job Highlights Job Description Looking for a dynamic yet challenging market insight career in a commercial market?  Our consumer insight team would give you a broad horizon across different industries leveraging the latest digital and big data technology in this consumer centric economy. This is an exciting opportunity for you to develop a profession where you can work with our international clients and help them to succeed in business through product innovation and marketing strategies. You will be: Maintaining and building an accurate, complete, up-to-date understanding of the market with insightful data and intelligence Accountable for analyses, charting and performing quality checks for analytic reports Assisting in developing analytical solutions, consumer insight recommendation and   developing questionnaires aligned with client goals and needs Assisting in preparation of proposals and credential presentations The gatekeeper to ensure timely and quality deliverables and services to clients Providing administrative and operational support in research projects Collaborating with the various internal teams for research projects   You are required: Bachelor in Marketing, Business, Economics, Social Sciences, Mathematics, Statistics or equivalent disciplines   Inquisitive and passionate in Market Research Excellent analytical, communication, and coordination skills Proactive and strive for excellence A good team player Good command of oral and written English and Chinese Candidates with more experience will be considered as Senior Analyst. Please apply with full resume, present and expected salary, the applications without indicating the current and expected salary may not be considered. We offer competitive compensation package including Incentive, Birthday Leave, Medical, Life and Personal Insurance, etc.  To find out more about what it's like to work with Nielsen and how we can help you fulfill your career aspirations, please visit our website  http://www.nielsen.com/hk/en/about-us/careers.html  and click  Apply now . Personal data provided by job applicants will be used strictly in accordance with our personal data policy. The information will only be used for appointment to the Company and other company-related purposes. The Company will retain unsuccessful applications as required but not more than 12 months and may refer suitable applicants to other vacancies within the Company. At Nielsen, we are committed to growing our staff in an  open, connected, useful  and  personal  way. description:

Limited Others - China Salary negotiable Posted on 02 Apr 2019 Chief Financial Officer, Asia Pacific AP Elite Co. Limited Job Highlights Job Description Our client is a MNC manufacturer with global leading position in its industry. They are looking for a Chief Financial Officer (Asia Pacific) to join their senior management
 team. The role will be stationed in their Asia Pacific Headquarters based in China. The Chief Financial Officer (Asia Pacific) will report to the CEO of Asia Pacific. He/She will lead the finance and accounting teams across the APAC region. As a key
 member of the senior management, the position is also the strategic business partner to both the CEO of Asia Pacific and the headquarters in Europe to assist with the continuous growth and expansion of the Group in the region.   
 Job responsibilities 
 Implement a smooth and efficient accounting and finance management system while ensuring the corporate finance policies and goals are implemented appropriately Organize, prepare and control the company’s budget and forecast;  ensure current and future alignment of the company’s strategic development and destination to the overall profitability targets of the Group Ensure the accuracy and validity of financial reports so that management will be provided with timely, accurate and relevant financial data for decision making Develop and apply advanced international financial reporting, budgeting, forecasting and manufacturing management reporting for multiple entities in multiple jurisdictions Analyze group’s operations to identify weakness and pinpoint opportunities and improvement areas; initiate solutions/actions to optimize operational efficiency and profitability as an ongoing efforts to
 raise the bar Act as a key member in the strategic project, business development initiatives and M&A projects Coordinate with the Headquarters as the shareholder for reporting, initiatives, approval, action follow up and etc. Requirements Bachelor degree or above, with major in accounting/fina nce
 or related disciplines Qualified Accountant is preferred More than 15 years related experience with at least 2 years regional experience Strong track record in finance with ability to manage an operation with multiple entities and business lines and functions including R&D, procurement, production
 and extensive sales and service network Strategic thinking and good business acumen, including understanding of marketing, R&D; be able to grasp the big picture, including strategic as well as financial
 assessment of acquisitions and investments Strong executive presence with ability to support the APAC CEO in presenting to the Corporate Board Strong communication skills and fluent English; Chinese language skills is preferred Good at MS Office and familiar with ERP, preferably SAP   Personal data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only. Additional Information Career Level Senior Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 15 years Employment Type Full Time Company details AP Elite is a regional executive search firm specialized in mid to senior level management positions. title: Accountant - Group Financial Reporting Team, Headquarter Function
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Accountant - Group Financial Reporting Team, Headquarter Function   A.S. Watson Retail (HK) Limited Shatin Area Salary provided Posted on 03 Apr 2019 Accountant - Group Financial Reporting Team, Headquarter Function   A.S. Watson Retail (HK) Limited Job Highlights Job Description This is a newly created position of our Group Finance team.  The Accountant will be working under Group Financial Reporting team
 to prepare consolidation of AS Watson Group. Quarterly consolidated financial results and annual budget consolidation are the main consolidation tasks.
 The Accountant will work closely with the finance teams of business units to ensure their financial reports are reported on time and in line with the standards of the Group. The Accountant will also
 involve in process improvements to enhance efficiency.   Review and analyse financial results from business units, work closely with finance team of individual business unit to enhance quality of financial reports
 Consolidation of quarterly results and prepare financial reports for shareholders
 Review and consolidate annual budget from business units
 Prepare statutory accounts and liaise audit and accounting issues with auditor
 Provide support to ad hoc assignment and projects Provide value added insights to management to enhance efficiency by streamlining or automatizing processes   Degree holder in Accountancy or related disciplines with professional accounting qualification Minimum 5 years working experience in both big 4 audit firm and financial accounting in sizeable companies Solid experience in International Financial Reporting Standards with strong analytical and problem-solving skills Excellent interpersonal and communication skills in English, able to deal with senior management Mature, self-initiative and able to work independently and as a team player Capable of working under pressure and meet tight deadlines Good knowledge of computer skills, including MS Word, Excel and Powerpoint   Interested parties please e-mail your full resume in WORD FORMAT with expected
 salary to our company email (shown in our Company Profile).   We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from all qualified candidates. The
 information provided will be treated in strict confidence and be used only for consideration of your application for relevant / similar posts within the A.S. Watson Group. Applicants not hearing from us within 6 weeks from the date of advertisement may consider their applications unsuccessful. All personal data of
 unsuccessful applicants will be destroyed within 12 months from the date of application.    Additional Information Career Level Middle Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 5 years Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Education allowance, Five-day work week, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus Company Website Company details MORE  is what we bring to life, every single day. MORE  has set the standard since 1841 – and we’ve only just
 begun. A.S. Watson (ASW) is the largest international health and beauty retailer in Asia and Europe with over 14,100 stores in 24 markets. Each year, over three billion customers and members shop with our well-known retail brands. Everyday, we bring  MORE  to
 life through our 12 retail brands including Watsons, Kruidvat, Trekpleister, Rossmann, Superdrug, Savers, Drogas, ICI PARIS XL, The Perfume Shop, PARKnSHOP, FORTRESS and Watson’s Wine. Our vision At ASW, it is our vision to be the world’s leading health, beauty and lifestyle retailer, and with such ambition in mind we work tirelessly to put a smile on our customers’ faces,
 in order to deliver our commitment “We bring  MORE  to life” – to our customers, colleagues, communities and shareholders. Be Part of MORE Inspired by our passionate commitment “ Be Part of  MORE ”
 is at the heart of the movement at ASW connecting brilliant talent around the world by inspiring them with the higher purpose of working at ASW – “Bringing  MORE  to
 life” by making people healthy and beautiful. MORE  isn’t just a job. It’s your share in the global success
 of our brands. Together we’re  MORE  than you can imagine.  When the Hong Kong Dispensary opened its doors to customers 175 years ago, nobody could’ve imagined it would one day grow into the A.S. Watson Group we know today. The A.S. Watson Group story is already an extraordinary one. But there’s much more to come. Help us write the next chapter. Join us, and  Be Part of MORE !    If you are interested to know more about our global brands, explore our different teams and hear our amazing employees’ stories, please visit our career
 website,  www.aswatsoncareers.com .    You are welcome to register at our career website for job application or directly send your full resume with expected salary to A.S. description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Data Manager (5-day work in Tsim Sha Tsui) Starberry Limited Tsim Sha Tsui Salary provided Posted on 03 Apr 2019 Data Manager (5-day work in Tsim Sha Tsui) Starberry Limited Job Highlights Job Description Starberry is building big data and predictive analytics capabilities to enhance the location intelligence services of our Starbeacon platform. Over the last 2 years, our Starbeacon platform
 has been deployed in numerous locations ranging from retail shops to mall complexes and transport networks including the Hong Kong International Airport. And the network is expected to grow exponentially in the second half in the coming 12 months. We are seeking a Data and Analytics Manager to lead and grow a team to design, develop, and implement robust high-quality data solutions for new and existing projects within an agile environment. The
 successful candidate will be a creative problem solver and excel at uncovering insights relating to geolocation and new retail. Job description: Manage a team of data scientists and analysts. Take the overall responsibility for the end-to-end delivery of location intelligence data projects, including requirement gathering and analysis, design of report templates, data collection,
 defining data model and ETL requirements, overseeing the development of data algorithms and machine learning models, data visualization. Work closely with product team for the development of our own data products. Develop our capability to extract data insights from petabytes of location and non-location data. Present data insights to senior management on a regular basis Assist the preparation of the bid submission for data-related tenders. Provide the technical and business aspects of data science training to senior colleagues and management Drive data-related initiatives Define and enforce the data and privacy policies for our data products Job requirement: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Sciences, Statistics or related disciplines At least 2 years experience of team management Experience in communicating with senior management, various functional teams and business units, external customers Strong commercial sense and analytics skills Experience in managing all aspects of data science lifecycle such as requirement analysis, data mining, data cleansing, data exploration, data visualization and presentation Experience in advanced analytics and machine learning based prediction will be a great advantage Knowledge of cloud services, computer languages (e.g. Python), visualization are beneficial but not mandatory. Knowledge about Big Data tools on the cloud is a plus Knowledge about iOS and Android is a plus   Interest parties please apply in full resume including current and expected salary Additional Information Career Level Middle Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 2 years Employment Type Permanent Benefits Education allowance, Five-day work week, Housing allowance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus Company Website Company details More Jobs from this employer DevOps Manager Posted on  12-Apr-19 System Engineer Posted on  12-Apr-19 UX/UI Designer Posted on  02-Apr-19 View all jobs from this employer About JobsDB About jobsDB FAQ Career @ jobsDB Contact us Contact us International partners Bdjobs (Bandladesh) Brighter Monday (East Africa) Catho (Brazil) Jobberman (West Africa) JobStreet (S.E. title: Buying Controller
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Buying Controller Hop Lun Brands Limited Lai Chi Kok Salary provided Posted on 03 Apr 2019 Buying Controller Hop Lun Brands Limited Job Highlights Job Description Role Purpose DORINA  Buying Controller will support the stock inventory management to optimize sales and satisfy customer
 needs whilst maintaining tight control in all warehouses. Job Responsibilities Prepare monthly sales projections report by customer for sales office to support forward stock planning Maintain an accurate database with prices, articles etc., for manual invoicing on the consignment business
 Monitor the inventory by warehouse
 Regular stock replenishment by SKU and allocation  to warehouses 
 based on sales planning tool Analyze sales projection accuracy by sales office Protect the GP on discounted and mark-down stock
 Update and maintain stock website and mark-down master  at article and warehouse level
 for de-listed, markdown and ‘while stock lasts’ products Track and record status of goods in transit, stock on hand and goods under production Contribute to the building of new ERP system Job
 Requirements Higher Diploma  or above
 in Buying or related discipline 4+ years relevant experience in a fast paced environment Knowledge of wholesale stock business will be an advantage Excellent computer knowledge and a wizard at excel Strong business acumen with
 strategic yet practical mindset Strong organizational skills Must be a fire-starter with and entreprenurial spirit Enjoys working in a fast growing business environment and has a competitive and result driven mindset Used to working in a matrix organization with strong cross functional collaboration, flat organizational structure and where people are empowered to take own decisions and initiatives Self-driven with ability to take initiatives and push through decisions, driven, positive with a can-do attitude Self motivated, strong team player with excellent communication & presentation skills, verbally and in writing Open, flexible and receptive towards changes Culturally sensitive  and an excellent team player Fluent in English and Cantonese DORINA Competencies   BE A "FIRE STARTER" ENTREPRENEUR                                    always come up with ideas to generate leads, to create opportunities, and essentially own the overall pipeline of business be bothered by inefficiency, always consider whether there are places you could implement solutions or improvements try to solve, and be energized by any challenge that stands in the way be immensely passionate about your work, and know what it's like to dive deep into a subject and completely understand it able to work autonomously and be decisive, make calculated moves by taking calculated risks keep assuming positive intent in the workplace able to catch the ball and willing to run the extra miles ADAPT TO CHANGE & EXECUTE IT FASTER quickly modifies behavior to deal effectively with changes in the work environment. does not persist with ineffective behaviors and old routing consistently remains open to ideas offered by others, supports and uses good ideas to solve problems or address issues help others to develop a clear understanding of what they will need to do differently, as a result of changes in the company  DELIVER COMMITMENT demonstrate personal commitment to team   and
 company exhibits a sense of responsibility towards company goals   DEMONSTRATE EQ INTELLIGENCE              able to recognize and regulate emotions and behaviors in the workplace able to recognize others’ emotions and perspectives and take them into account welcome perpetual feedbacks i nteract
 with teammates with respect and empathy DEMONSTRATE DATA INTELLIGENCE              able to find patterns, evaluate data and reach conclusions which is essential for the business to gain insight able to identify inconsistencies in data and information   able to effectively use data and research to reach informed and effective decisions   EMBRACE INNOVATION & TECHNOLOGY                be receptive to change occurring within the workplace develop, sponsor, or support the introduction of new and improved method, products, procedures, or technologies. always challenge on boundaries and status quo,   not
 being constrained by current thoughts or approaches be innovative, people can make the difference, a small difference can lead to a big change. Additional Information Career Level Not Specified Qualification Not Specified Industry Job Function Years of Experience Not Specified Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Dental insurance, Education allowance, Five-day work week, Flexible working hours, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus Company details Hop Lun is an international leading fashion service company. We engage in design development, manufacture, distribution and retail business of fashion lingerie,
 swimwear, casual wear and night wear. Other than providing one-on-one ODM service to global retailer we also have two brands for our global wholesale and retail business which are Dorina and 6IXTY8IGHT. Hop Lun was founded in Hong Kong in 1992. We today have
 11 fully owned factories in Bangladesh, China and Indonesia and 8 sales offices in Austria, Benelux, Hong Kong, France, Germany, Sweden, UK and USA. Nearly 130 retail stores in Greater China, including HK & Macau, Korea and Taiwan operating under the name
 of “6IXTY8IGHT”. scripts Develop unit and integration tests using Java and JavaScript testing frameworks Contribute to design & overall solution and product architecture Requirements: Bachelor or above in software engineering, computer science or related disciplines Over 4 years’ experience in software development, backend development (preferable in Java), database schema design and data access logic design At least 4 years’ experience in developing servicer side backing application logics, APIs and web services Extensive hands-on experience in PaaS (e.g. Lambda) and IaaS environments (e.g. AWS) Experience with Agile (Scrum) project methodology and practices Relevant experience in home-automation, e-health, e-wallet and/or e-payment solution is a strong advantage Good knowledge in IoT and wearable APIs, mobile payment, blockchain and financial processes is a definite advantage  Troubleshooting techniques and ability to diagnose issues in a distributed environment Good command of written and spoken description:

 well as develop & implement business strategies for the growth of  
DORINA. Job Responsibilities   Price negotiation with suppliers for both raw materials and garment production Maintain Product & Colour Master, update as needed Prepare and issue PO for salesman samples Record receipt of salesman sample and check details are correct before factory releases to Global offices Handle customer sample requests to suppliers and arrange for dispatch to relevant sales offices Maintain seasonal shipment samples in orderly manner Work with Manager and suppliers on projections by article and delivery dates. Rework the styles with the production teams should the required
 DORINA  GP% not be achievable Higher Diploma  or above
 in Merchandising, Fashion, Textiles or related discipline 1+ years relevant experience in a multinational fashion environment with an understanding of Global markets Strong organizational skills Excellent computer knowledge especially in excel Self motivated, strong team player with excellent communication & presentation skills, verbally and in writin Open, flexible and receptive towards changes Culturally sensitive  and an
 excellent team player DORINA Competencies
   BE A "FIRE STARTER" ENTREPRENEUR                                            always come up with ideas to generate leads, to create opportunities, and essentially own the overall pipeline of business         be bothered by inefficiency, always consider whether there are places you could implement solutions or improvements         try to solve, and be energized by any challenge that stands in the way        be immensely passionate about your work, and know what it's like to dive deep into a subject and completely understand it         able to work autonomously and be decisive, make calculated moves by taking calculated risks         keep assuming positive intent in the workplace         able to catch the ball and willing to run the extra miles   ADAPT TO CHANGE & EXECUTE IT FASTER         quickly modifies behavior to deal effectively with changes in the work environment.         does not persist with ineffective behaviors and old routing         consistently remains open to ideas offered by others, supports and uses good ideas to solve problems or address issues         help others to develop a clear understanding of what they will need to do differently, as a result of changes in the company    DELIVER COMMITMENT         demonstrate personal commitment to team   and
 company         exhibits a sense of responsibility towards company goals     DEMONSTRATE EQ INTELLIGENCE                      able to recognize and regulate emotions and behaviors in the workplace         able to recognize others’ emotions and perspectives and take them into account         welcome perpetual feedbacks         interact with teammates with respect and empathy   DEMONSTRATE DATA INTELLIGENCE                      able to find patterns, evaluate data and reach conclusions which is essential for the business to gain insight         able to identify inconsistencies in data and information         able to effectively use data and research to reach informed and effective decisions   EMBRACE INNOVATION & TECHNOLOGY                1 .         be
 receptive to change occurring within the workplace         develop, sponsor, or support the introduction of new and improved method, products, procedures, or technologies.         always challenge on boundaries and status quo,   not
 being constrained by current thoughts or approaches         Be innovative, people can make the difference, a small difference can lead to a big change. Additional Information Career Level Entry Level Qualification Non-Degree Tertiary Industry Job Function Years of Experience 1 year Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Dental insurance, Education allowance, Five-day work week, Flexible working hours, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Overtime pay, Performance bonus Company details Hop Lun is an international leading fashion service company. We engage in design development, manufacture, distribution and retail business of fashion lingerie,
 swimwear, casual wear and night wear. Other than providing one-on-one ODM service to global retailer we also have two brands for our global wholesale and retail business which are Dorina and 6IXTY8IGHT. Hop Lun was founded in Hong Kong in 1992. We today have
 11 fully owned factories in Bangladesh, China and Indonesia and 8 sales offices in Austria, Benelux, Hong Kong, France, Germany, Sweden, UK and USA. Nearly 130 retail stores in Greater China, including HK & Macau, Korea and Taiwan operating under the name
 of “6IXTY8IGHT”. jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Manager, Finance & Business Controlling BSH Home Appliances Ltd Tsuen Wan Area Salary provided Posted on 03 Apr 2019 Manager, Finance & Business Controlling BSH Home Appliances Ltd Job Highlights Job Description THE JOB Develop and maintain the reporting which provides the management with meaningful data to steer the business Lead the budget planning, sales forecasts, data analysis and budget control process Act as the business partner by actively involved in the development of business processes, as well as strategies and action plans in order to improve business performance Monitor the objectives by comparing actual performance with planned performance, identify gaps and support implementing countermeasures if necessary Provide ad-hoc controlling support and be the contact person for various stakeholders within the company (i.e. interface between business owners, local F&A, regional and global counterpart) Supervise the team to deliver company target as appropriate THE CANDIDATE  Degree or above in Accounting, with HKICPA, ACCA, or CIMA Minimum 7 years of working experience, in which 3 years from Big Four and 4 years in managerial position Fluent in written and spoken English and Chinese, satisfactory in Mandarin Good reporting skill and strong numerical sense Proficient in MS Office and Chinese word processing, advanced in Excel applications. Knowledgeable on SAP Result-oriented with excellent communication and interpersonal skill and leadership skill We offer competitive remuneration package including 13th-month salary, performance bonus, 18-day annual
 leave plus other grant leave for family role, life and accident insurance coverage, generous medical and dental coverage, staff purchase privileges in addition to a 5-day work week to the right candidate. PLEASE APPLY  to BSH Home Appliances Limited by sending your full resume with present & expected salary
 and available commencement date via "APPLY NOW". All
 information provided will be treated in strict confidence and used for recruitment purposes only. Additional Information Career Level Senior Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 7 years Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Dental insurance, Double pay, Education allowance, Five-day work week, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus Company Website Company details BSH Home Appliances Group is the
 leading  
 manufacturer of home appliances in Europe and the world's number 2 in the sector. The group was founded in 1967. Since the beginning of 2015 BSH exclusively belongs to the Bosch Group. The BSH family
 is today made up of about 80 companies in 50 countries, with a total workforce of more than 61,800 people worldwide and posted annual revenue of over 13.8 billion Euros as of March, 2018. Today, BSH operates 42 factories worldwide to
 fulfil  different customer needs all over the world with its innovation, advanced technology, excellent and user-friendly
 design.     In
 BSH  Hong Kong, we carry two premium home appliances brands, Bosch and Siemens, and are a key player in the market with product
 portfolio spanning the entire spectrum of modern home appliances. It extends from major domestic appliances - kitchen appliances to dishwashers; washers and dryers; refrigerators and freezers to small appliances such as kitchen machines, food and beverage
 appliances and  vacuum cleaners .   For our company and brand information, please visit websites :
 ;
 ;
 . title: Director, Client Services & Loyalty - DFS9112562
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Director, Client Services & Loyalty - DFS9112562 DFS Hong Kong Limited Tsim Sha Tsui Salary provided Posted on 03 Apr 2019 Director, Client Services & Loyalty - DFS9112562 DFS Hong Kong Limited Job Highlights Job Description Job Summary: DFS (LVMH group) is the world's leading luxury retailer catering to the traveling public. We are currently seeking a Director, Digital of Client Services & Loyalty
 to join our team. In this role, you will lead the strategy to develop a best-in-class client services organization and will take our global Loyalty program to new heights. You will be responsible for driving incremental revenue with current customers, accelerating
 the recruitment of high potential prospects and increasing retention of existing VIP customers. You will be the guardian of the DFS client experience in the prestige lounges and support the operations across our store network. The right candidate has strong
 experience driving luxury sales and excels at delivering an amazing customer experience. Key Responsibilities: Strategy and sales development:
 Define and implement the Client Services strategy for DFS with the objective to accelerate recruitment of high potential prospects and increase retention of existing
 VIP customers.  Propose, plan and execute store-focused initiatives which generate new traffic to stores and drive repeat visits.
 Champion client development through relationship building and VIP outreach plans, including new client acquisition and maintaining existing client loyalty.
 Leverage client insights to drive store performance via strategies focused on growing, developing client base including local client retention, migration to priority
 categories, cross-sell into new categories.  Establish successful approaches to closing sales opportunities at events in different markets.
 Create strong relationships with Merchandising Team to support product launches, propose local client events in partnership with marketing and PR teams, and support
 company events by ensuring high client attendance rates and achievement of sales results.
 Drive and maximize sales performance to achieve/exceed monthly, quarterly, and annual sales plans, as well as KPIs and profitability targets.
 Monitor acquisitions working with the Personal Shoppers to ensure we are maintaining leads engaged with product and service.
 Analyze selling reports, identify opportunities and trends, research competitor performance, and develop strategies to meet the needs of the business. Loyalty:
 Lead Loyalty program development, performance and operations.
 Define, launch and evolve loyalty programs that enhance customer engagement and profitability. Manage loyalty activation goals and develop local tactics and plans to drive effective enlistment of new, high-value members.
 Increase customer loyalty through elevated and strategic VIP programs (retail & ecom) for all regions.
 Grow customer base exponentially and accelerate development of top VIP customers, by developing and executing strategies for customer loyalty.
 Expand the penetration of the loyalty program in all markets.
 Develop & execute the member engagement strategy to drive member experience, retention & loyalty.
 Drive innovation to enrich DFS' loyalty program.
 Identify key drivers of engagement (recruitment & repeat) and socialize use cases of marketing initiatives that successfully capitalize on these drivers.
 Ensure successful adoption of CRM tools across all regions.
 Client Services:
 Create and implement the overall client service strategy including staff coaching, client relationship management, in store client experience, and after sales service
 in order to achieve/exceed client barometer results.  Manage Voice of Client program and use learnings to continuously strengthen client service. Utilize all available data, including loyalty, POS & survey data to assess
 areas of opportunity to drive meaningful change in the store experience.  Manage the team’s Global Marketing calendar of activities and events. Evolve a network of client services managers and personal shoppers to develop shopping events
 and activities that focus on quality leads over quantity.  Work with cross-functional partners and utilize each customer touchpoint to create a data-rich view of the customer, enabling client services managers to deliver
 on truly special experiences in-store.  Continually test the quality of the member experience in stores and improvise solutions as appropriate to deliver on a customer-first vision which is best-in-class.
 Conduct weekly calls with key field personnel on both challenges and best practice in the stores to troubleshoot and improve all existing programs related to customer
 experience and loyalty.  Develop structure around client outreach communications (e.g. Implement client follow-up program, etc.). Key Requirements: At least 10 years direct experience in CRM/Loyalty/Client Services. Minimum of 2 years at a Director level. Solid understanding
 of retail a big plus.  Experience must include a combination of CRM/Database, Marketing, and Market Analysis, and a blend of proven strategic and tactical
 capabilities.  Passionate about Client Satisfaction and able to motivate and face challenging situations.
 Digital minded, curious about new habits and client behaviours.
 Strong experience and familiarity with Salesforce systems a plus.
 High degree of professionalism in communication, attitude and teamwork with customers, peers, and management team.
 Excellent presentation and facilitation skills.
 Strong leadership and coaching skills to build and develop a high-performing team.
 Proven ability to manage external suppliers and partners and ensure top value and performance for organization.
 Creative, analytical and thoughtful thinker – open to testing new ideas and work towards validating results. Additional Information Career Level Senior Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 10 years Employment Type Full Time Benefits Five-day work week, Life insurance, Medical insurance Company details DFS Group Limited is the world's leading luxury retailer catering to the traveling public. We have attained this position by listening to our clientele, adapting to changes in our customer base, and continually responding with innovative concepts.   Our strength lies in our strategic brand partnerships, groundbreaking store and product development, superior assortments, and targeted marketing programs.   As we continue to perfect our business model, improve our offerings and expand into emerging markets, we are well positioned to remain the world's leading luxury retailer.  the successful candidate will carry out the following duties: -   
 Responsibilities: Responsible for the Group consolidation and financial reporting Provide timely and accurate monthly financial reports/package for internal use and to parent company Participate in preparation of annual report and interim report Participate in quarterly forecast and annual budget Liaise with internal and external auditors on internal audit and annual statutory audit Coordinate and Perform group cash flow forecast and financial analysis Develop and coach the subordinates Performing other ad-hoc assignments 
 
 Requirements: Qualified Accountant and degree holder in Finance or Accounting discipline
 Minimum 5 years post-qualification relevant experience and listed company and big four experience in property industry preferred Familiar with the latest HK financial reporting standards and tax regulations Proficient in computerized consolidation and accounting system with experience in JDE and HFM preferred Detail-oriented, committed, pro-active and can work under pressure Good team player, well-organized, self-motivated with good interpersonal skills Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and able to work independently 
 
 Interested parties are invited to send their applications with a cover letter quoting job reference number, and full resumes stating career history, qualifications,
 present and expected salary and contact numbers through one of the following means: Postal address: Human Resources & Administration Department Swire Properties Limited 64/F, One Island East, Taikoo Place, 18 Westlands Road, Quarry Bay, Hong Kong  (852) 2880 8300 Application deadline is
 . If we have not contacted you within six weeks of the date above, please consider your application be unsuccessful this time.  The personal data of unsuccessful candidates collected for this recruitment exercise will be kept for
 12 months from its completion and thereafter destroyed. Information provided will be used for recruitment and appointment purpose only.  The Company will handle all personal data confidentially in accordance with the principles laid down in the Personal Data
 (Privacy) Ordinance.   © Swire Properties Limited 太古地產有限公司 Additional Information Career Level Senior Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 5 years Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Company Website Company details Swire Properties develops and manages commercial, retail, hotels and residential
 properties, typically mixed-use developments in prime areas across Hong Kong, Mainland China and Miami, US. Adhering to our core values of integrity, originality, long-term focus and quality, we pride ourselves in transforming the urban landscape, creating
 thriving communities and ensuring sustainable value for our stakeholders. Our creative culture drives our passion to excel and energises us to design inspiring experiences. title: Project Manager
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Project Manager Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd Lantau Island Salary provided Posted on 03 Apr 2019 Project Manager Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd Job Highlights Job Description  Application Manager  Information Technology This role is responsible for contributing operationally to the achievement of Information Management’s business objectives by delivering project management services across Cathay Pacific
 IT projects. Plan, direct and coordinate all IT project activities to ensure that project objectives are accomplished within prescribed time frames and funding parameters Adopt necessary standards and best practices for project management and ensure compliance with Project Management Office expectations Review project proposals or plans to determine time frame, funding limitations, procedures for accomplishing projects, risks, dependencies and negotiate staffing requirements to various
 project phases Provide leadership and motivation to project team members throughout the project life cycle Collaborate with Project Practice Lead to improve project management practices across all IT projects Collaborate with all related IT stakeholders to drive business and technology innovation to achieve business unit’s strategic plan and business objectives Keep abreast of the latest trends in technology and project management practices, ensuring timely exploration and proactively communicate IT’s position towards the introduction of relevant
 / key emerging technologies Manage dynamic project teams that consist of internal staff, contractors and vendors Manage all project issues, risks and dependencies effectively and ensuring all related stakeholders are aligned and up-to-date Foster a continuous learning and cross-team knowledge sharing culture among project delivery groups Ability to influence all key stakeholders, including senior executives Minimum 10 years of IT experience with at least 5 years in project management role Tertiary qualifications are essential Project Management certifications (i.e. PMP) are desired Proven experience in managing projects with ability to multitask and manage multiple medium to large projects in a cross-functional environment Demonstrated ability to lead and motivate staff and to apply skills and techniques to solve dynamic problems Excellent verbal and written communication skills; expertise in setting and managing user expectations Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills at all levels Ability to coach, motivate and develop others Strong problem-solving skills, and can shift readily between the “big picture” and the small-but- Crucial details, knowing when to concentrate on each Self-motivated Detailed oriented, organised with strong time management skills Proficient in MS Office applications, MS Project, VISIO, and Project Management Tools Setting Directions Leading and Engaging Teams Driving Business Performance and Change Developing and Recognising Others Cathay Pacific is an Equal Opportunities Employer. Personal data provided by job applicants will be used strictly in accordance with our personal data policy and for recruitment purposes
 only. Candidates not notified within eight weeks may consider their application unsuccessful. All related information will be kept in our file for up to 24 months. A copy of our Personal Information Collection Statement will be provided upon request by contacting
 our Data Protection Officer. title: Senior Executive - Risk Management
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Senior Executive - Risk Management Mercedes-Benz Hong Kong Limited Wan Chai Salary provided Posted on 03 Apr 2019 Senior Executive - Risk Management Mercedes-Benz Hong Kong Limited Job Highlights Job Description RESPONSIBILITIES Involve in the implementation of Risk Management project, monitor & facilitate the progress of interviews with risk owners/ business units, coordinate Risk Management Survey and conduct analysis with risk
 owners. Continuously direct process owners to update business processes to ensure the process flows can truly reflect MBHK daily operations. Involve in the implementation of Internal Control System (“ICS”) in MBHK, review the control designs prepared by the departments, and monitor the annual self-assessment with departments. Involve in daily compliance consultation work. Involve in Policy and Guideline Coordination, provide consultations to guideline owners and ensure the guidelines are consistent with business processes, and fulfilled the Headquarters’ requirements. Conduct research and prepare newsletters on the Anti-money laundering and Personal data privacy topics. Coordinate and smooth cross- functional communication among different departments to set up or update control designs, and key business processes. Assist in preparing risk management reports and compliance related reports periodically for management review. Discuss & implement other compliance & risk management projects, report projects progress, decisions and activities to supervisor. Handle the compliance and risk management administrative and documentation & archiving works.   REQUIREMENTS Bachelor of Accounting or Business Administration or Law  or  Degree in Business (Economics) Experience/law 2-3 years working experience, preferably in business accounting/ finance/ risk management related discipline
 Working experience in consulting firm, accounting firm, auditing firm or automotive industrial working experience will be a big plus Strong Communication and project management skill Possess good presentation, negotiation & teamwork skills
 Possess good business & intercultural sense Dynamic and pro-active personality Good analytical skills Proficient in Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, and PowerPoint Proficient in Microsoft Visio (Preferred)

title: Director Global CRM and Customer Lifecycle Marketing - DFS9112564
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Director Global CRM and Customer Lifecycle Marketing - DFS9112564 DFS Hong Kong Limited Tsim Sha Tsui Salary provided Posted on 03 Apr 2019 Director Global CRM and Customer Lifecycle Marketing - DFS9112564 DFS Hong Kong Limited Job Highlights Job Description Job Summary: This position is responsible for developing and executing the global strategic vision for CRM and customer lifecycle marketing programs. The candidate will manage
 DFS’ customer acquisition, retention and customer journey mapping initiatives. He/she will be the Sales Force product owner and will lead the CRM product roadmap, partnering with IT to develop the platform. This position will also work with the analytics to
 lead all test-and-learn efforts to drive ROI and to increase customer lifetime value. This leader will represent the voice of the customer and works closely with all internal teams (marketing, merchandising, creative, finance, operations, learning and development),
 as well as external vendors, to develop the appropriate multichannel strategies and programs to drive revenue via actionable customer insights. A successful candidate will have strong retail, e-commerce or travel industry experience, with a deep understanding
 of the customer experience and CRM. He/she will also have a penchant for digital creative and analytics. Key Responsibilities: Strategy & product roadmap:
 Develop and gain approval of the strategic plan for customer relationship marketing, database marketing and customer research. Ensure integration into corporate strategy
 and objectives.  Be a CRM subject-matter expert on customer data, data architecture and new ways of executing CRM programs to achieve a 360 customer view.
 Define, develop, and oversee CRM strategy and large scale programs within the context of DFS’ online and offline sales and marketing objectives to build profitable,
 long-term customer relationships that drive customer retention and incremental sales to the brand.
 Ownership & management of program budgets and achievement of customer revenue targets.
 Partner with IT to develop and implement a CRM product road map suited to support the needs of the business regarding data/address hygiene, campaign management, database
 analytics, business intelligence and other appropriate applications.  Lifecycle Marketing:
 Develop and implement programs for customer on-boarding, lifecycle management, referral and win back initiatives.
 Work with creative team to manage CRM program creative, including copy, production and campaign implementation, within agreed budgets and timing
 Manage execution of all 360 customer communications (emails, direct mail, SMS, WeChat, etc.) for all markets.
 Establish industry-leading customer relationship marketing programs utilizing a test and learn methodology to implement traditional and non-traditional methods of
 engaging and retaining customers.  Own and manage customer communications calendar.
 Maximize engagement and ROI on all CRM initiatives by identifying key audience segments, look-alike models, message frequency, personalization tactics, etc. and lead
 reporting to inform the development of the lifecycle programs.  Work across regions to identify and share best practices resulting in global roadmaps for acquisition, retention, and Loyalty.
 CRM Analytics:
 Analyze customer data, create behavioral reporting, establish and measure global customer retention & loyalty goals, manage program performance, and create actionable
 and strategic plans to support marketing decisions.  Identify customer lifecycles, calculate LTV and develop key customer segments.
 Partner closely with analytics and data science teams, providing direction to customer analytics team inclusive of establishing analytics roadmap, writing analytics
 briefs, and aligning on methodology and approach to measurement of customer lifetime value.
 Continuously review and recommend opportunities to enhance the quality and accuracy of the customer database. Lead the development of database marketing analytics,
 such as statistical modeling, customer profiling, segmentation analysis, and other analytical techniques to improve customer insights, retention and loyalty. Key Requirements: At least 10 years direct experience in CRM. Minimum of 2 years at the Director level in CRM. Solid understanding of retail or e-commerce business a big plus.
 Experience must include a combination of CRM/Database, Marketing, and Market Analysis, and a blend of proven strategic and tactical capabilities.
 Strong experience and familiarity with Salesforce systems.
 Good understanding and experience with audience segmentation, outlining customer journeys and omnichannel activation.
 Must be analytical and laser focused on driving ROI And KPI tracking but also creative.
 Experience in a global role preferred, with exposure to Asian markets.
 Strong leadership and coaching skills to build, and develop a high-performing team.
 Proven ability to manage external suppliers and partners and ensure top value and performance for organization.
 Creative, analytical and thoughtful thinker – open to testing new ideas and work towards validating results. Additional Information Career Level Senior Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 10 years Employment Type Full Time Benefits Five-day work week, Life insurance, Medical insurance Company details DFS Group Limited is the world's leading luxury retailer catering to the traveling public. We have attained this position by listening to our clientele, adapting to changes in our customer base, and continually responding with innovative concepts.   Our strength lies in our strategic brand partnerships, groundbreaking store and product development, superior assortments, and targeted marketing programs.   As we continue to perfect our business model, improve our offerings and expand into emerging markets, we are well positioned to remain the world's leading luxury retailer. Technology innovation will be part

 technologies but also the more traditional enterprise technology stack in order to line up the old systems with the edgy new technologies.  Responsibilities:

title: Infrastructure Investment Associate
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Infrastructure Investment Associate China Ping An Insurance Overseas (Holdings) Limited Central Salary negotiable Posted on 03 Apr 2019 Infrastructure Investment Associate China Ping An Insurance Overseas (Holdings) Limited Job Highlights Job Description Screen and evaluate infrastructure project and fund investment opportunities, including industry and company investment research, financial modeling, valuation and preparation
 of investment proposals for the Investment Management Committees Liaise with external and internal stakeholders to obtain internal approvals Coordinate and liaise due diligence, documentation and closing processes, ensuring
 compliance with Group’s policies and priorities Support and assist Deal Team
 Leader to negotiate transaction terms Post-closing
 investment monitoring Job Requirements: Minimum: 4-6 years in a one or several roles, covering M&A, Corporate Finance, PE, Fund-of-fund / LP direct and/or co-investments, in reputable Investment Banks, Financial
 Institutions, Accounting Firms (e.g. Big 4 valuation team) or Management Consulting Firms; Industry and/or transaction expertise in the Energy, Power & Utilities, Transportation and/or TMT sectors would be preferred Good analytical skills as applied to common problems in infrastructure investment Candidates with accounting qualification,
 CFA designation, SFC licenses holder for Type 4 and 9 regulated activities, and/or who possess other advanced finance / professional qualifications would be preferred.
 Advanced
 analytical ,  modeling and accounting skills. Attention to detail. Strong oral and written communication skills in English and Chinese (Mandarin). We offer competitive remuneration package and comprehensive fringe benefits  including  medical and life insurance, and different types of
 allowances to the right candidates. Interested parties, please submit your application by clicking “Apply Now”.   Data collected would be used for recruitment purposes only and will be used strictly in accordance with company’s personal data policies, a copy of which may
 be obtained by the applicant upon request. The personal data of unsuccessful job applicants will be destroyed within 24 months of receipt. Additional Information Career Level Entry Level Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 4 years Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Dental insurance, Five-day work week, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus Company details 中国平安保险海外（控股）有限公司（以下简称“海外控股”）于 1996 年 10 月 24 日在中国香港特别行政区成立，由中国平安保险（集团）有限公司 ( 以下简称“平安集团” ) 全资控股的直属子公司，注册地址位于香港中环金融街 8 号国际金融中心 2 期 23 楼 2318 室。   海外控股及其下属公司是平安集团的海外投资及资产管理业务平台，是平安集团境外唯一的直属投资和融资平台。海外控股及其下属公司为境内外机构提供各类海外投资产品、资产管理及咨询服务。其投资服务范围覆盖到私募股权投资、基础建设投资、地产投资、私募债投资等另类市场投资以及港股、全球、 ETF 、定制化策略、固定收益等资产市场的多个领域，同时公司及其子公司搭建强大的投资研究和组合管理能力，致力于为客户提供一揽子的服务和解决方案。  
   China Ping An Insurance Overseas (Holdings) Limited (“PAOH”),
 established in  the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region of the People's Republic of China  on October 24, 1996, is a direct wholly-owned subsidiary of Ping An Insurance (Group)
 Company of China, Ltd.  （“ Ping An Group” ） . The registered
 office of PAOH is located at Suite 2318, 23  Floor, Two International Finance Centre, 8 Finance Street, Central, Hong Kong.
   PAOH, together with all of its subsidiaries, operates the overseas investment management business of Ping An Group,  and is the exclusive overseas
 platform for direct investments and financing of Ping An Group.  It provides a diverse range of overseas investment products, asset management services and consulting services to institutional investors at home and abroad. It offers a wide variety of alternative
 investment services such as private equity, infrastructures, real estates and private credit assets, etc.; and also capital markets investment services in  Hong Kong and overseas stocks, ETF, customized investment strategies, and fixed income investments,
 etc. PAOH, together with all of its subsidiaries, has built up strong capabilities for offshore investment research and portfolio management, and always provides customers with more diversified financial products and comprehensive value-added services.     More Jobs from this employer Intern - Administration (Focus on Corporate Communication) Posted on  08-Apr-19 Intern - Administration Posted on  08-Apr-19 Intern for PE Department Posted on  26-Mar-19 View all jobs from this employer About JobsDB About jobsDB FAQ Career @ jobsDB Contact us Contact us International partners Bdjobs (Bandladesh) Brighter Monday (East Africa) Catho (Brazil) Jobberman (West Africa) JobStreet (S.E. title: Regional Supply Planner (12 month contract) - FMCG, Skin care, 3PL
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Regional Supply Planner (12 month contract) - FMCG, Skin care, 3PL Clorox Hong Kong Ltd North Point Salary provided Posted on 04 Apr 2019 Regional Supply Planner (12 month contract) - FMCG, Skin care, 3PL Clorox Hong Kong Ltd Job Highlights Job Description Supply planner   Position summary.  Manage locally held inventory to ensure cost targets are met whilst maximizing availability of product to the region and local trade. Take full ownership for ordering of stock from the USA and ensuring freight lead-times and costs are adhered to. Manage the day to day relationship with the 3PL, monitor rework requirements and costs.   Make your mark. At Clorox, we build big brands that make everyday life better, every day. We value our differences, and challenge each other to think and act boldly. We try new things, succeed, fail and keep learning. We work hard, and have busy personal lives. And we’re all able to make a positive impact – at Clorox, in our communities, and in the lives of millions of people who invite us into their homes. Make your mark and help us drive Good Growth – growth that is profitable, sustainable and responsible.   Key responsibilities: Provide the Replenishment Forecast Plan to US  Create  purchase order in system, and  monitor monthly stock orders with US  / Vendors to  ensure customer service level is maximized by having the correct inventory levels. Share the Weekly inventory report and  increase the information transparency on order stat u s Monitor the supply status of NPD and projects (such as Project Williams) R eport the potential / OOS situations regularly  to Sales and  Marketing ,  and Customer  Service Operations Take ownership of stock management within NetSuite to include: o     All product Set up o     Creating purchase orders and work orders o     Kit building and stock transfers  (QA purposes)   Provide  data  input  in system on p ricing calculations on local kit builds and gift sets. Oversee all  copack activities  by 3PL to ensure quality and costs are in line with expectations. Lead monthly  Supply Alignment Meeting  with Sales/Marketing/PSO/Finance to review residuals list and create action plan to clear Full engagement in S&OP process to provide input on potential supply issues. Monitor stock orders from US vs invoice vs physical receipt and report on same. Monitor supply chain performance on 1) DOS 2) Ageing, Products Freshness 3) Obsolescence cost, 3) replenishment order fill rate and delivery timings.  Closely monitor all SKU changeovers to ensure business is kept up to date on timings/requirements. Work closely with the Demand Planner to understand forecast build and create monthly Demand Plan for Burt’s Bees USA. Work closely with Category Development Units to improve communication and processes on inbound stock availability and information flow.   Minimum Qualifications:   Years and Type of Experience:  3-5yrs supply planning experience in a FMCG environment. Understanding and experience of wider supply chain processes Knowledge of Sales and Operational Planning   Skills and Abilities  o     Exposure to ERP System and any other Supply Planning systems, preferred. o     Good knowledge of production environment, constraints and processes. Ability to drive continuous improvement through recommendations for process change and generally challenging the status quo o     Exceptionally organized with ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously o     Excellent problem solving ability and demonstrated ability to take ownership of issues and ensure timely resolution o     Excellent analytical skills with attention to detail and advanced knowledge of Excel, including building and maintaining complex formulas o     Strong interpersonal skills including ability to liaise and interface with a variety of individuals both within and outside the company o     Excellent written and verbal communication skills o     Ability to work in a fast paced environment and balance priorities   Education Level/Degree: Degree or equivalent level of educational attainment preferred   More about Customer Service & Logistics We provide excellent service to Clorox’s retail customers while maximizing savings for the company. As a member of our Customer Service & Logistics team, you’ll drive top-line growth and help control costs in areas such as customer support, distribution center operations, transportation and field-based supply chain contacts for customers.   More about Clorox  The Clorox Company (NYSE: CLX)  is a leading multinational manufacturer and marketer of consumer and professional products with approximately 8,700 employees worldwide and fiscal year 2018 sales of $6.1 billion. Clorox markets some of the most trusted and recognized consumer  brand names, including its namesake bleach and cleaning products;  Pine-Sol  cleaners;  Liquid Plumr  clog removers;  Poett  home care products;  Fresh Step  cat litter;  Glad  bags, wraps and containers;  Kingsford  charcoal;  Hidden Valley  dressings and sauces;  Brita  water-filtration products;  Burt's Bees  natural personal care products;  RenewLife  digestive health products; and  Rainbow Light , Natural Vitality  and Neocell  dietary supplements. The company also markets brands for professional services, including Clorox Healthcare  and Clorox Commercial Solutions .  More than 80 percent of the company's sales are generated from brands that hold the No. 1 or No. 2 market share positions in their categories.   More about Hong Kong Clorox Hong Kong was founded in 1986.   Hong Kong is part of the Greater China operation and has an integrated team of 40 employees.  Our iconic brands are Glad ® , Burt's Bees ® , Clorox ® , Greenworks ® , Tilex ® , Kingsford ®  and many others that you can find at retail chain stores, supermarkets, hyper supermarkets and drugstores. You can visit our website at:    Making a positive impact. Clorox is a signatory of the United Nations Global Compact, a community of global leaders committed to sustainability. We’ve been broadly recognized for our corporate responsibility efforts, most notably being  named to the Drucker Institute's 2018 Management Top 250 list, The Just 100: America's Top Corporate Citizens list, CR Magazine's 2018 Best Corporate Citizens list. We are featured in the list of top 100 companies in the Inaugural Bloomberg Gender Equality Index in 2018 and ranked #47 on the Glassdoor 2019 Best Places to Work List for Large Companies. We also support our communities, and, in FY2018, contributed approx. $20 million in combined cash grants, product donations and cause marketing. The Clorox Company and its subsidiaries is an EEO/AA/Protected Veteran/Disabled/LGBT employer. Additional Information Career Level Entry Level Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 3 years Employment Type Contract Benefits Five-day work week Company details    is an   multinational company with market leading and iconic brands such as  ,   and  . Across the world, we pride ourselves on the dedicated, values-driven people, who make up our company. Our mission is to make everyday life better, every day, for our consumers, through our brands and employees. We manufacture products in more than two dozen countries and market them in more than 100 countries.  and entertainment services. HKBN owns an extensive fibre network in Hong Kong, which covers over 2.1 million residential homes passed, representing approximately 79% of Hong Kong’s total residential units, and more than 2,200 commercial buildings. HKBN takes
 great pride in developing its 2,900 plus Talents into a competitive advantage .  on the Main Board of The Stock Exchange of Hong Kong in December 2011. Founded in 1929, the Group's iconic brand "CHOW TAI FOOK" has been widely recognised for its trustworthiness and authenticity, and
 is renowned for its product design, quality and value. The success of the Group and its iconic brand is rooted in innovation, craftsmanship and heritage. The Group also holds other jewellery brands including T MARK, HEARTS ON FIRE, MONOLOGUE and SOINLOVE,

 in the business, in people and in culture. Another asset underpinning sustainable growth is a sophisticated vertically integrated business model. This supports the Group by fostering excellence and extending opportunities along the entire value chain to communities

 business, the Group is implementing effective online-to-offline ("O2O") strategies to succeed in today's omni-channel retail environment. title: Manager, Finance Systems, Financial Management
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Manager, Finance Systems, Financial Management KPMG Central Salary provided Posted on 04 Apr 2019 Manager, Finance Systems, Financial Management KPMG Job Highlights Job Description In Management Consulting, you’ll join a large and rapidly growing team, contributing to a range of projects that help clients address some of the biggest issues they’re facing in the boardroom. By helping them to add lasting value to the bottom line and make huge improvements in their performance, you’ll support them in transforming the way they do business. Our approach involves both strategy and implementation, which means we’re not just thinkers, but practical doers, creating client strategies that are designed to work in the real world. In Financial Management, we improve the effectiveness and efficiency of the finance function and generate real insights to help deliver value to the business. As digital disruption affects more industry sectors, Chief Financial Officers (CFOs) find it increasingly challenging to deliver sustainable growth in profits and dividends, whilst managing costs. Join this team and we can ensure you’re equipped to support and advise CFOs in this constantly changing world by training you in at least one of these capabilities: - How to develop a company’s finance strategy - Process improvement, including what good looks like for each of the key finance processes - Implementing systems changes specifically in cloud-based technology solutions, using our powered solution - Implementing process enhancement through digital and robotic technologies  - Organisational change and specifically designing and implementing a shared service centre - Regulatory changes Armed with these skills and supported to continue developing your expertise, you’ll help our Finance Transformation teams in these areas: -   – enabling finance to add more value to the business by improving processes such as business planning, forecasting and the provision of regular management information  -   – enabling finance to deliver these services quicker, cheaper and with better controls  -   – Facilitate the strategy, vendor selection, implementation and post implementation in areas of business process, security and data -   - Supporting the client through process design validation, configuration and testing in the implementation and enable them to optimise their processes and maximise the benefits of the selected system We are looking for a   with prior experience as Project Manager/Senior Project Team Members in the area of   (e.g. Oracle, SAP, Tagetik or similar solutions). Candidates with either experience in the commercial sector or a professional service firm will be considered. The individual will have: - Experience working in a Big 4 professional firm or a large corporation - Excellent knowledge of finance systems, emerging technologies and digital solutions - Previous implementation experience, working as part of a development and implementation team  - Strong people manager, able to lead large teams and develop others  - Self-starting, pro-active team player that is experienced in working in challenging environments and within a multi-disciplined team  - Ability to liaise with senior Finance stakeholders  - Ability to create and deliver high level presentations and output reviews to senior executives/stakeholders and business managers  - Experience in performing business development  - Ability to review and challenge information that has been provided by other team members, ensuring the information is 'fit for purpose' and at the right level of granularity  - Ability to perform structured analysis on business models to provide best practice knowledge  - Strong written and verbal communication skills in English - Cantonese speaking candidates are preferred We offer successful candidates an attractive remuneration package and the opportunity to work in a dynamic and exciting environment. Personal data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only. © 2018 KPMG, a Hong Kong partnership and a member firm of the KPMG network of independent member firms affiliated with KPMG International Cooperative ("KPMG International"), a Swiss entity. All rights reserved. Additional Information Career Level Middle Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience Not Specified Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Company Website Company details KPMG China operates in 19 cities across China, with around 12,000 partners and staff in Beijing, Beijing Zhongguancun, Changsha, Chengdu, Chongqing, Foshan, Fuzhou, Guangzhou, Hangzhou, Nanjing, Qingdao, Shanghai, Shenyang, Shenzhen, Tianjin, Wuhan, Xiamen, Xi'an, Hong Kong SAR and Macau SAR.   KPMG is a global network of professional services firms providing Audit, Tax and Advisory services. We operate in 154 countries and territories, and have 200,000 people working in member firms around the world. description:
