Limited Wan Chai Salary provided Posted on 04 Apr 2019 Key Account Manager REA Hong Kong Management Co. Limited Job Highlights Job Description A growing digital media business Start-up pace, big business scale Work with passion and purpose We’re Squarefoot.com.hk, part of REA Group 
  is a multimedia real estate platform for real estate agents and property developers. One of the most important bilingual real estate media on the market, we help local and foreigners
 learn more about real estate in Hong Kong and overseas.   What we're doing Agent sales team work together with the belief that nothing's out of our reach. We actively manage, up-sell and retain the Agent customer base by developing long-term and enduring relationships
 with existing customers (Agent). Source new customers (Agent) to increase our market share. Primary purpose of the position Nurture the key customer base, ensuring they continually see the value of REA products Take the time to understand your customers - where they operate, what areas they specialize in, what is their market objectives Establish and execute a quarterly key account plan including coverage objectives Achieve revenue targets within defined territory, by identifying new opportunities including new sign-ups, as well as taking advantage of opportunities provided by analytics Monitor listing usage and that adequate number of listings are on our site in comparison to customer and competitor websites Identify and explore opportunities with existing cliente by selling total solutions (including listing, digital and print advertising and bespoke packages) to achieve revenue targets Identify gap fill initiatives to ensure target achievement Develop a systematic approach to the education and training within key franchises Accept responsibility and attend customers’ needs in a timely manner Actively promote the use of Squarefoot services, tools and resources across the key customer base Ensure relevant performance data and analysis reporting is delivered to customers in a timely and convenient manner Share insights learned from corporate relationships to HOS and agent sales team on regular basis Develop standard key messages for BDM’s to adopt, providing new and update information to their customers Work with Database Coordinator to keep a master list of corporate franchises contacts Who we're looking for Higher Diploma / Associate Degree or above At least 5 years of experience in a corporate sales environment Sales experience in out-bound sales environment, field sales, face-to-face selling, online marketing and account management Computer Skills- MS Office Strong communications and presentation skills Passionate about the industry we serve Result-driven Good in English and Chinese (Mandarin and Cantonese) The REA experience Our people are our greatest asset. Without them, we would not be the successful business that we are today. That's why we offer a range of benefits to ensure we hire and retain great staff.
 We offer: An annual reward and recognition program for staff who are kicking goals throughout the year An environment that truly encompasses an agile way of working. You can sit where you want – at a desk, in our break out areas, even on a couch! Enjoy a game of table tennis or music? Work From Home policy that provides our staff a flexibility to occasionally work from home for business or personal reasons By submitting personal information to REA Hong Kong Management Co. Limited (“REA”) in relation to an employment opportunity, you accept REA’s
  and agree to the collection, use, disclosure, storage, processing and handling of your personal information in accordance with REA’s Privacy Policy. Additional Information Career Level Middle Qualification Non-Degree Tertiary Industry Job Function Years of Experience 5 years Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Dental insurance, Five-day work week, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus, Work from home Company Website Company details  ( ) REA Group Limited ACN 068 349 066 (ASX:REA) (“REA Group”) is a multinational digital advertising business specialising in
 property. REA Group operates Australia’s leading residential and commercial property websites, realestate.com.au and realcommercial.com.au, Chinese property site myfun.com and a number of property portals in Asia via its ownership of iProperty Group. REA Group
 owns Smartline Home Loans Pty Ltd, an Australian mortgage broking franchise group, and Hometrack Australia Pty Ltd, a leading provider of data property services. REA Group also holds a significant shareholding in property websites Move, Inc in the US and PropTiger
 in India.   Within Hong Kong, REA Group Asia operates GoHome.com.hk, squarefoot.com.hk and SMART Expo. The brands aim to provide consumers
 with extensive local and overseas property news, listings and investment opportunities while offering property and home-related advertisers with a one-stop, multi-platform solution. title: Director Client Development, Hong Kong
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Director Client Development, Hong Kong Resources Global Professionals (HK) Limited Central Salary provided Posted on 04 Apr 2019 Director Client Development, Hong Kong Resources Global Professionals (HK) Limited Job Highlights Job Description RGP is a global consulting firm helping some of the most recognized companies in the world work differently. Our success comes from a shared belief in
 rolling up our sleeves and doing the hard work of solving complex challenges, executing plans and implementing technology to help transform organizations. Working for RGP, you will be connected to work that matters, putting your expertise to its best use while developing skills for the future. The result
 is a career defined by you, supported by RGP and built on tangible accomplishments. As we continue to grow and deepen our impact on organizations around the world, we are looking for the right people to join us on our mission. If you are
 interested in being part of our team, there are a few things you should know: We are energized by challenges and the effort needed to solve them. We like working with people who are positive, adaptable and growth-minded. We care how work gets accomplished and are deeply invested in the success of our clients and our colleagues. If this sounds like you, we invite you to read on and learn more. 
 Whether you desire to work directly with clients or support those who do, RGP connects you to meaningful opportunities designed to put your talents to
 their best and highest use, and help you develop skills for today and tomorrow. As an RGP employee, you are a champion for your team, driven to develop their functional acumen in a manner that is transformative and valuable. You help guide people and organizations
 to be and become more than they thought possible and have the ultimate service mentality based on openness, understanding and teamwork. RGP partners with business leaders to solve problems, implement initiatives, drive change and transfer knowledge. We are proven problem solvers who start
 adding value as soon as we begin an engagement in Finance & Accounting, Human Capital Management, Information Management, Legal, Risk & Compliance and Supply Chain. Our professionals have the talent and enthusiasm to exceed expectations in many of the world’s
 largest businesses.  Devise and implement business plans to penetrate new markets, build new portfolios with clear target and sales strategy Drive revenue and profit targets consistently to achieve company growth Lead generation, prospecting, qualifying and closing of business by connecting client's decision makers across disciplines, managing a portfolio of top-tier
 prospects Keep abreast of market change and industry trend to identify new business opportunity, and propose RGP solutions for such target sectors Assist client through a process of understanding their requirements, defining a solution, creating a compelling proposition and responsible for negotiating
 commercials and closing the deal Partner with Solutions and Talent teams throughout the sales process to accelerate the sales cycle and effectively increase new business wins Collaborate with regional practice leaders to drive revenue growth and market penetration Drive partnership and collaboration with key vendors Develop effective negotiation strategy on pricing and contractual terms like Statements of Work and Master Service Agreements to maximize profit   Maintain accurate sales data and activities for big data analytics in sales forecasting   Degree holder with a minimum of 10 years solutions selling experience preferably in the Professional Services sector Extensive commercial experience and a demonstrable track record of achieving targets in solutions sales Knowledgeable in overall information management/project management solutions and functions Ability to communicate effectively with client up to C-suite Able to work effectively with subject matter experts in defining the right proposition for a specific client's needs Able to manage the entire deal lifecycle from inception to delivery start and commercial close Proven experience of working in a highly customer and business focused environment Understanding of commercial and risk management in a solution environment Able to manage sales campaigns, and engaging, building and maintaining relationships at a senior level The position offers an attractive compensation including base salary, year-end bonus, options and a full range of benefits. Data received will be for recruiting
 purpose only. EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER 
 RGP is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
 
 Additional Information Career Level Senior Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 10 years Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Five-day work week, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus Company Website Company details     www.rgp.com  is a
 US  consultant firm with  a Big 4 heritage , listed on NASDAQ, and named one of the Most Trustworthy Companies by Forbes. RGP has 3,000 consultants
 in 70 countries  serving 1,800  clients which include 87 of Fortune 100, half of Fortune 500, and over half of Fortune 1000. We have 100% retention of the top 50 clients year after year. RGP provides advisory, project
 and interim solutions to clients in most business areas.   Applications can be submitted to      More Jobs from this employer Payroll & Workday HRIS Specialist - Contract for 3 to 6 Months Posted on  11-Apr-19 Operations Consultant, Life Insurance - Project for 6-12 months, Extendable Posted on  11-Apr-19 Team Lead, IT Development - Extendable Project Posted on  11-Apr-19 View all jobs from this employer About JobsDB About jobsDB FAQ Career @ jobsDB Contact us Contact us International partners Bdjobs (Bandladesh) Brighter Monday (East Africa) Catho (Brazil) Jobberman (West Africa) JobStreet (S.E. title: Senior Manager - Internal Audit
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Senior Manager - Internal Audit Aon Services Hong Kong Limited 怡安服務香港有限公司 Causeway Bay Salary negotiable Posted on 04 Apr 2019 Senior Manager - Internal Audit Aon Services Hong Kong Limited 怡安服務香港有限公司 Job Highlights Job Description The Roles: Managing and overseeing the completion of audit projects (e.g., core assurance audits, Sarbanes Oxley 302 & 404 compliance activities, special investigations, ad-hoc projects, etc.) within assigned region/responsibility and ensures support provided by other audit teams is coordinated and covers the appropriate risk Assisting the Internal Audit Directors in assessing key business risks and controls and in developing risk based audit plans, which are responsive to audit priorities and emerging risk activities Evaluating the adequacy of the internal control environment within select company business operations. Communicating audit findings and recommendations to improve the overall effectiveness of the company’s internal controls to business unit management. The Audit Senior Manager is also primarily responsible for the overall assessment of audit findings and positioning of audit reports and other communications related to the condition/adequacy of the company’s control environment Providing leadership and guidance to managers and staff, fostering an environment that encourages participation, teamwork and communication. Providing the necessary supervision, coaching and training as well as regular performance feedback Providing a first or second level review and approval of work paper documentation to ensure the retained documentation supports the audit work performed and satisfies audit objectives Managing and overseeing the status of management corrective action plans to ensure that significant process and control issues have been remediated and updating key stakeholders and senior leadership. The Audit Senior Manager is also responsible for providing insights to the updating of the various management reports sent to executive management and the Audit Committee regarding the status of open control matters As required, building relationships with the external auditors throughout their interim and annual reviews of the company As assigned, assisting the Internal Audit leadership team on department/corporate-wide initiatives and ad-hoc special projects, as well as supporting other audit offices Developing a strong knowledge base and level of expertise in the operations of assigned lines of business or functional areas As a global resource, participating in audit assignments as required in any location   Our Requirements: Degree holder in Accounting, Finance or related disciplines with recognized accounting or auditing professional qualifications (e.g. CPA/ Chartered Accountant/ Certified Internal Auditor) preferred Minimum 10 years audit experience gained from Big Four and/ or multi-national corporations, financial institutions, including 4-6 years of audit manager experience.  Experience in the insurance brokerage, the reinsurance and the consulting industry preferred Excellent knowledge of internal auditing standards and techniques as well as accounting methods, principles and practices Proven supervisory and leadership skills in being flexible, creative, team-oriented and results-driven.   We offer attractive remuneration and fringe benefits. Interested parties please send your full resume with current salary and expected salary by clicking   to submit your application, or   for interview. All applications will be treated in strict confidence and data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only.  Only selected candidates will be contacted for interview. Additional Information Career Level Senior Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 10 years Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Dental insurance, Double pay, Five-day work week, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus Company details Aon plc  (NYSE: AON) is the leading global provider of risk management, insurance and reinsurance brokerage, and human resources solutions and outsourcing services. Through its more than 72,000 colleagues worldwide, Aon unites to empower results for clients in over 120 countries via innovative and effective risk and people solutions and through industry-leading global resources and technical expertise. Aon has been named repeatedly as the world's best broker, best insurance intermediary, reinsurance intermediary, captives manager and best employee benefits consulting firm by multiple industry sources. You can learn more about Aon plc (NYSE:AON) at aon.com and explore more about our partnership with Manchester United at  . Geospatial Solution Limited Aberdeen Salary negotiable Posted on 05 Apr 2019 3D GIS Technology Researcher Ambit Geospatial Solution Limited Job Highlights Job Description Job Duties: Report to the Senior GIS Manager and work with GIS development team Carry out global market research on 3D GIS industry trend Review market demand and turnover business amount of 3D GIS in Smart City applications Compile progress report on annual study of industry development in term of synergy of geomatic engineering with new city big data technology Support R&D of new 3D spatial data acquisition technologies User requirement analysis on the popularity of 3D GIS in related to digital photogrammetry technologies   Qualification Requirements: Degree holder in geomatic or related disciplines Preferably at least 1 year related working experience in GIS industry Self-motivated and independent Good English written skill in compiling powerpoint presentation and document writing Occasional commuting between our Hong Kong and overseas is required Immediate available Fluent in Mandarin is an advantage Experience in using GIS spatial database technology for enterprise GIS application is preferred   Additional Information Career Level Entry Level Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 1 year Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Five-day work week, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus Company details   AMBIT is the major City Big Data provider in Hong Kong, we captured intelligent geographic information and its attribute throughout the city by automatic approach. We deliver total solution ranging from acquisition, post processing, analysis as well as dissemination of City Big Data to corporate users. High resolution city data are collected seamlessly through aerial and terrestrial systems developed by our patented technologies. Our professional data collection media including drone, large scale aerial camera and vehicle/backpack mobile mapping system (MMS). Using our expertise in 3D geographic information system (GIS), we developed series of smart city applications ride on our City Big Data infrastructure. Over decade our team worked together with various engineering disciplines using innovative geospatial technologies to resolve project challenges both in Hong Kong and internationally. Our technology generates strategic information with multiple perspectives that helps risk management and progress monitoring during national development. Our smart city solution serves wide range of industry in agricultural, environmental, survey mapping, car autonomous driving, urban planning as well as construction applications; where high resolution accurate data is the key ( www.ambit-geospatial.com.hk ). Ambit is the sole distributor of the world leading 3D GIS software – Skyline ( www.skylinesoft.com )  and the best digital photogrammetry camera manufacturer – Vexcel ( www.vexcel-imaging.com ).  and distribution businesses, Lane Crawford, Joyce, Pedder Group and ImagineX. The Group is Asia’s pre-eminent luxury lifestyle Group, with more than 450 points of sale and 1.5 million active luxury customers across Greater China and online. Its
 companies are internationally recognized as benchmarks for retail innovation and creativity. Beta Labs aims to support the paradigm shift in retail by driving business insights through data solutions. We are looking for data scientists, engineers, and digital
 domain experts to join us to explore the potential value and possibilities to innovate personalization and customer experience. You will have access to our assets and analyse on top of Hadoop and Spark. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment, possess an entrepreneurial spirit and are passionate about data analysis with a focus on the end user, we’d like to hear from
 you. WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING? Design, build, support and optimize new and existing data models and ETL processes Develop and support the data pipeline to integrate new data from various data sources with emerging data technologies Define and manage SLA for all data processes and own data quality issues Getting “first-hand” break to engineer data analytics platform which will include architectural design, infrastructure setup, and building data pipelines, integrate with
 data lakes and integrating data mining models into data pipelines Understand, brain-storm and integrate data from different internal as well as external platforms (including mobile event streams) to deliver data insights
 
 YOU NEED TO BE... Bachelor's degree in computer science and information technology 3 years hands-on experience in Redis, RMDB, NoSQL and query performance tuning 2 years hands-on experience in building data model for visualizations 2 years development experience in at least one scripting language (Python is preferred) Hands-on experience in big data management platform implementation like Informatica and Talend Hands-on experience of integrating big data technologies like Hive, Presto, Spark, Kafka, Hbase and Apache Ignite into traditional systems Data architecture, data modelling, schema and ETL/ ELT workflow design skills Excellent communication skills and proven experience in leading data driven projects from definition through interpretation and execution Candidate with more experience will be considered as Senior Data Engineer   WE OFFER YOU…   Annual Leave & Birthday Leave Public Holidays 5-day Marriage Leave Medical Insurance Dental Care Professional Corporate Training Annual Performance Bonus Free Shuttle Bus Staff Purchase Discount Interested parties please click "Apply Now" and  send

AIA International Limited AIA Group Limited and its subsidiaries (collectively “AIA" or “the Group") comprise the largest independent publicly listed pan-Asian life insurance group. It has operations in 16 markets in Asia-Pacific

The Group also provides employee benefits, credit life and pension services to corporate clients. Through an extensive network of agents and employees across Asia-Pacific, AIA serves the holders

A multinational electronic recycling company is looking for a Finance Manager in HongKong. With great strategic plan from the headquarter in Shanghai, the business in mainland China is tripled in the last couple of years. Meanwhile, the business is expanding
 into international market since 2018. HongKong is the centralized hub for the APEC region. 
 
 
As a key person, you will be directly reporting into the Finance Head based in Shanghai, with dotted line to Overseas Market Business Head in HongKong. The successful hire will manage and provide guidance to the finance team, understand the business model,
 and provide insightful analysis, forecasting, design and execute internal controls, comply with local tax policy, review monthly financial account, provide business decision support through proactive interaction with all site functions.
 
 
 
The ideal candidate will be from an international company with solid experience in financial analysis and costing. The candidate will also have strong knowledge in local regulation and tax policy. 
• Strong knowledge in financial & management accounting, IFRS, local tax policy  
• Familiar with cash management 
• Solid in costing analyst 
• Deep understanding in internal control and its implementation effectiveness in a commercial environment 
• Excellent skills in Excel 
• Fluent level in English and Mandarin. 
• Self-driven  
• Independent problem solving  
• Strong communicator  
• Be able to work under pressure and fast pace environment  
• Big four plus industry work experiences are preferred Additional Information Career Level Senior Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 6 years Employment Type Full Time Benefits Dental insurance, Five-day work week, Flexible working hours, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus, Travel allowance Company details Aihuishou Global Co., Limited was found in 2010, as a parent company of Shanghai YueYi Network Information technology Ltd.. Assist in preparation, development and exercise of the cyber incident response plan, incident response playbooks, and table-top exercises. title: Cyber Security Operations Manager
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Cyber Security Operations Manager A.S. Watson Retail (HK) Limited Shatin Area Salary negotiable Posted on 08 Apr 2019 Cyber Security Operations Manager A.S. Watson Retail (HK) Limited Job Highlights Job Description Job Purpose This role forms part of the A.S. Watson Group IT (GIT) Security function and has a main responsibility for supporting A.S. Watson Group (Asia) with Security Operations. The Cyber Security Operations Manager, reporting to Senior Manager – Cyber Security Operations, is a cyber security specialist with corporate responsibility to direct
 and manage the execution of the security operations process. This role will work with GIT and BU IT Management on operational decisions to mobilize staff, activate response plans, and manage time-critical incident management and response activities when a
 high-impact IT security incident is declared.   The role will be responsible for: Delivering advanced analysis and recommend remediation steps for cyber security events and incidents. Manage execution of action plans for ensuring the safety and security of all information systems assets. Performing advanced analysis and recommend remediation steps for cyber security events and incidents. Lead investigations on security incidents to minimalize the risks to an acceptable level.
 
  Controls and monitors IT and telecommunication security within given authority. Identifies and analyzes operational risks for IT systems security. Performs root cause analyzes and recommends necessary actions to be taken.   Analyzes business needs in the information security area and recommends and gives opinions on technical security implementations and solutions to several levels within the organization.
 Advises in the design and implementation of IT security solutions. Directing the Security Operations Center rollout in Asia. Manage the Security Operation Center process in Asia, where security-related alarms must be verified and analyzed. Managing & evaluating security scans done by third parties. Coordinating & performing security penetration tests on servers & websites before go-live(new servers / websites or big changes) in Asia. Advises developers on the remediation of security issues on websites. Logging and reporting of security incidents. Manage the incident response process.   Person Specification: 3+ years working experience in IT security or IT operations fields Excellent knowledge of IT Infrastructure, cyber security technologies, various operating systems (Windows/UNIX), and web technologies (focusing on network security)
 Ability to read and understand packet level data Intrusion detection and prevention and Network Security Products (IDS/IPS, firewalls, etc.) Host Security Products (HIPS, AV, scanners, etc.)
 Knowledge of cutting edge threats and technologies effecting Web Application vulnerabilities and recent internet threats
 Exposure on Vulnerability assessment as well as penetration testing or forensic analysis fields are an advantage
 Fluent English verbal & written communication capability Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
 Exceptional interpersonal skills and the ability to work across the organization at all levels, and geographical locations Has a positive attitude with an eagerness to learn and develop professional knowledge.
 Additional Information Career Level Middle Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 3 years Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Five-day work week, Free shuttle bus, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus Company Website Company details is what we bring to life, every single day.  has set the standard since 1841 – and we’ve only just begun. A.S. Watson (ASW) is the largest international health and beauty retailer in Asia and Europe with over 14,100 stores in 24 markets. Each year, over three billion customers and members shop with our well-known retail brands. Everyday, we bring   to
 life through our 12 retail brands including Watsons, Kruidvat, Trekpleister, Rossmann, Superdrug, Savers, Drogas, ICI PARIS XL, The Perfume Shop, PARKnSHOP, FORTRESS and Watson’s Wine. At ASW, it is our vision to be the world’s leading health, beauty and lifestyle retailer, and with such ambition in mind we work tirelessly to put a smile on
 our customers’ faces, in order to deliver our commitment “We bring   to life” – to our customers, colleagues, communities and shareholders. Inspired by our passionate commitment “ ”
 is at the heart of the movement at ASW connecting brilliant talent around the world by inspiring them with the higher purpose of working at ASW – “Bringing   to
 life” by making people healthy and beautiful.  isn’t just a job. It’s your share in the global success of our brands. Together we’re   than you can imagine.  When the Hong Kong Dispensary opened its doors to customers 175 years ago, nobody could’ve imagined it would one day grow into the A.S. Watson Group we know today. The A.S. Watson Group story is already an extraordinary one. But there’s much more to come. Help us write the next chapter. Join us, and  !    If you are interested to know more about our global brands, explore our different teams and hear our amazing employees’ stories, please
 visit our career website,  www.aswatsoncareers.com .    You are welcome to register at our career website for job application or directly send your full resume with expected salary to A.S. Watson Group

title: Supply Planning Executive (1 year renewable contract)
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Supply Planning Executive (1 year renewable contract)  Philip Morris Asia Ltd Southern Area Salary negotiable Posted on 08 Apr 2019 Supply Planning Executive (1 year renewable contract)  Philip Morris Asia Ltd Job Highlights Job Description OUR VISION
 You may have heard of Philip Morris International (PMI), the world’s leading Tobacco Company and the maker of Marlboro – the undisputed number one cigarette
 brand in the world.  But PMI is about more than cigarettes. We’ve made a significant or momentum business decision to go “smoke-free” and work towards a world where non-combustible
 tobacco and nicotine products may one day replace cigarettes. Find out more on https://www.pmiscience.com/
 We’re now laying the foundation to make our smoke-free vision a reality (read about our transformation here: https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2017-03-08/big-tobacco-has-caught-startup-fever),
 and we are looking for a talented Manager Device Product and Process Improvement to work at our Hong Kong office to make it happen. YOU You will be employed in Hong Kong under Philip Morris Asia Limited (PMAL). PMAL operates as a subsidiary of Philip Morris International, Inc.
 RISE TO THE CHALLENGE
 You will be leading day-to-day supply planning processes with RRP device/components production centers in Asia with the key objective to ensure supply
 to market OTIF. This includes leading the communication and ensuring the market requirements are transmitted in an adequate way of continuous improvement and simplification of processes are key to ensure mutual understanding and smooth supply planning process Key Accountabilities
 Work with EMS on supply plan to fulfill monthly demand with the objective of 100% OTIF. Resolve issues to ensure demand are met. Communicate shipment
 plan with S&OP team. Communicate unconstrained forecast with supplier incl. ensuring clarity of data. Leveling/Constraining plan: taking into account all operational constraints
 (e.g. installed capacity, uptime, shutdowns, components supply) and trigger all feasible actions by supplier and RRP SC to remove constraints.
 Manage Short Term Plan (STP) Changes, i.e. planning of regular & adhoc non-commercial requirements while giving the right prioritization to RRP Production
 Centers in Asia.  New product material readiness - Provide initial forecast, reserve capacity, order new materials within lead time, highlight potential risks. Optimize stock policy to support demand requirement with agreed flexibility, Reconcile PMI total potential cost exposure, monitor supplier & ensure management
 is updated monthly via executive summary. Perform analysis on pricing updates to ensure price is maintained in an adequate manner. Manage price list updates based on contracts and release SKU
 quotes. Consolidate and analyze spend/saving reports. Manage supplier creation, ad hoc activities, such as data gathering, consolidation & analysis. Support Finance on adequate data to run budget cycle from the Procurement side.
 Support reporting and analysis on supply planning area. Identify opportunities for continuous improvement on current process Essential Skills and competencies: A minimum of 5 years of experience in Supply Planning with exposure to a multinational environment preferable in the electronic business environment. A College/University degree in Supply Chain Management/ engineering or equivalent is required. Project Management Experience, Action oriented, Priority Setting, Problem Solving, Standing Alone, Learning on the fly, Listening, Organizational Agility Functional skills: Good knowledge of SAP, Excellent MS Office skills [particularly Excel – including creation & analysis of large database] and Workpoint Displaying the following traits would be an advantage: Detail-oriented Action oriented, and bring strong analytical skills and good problem solving skills Team player Pro-active   JOIN A GLOBAL MARKET LEADER PMI is the world's leading international tobacco company, with six of the world's top 15 international brands and products sold in more than 180 markets.
 In addition to the manufacture and sale of cigarettes, including the number one global cigarette brand, and other tobacco products, PMI is engaged in the development and commercialization of Reduced-Risk Products ("RRPs"). RRPs is the term we use to refer to products that present, are likely to present, or have the potential to present less risk of harm to smokers who switch
 to these products versus continued smoking. We have a range of RRPs in various stages of development, scientific assessment and commercialization. Because our RRPs do not burn tobacco, they produce far lower quantities of harmful and potentially harmful compounds
 than found in cigarette smoke. For more information, see www.pmi.com and www.pmiscience.com. FIND A NEW PATH Our company offers you a fresh perspective. Here, you will never stop exploring and discovering. We take on-the-job learning to another level, giving
 you every opportunity to develop your career and reach your full potential. With innovative technologies, services and processes, backed by a competitive salary and compensation package, you will work in a professional setting with clients and team members
 from all over the world.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin,
 gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status. If you believe you would be a good fit to the requirements of the role, and you would like to explore further a career path within PMI, please apply now so that we can start the conversation.         Additional Information Career Level Not Specified Qualification Not Specified Industry Job Function Years of Experience Not Specified Employment Type Contract Benefits Dental insurance, Double pay, Flexible working hours, Medical insurance, Travel allowance Company details More Jobs from this employer Manufacturing Integration Manager Posted on  5 hours ago Failure Analysis Senior Engineer Posted on  08-Apr-19 Senior Devices Process Development Engineer Posted on  08-Apr-19 View all jobs from this employer About JobsDB About jobsDB FAQ Career @ jobsDB Contact us Contact us International partners Bdjobs (Bandladesh) Brighter Monday (East Africa) Catho (Brazil) Jobberman (West Africa) JobStreet (S.E. title: Senior Manager– Projects & Group Reporting (FINCON-PGR)
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Senior Manager– Projects & Group Reporting (FINCON-PGR) Orient Overseas Container Line Ltd (OOCL) Kwun Tong Salary negotiable Posted on 08 Apr 2019 Senior Manager– Projects & Group Reporting (FINCON-PGR) Orient Overseas Container Line Ltd (OOCL) Job Highlights Job Description Responsibilities: To strengthen the transparency of financial project analysis, improvement in process and system control and China reporting efficiency across the
 Group, the Company is looking for a high-caliber professional to join the Headquarter finance team.  As the Head of Projects and Group Reporting Section who reports duty to the Deputy Group Financial Controller, the candidate is required to: - Be responsible to drive the China reporting submission with excellent quality to the holding company listed in both the Shanghai Stock Exchange and the Hong Kong Stock Exchange Provide a strong support in the investment and financial project analysis
 Initiate and implement system improvement projects to strive for efficiency
 Strengthen financial control and compliance across the Headquarters and Regions Shade the control culture in the department to foster high level of integrity Provide guidance and address queries regarding financial and internal control, accounting policies and procedures Tackle internal audit, external interim and yearly audit for compliance with the PRC GAAP Manage, motivate and develop staff under supervision Requirements: Qualified accountant with bachelor’s degree in Accounting or related discipline Minimum 12 years work experience in the accounting field with at least 4 years in Big 4 Well versed in ERP and operating system project initiatives and implementation Ability to handle investment, financial and business model evaluation independently
 Strong in-house MNC and SOE experience Knowledge in shipping and logistics industry will be a definite advantage Team leader with excellent communication, presentation and analytical skills
 Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines Mature, proactive and organized with strong interpersonal skills Computer literate in Excel/Word/SAP Proficient spoken and written Chinese and English; and good command of Putonghua is a must Occasional travel is required
 Please send your application letter with detailed resume and expected salary by clicking "Apply Now" and quote the reference number on the subject (Data collected will be used for recruitment purpose only.) http://www.oocl.com Additional Information Career Level Senior Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 12 years Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Dental insurance, Double pay, Education allowance, Five-day work week, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus Company Website Company details We are a leading international container transport and logistics service provider, operating from more than 360 offices in 70 countries around
 the world. Our modern and ever-expanding fleet, in addition to our extensive international facilities, links Asia, Europe, North America and Mediterranean, the Indian sub-continent, the Middle East and Australia/New Zealand. As a customer-focused organization
 we embrace quality standards, utilizing the most advanced information technology and e-Commerce platforms in the industry. OOCL has long been recognized as the industry leader in developing and providing IT solutions for both container transportation customers and logistics customers. In addition,
 we are also the pioneer in the provision of IT solutions for other industry players through our advanced systems and portals. One such system is CargoSmart, one of the most advanced online application and integration service in the ocean container transportation
 industry, which has received 5 awards for its innovative use of leading technology. At OOCL we recognize that people are our most important asset and would like to invite high-caliber candidates to join our global team. Please send your application letter with detailed resume and expected salary by email to
 [email protected]  and quote the reference number on the subject. title: Senior Associate - Regional Internal Audit
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Senior Associate - Regional Internal Audit A.S. Watson Retail (HK) Limited Shatin Area Salary negotiable Posted on 08 Apr 2019 Senior Associate - Regional Internal Audit A.S. Watson Retail (HK) Limited Job Highlights Job Description Summary: We are looking for candidates with strong passion in developing their career in internal audit. This person will work under our Group Finance - Internal Audit Team. Candidates with passion in internal audit and would like to have regional exposure in Asia and Europe will be a good fit to this role. We also welcome candidates who are currently working in external audit firms without any commercial experiences as Associate.    Responsibilities: Perform reviews and report on status of controls (adequacy, efficiency and compliance thereof) in different business units in Asia. Reduce financial and operational risks focusing on highest value areas (margins, supplier funding and inventory) and the highest risk businesses. Provide advice and assurance to Group and line management on key strategic decisions. Perform independent testing to verify self-assessment results. Coordinate quarterly update process on status of audit findings reported by the Internal Audit Group. Prepare periodic summaries of work performed to Group management.    Requirements: University graduate in Finance or Accounting related disciplines  Qualified accountant with external audit experiences preferably from Big 4 Minimum of 1-3 years' of related work experience  Passionate, detail oriented with a great sense of team spirit  Excellent communication and presentation technique  Proficient in Pivot Table, V-Look Up and PowerPoint  Excellent command of English and Chinese (including Mandarin) Willing to travel frequently across Asia and Europe  Candidates with less experiences will be considered as Associate    Interested parties please e-mail your full resume with expected salary to our company email (shown in our Company Profile).   We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from all qualified candidates. The information provided will be treated in strict confidence and be used only for consideration of your application for relevant / similar posts within the A.S. Watson Group.   Applicants not hearing from us within 6 weeks from the date of advertisement may consider their applications unsuccessful. All personal data of unsuccessful applicants will be destroyed within 12 months from the date of application.    Additional Information Career Level Middle Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 2 years Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Education allowance, Five-day work week, Medical insurance, Performance bonus Company Website Company details Established in Hong Kong in 1841, A.S. Watson Group is the largest international health and beauty retailer in Asia and Europe with 13,000 stores in 25 markets. Each year, over 3 billion customers and members shop with our 13 retail brands, both in stores and online. In Hong Kong, we operate over 650 stores under four retail brands – Watsons, PARKnSHOP, FORTRESS, and Watson’s Wine. In addition, we manufacture and distribute high quality drinking water brand Watsons Water, as well as famous juice drinks Mr. Juicy and Sunkist. For the fiscal year 2015, A.S. Watson Group recorded revenue of HK$151.9billion. We have over 120,000 employees worldwide, including 12,800 in Hong Kong. A.S. Watson Group is also a member of the world-renowned multinational conglomerate CK Hutchison Holdings Limited, which has major interests in ports and related services, retail, infrastructure, energy and telecommunications in over 50 countries. Please visit   for more in-depth information about A.S. Watson Group and its brands. You may also stay in touch with us via our digital presence (eCommerce, social media, mobile app & more); more details are at  . Candidates would like to apply any of our job vacancies, please send your full resume with expected salary to A.S. description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Associate Data Scientist Asia Miles Limited Tung Chung Salary provided Posted on 09 Apr 2019 Associate Data Scientist Asia Miles Limited Job Highlights Job Description Asia Miles, Asia’s leading travel and lifestyle rewards programme, is now looking for an experienced data scientist with strong

Reporting to the Senior Managers, HAT is looking for an experienced finance professional to join the team. Ensure reporting packages at regional level for group consolidation and reporting purposes are prepared in an accurate and timely manner. Its MCO branded consumer financial services, including the MCO Visa Card, MCO Wallet app, and MCO Token embrace a vision of Cryptocurrency in Every Wallet™.CRYPTO.com is headquartered in Hong Kong. MCO is democratizing blockchain technology by designing beautiful, simple and useful financial services that have a lasting, positive impact on people’s lives.  For more information, please visit:  www.crypto.com  and   mco.crypto.com .    About the role: We are looking for a Junior to Mid-level Python Developer to join our in-house trading team. description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Manager – Projects & Group Reporting (FINCON-PGR)    Orient Overseas Container Line Ltd (OOCL) Kwun Tong Salary negotiable Posted on 09 Apr 2019 Manager – Projects & Group Reporting (FINCON-PGR)    Orient Overseas Container Line Ltd (OOCL) Job Highlights Job Description To cope with business expansion and development needs, we are looking for a dedicated and quality talent to join the Headquarter finance team.  Reporting to the
 Head of Projects and Group Reporting Section, the candidate is required to: - Evaluate the effectiveness and efficiency of the existing accounting processes and procedures
 Explore and formulate process improvement and system implementation project Drive and monitor project progress in terms of user requirements collection, UAT and system implementation Assist to prepare the China reports submitting to the holding company listed in Shanghai and Hong Kong
 Prepare data analysis supporting financial projects
 Liaise and coach accounting service centers when involving projects Assist in the interim and year end book closing and audit Produce high quality analysis report and handle ad hoc assignments when required Qualified accountant with bachelor’s degree in Accounting or related discipline Minimum 8 years work experience in the accounting field with 3 years in Big 4 Strong in-house experience with MNC or SOE is preferred Experience in ERP system projects initiatives and implementation
 Knowledge in shipping and logistics industry will be a definite advantage Mature, self-motivated, deadline-driven and can work under pressure Cross department team-player with good communication and analytical skills Proactive, detail oriented and organized with strong interpersonal skills Computer literate in Excel/Word/Access/SAP Proficient spoken and written Chinese and English with good command of Putonghua Occasional travel is required Please send your application letter with detailed resume and expected salary by clicking "Apply Now" and quote the reference number on the subject (Data collected will be used for recruitment purpose only.) http://www.oocl.com Additional Information Career Level Senior Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 8 years Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Dental insurance, Double pay, Education allowance, Five-day work week, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus Company Website Company details We are a leading international container transport and logistics service provider, operating from more than 360 offices in 70 countries around
 the world. Our modern and ever-expanding fleet, in addition to our extensive international facilities, links Asia, Europe, North America and Mediterranean, the Indian sub-continent, the Middle East and Australia/New Zealand. As a customer-focused organization
 we embrace quality standards, utilizing the most advanced information technology and e-Commerce platforms in the industry. OOCL has long been recognized as the industry leader in developing and providing IT solutions for both container transportation customers and logistics customers. In addition,

 regularly attending the fairs.   Main Duties & Responsibilities:   Manage relations with existing VIP & loyal buyers, trade associations and online sellers through the delivery of top notch communications and customer service pre/at/post
 show, with the goal to maintain a high retention & satisfaction rate for these audience groups Identify and contact potential new buyers from these groups to invite to the fairs to reach assigned targets. Organize attendee delegations from big buying companies and
 industry associations, and provide the needed support to encourage and facilitate their attendance  Plan and execute exciting and cost-effective incentive programs and services

 largest electronics and mobile electronics shows.  online marketplaces ( GlobalSources.com ), magazines, and apps.   More than 1.5 million international buyers, including 94 of the world’s top 100 retailers, use these services to obtain product and

title: Deputy Head Wildlife
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Deputy Head Wildlife World Wide Fund For Nature Hong Kong Kwai Hing Salary provided Posted on 10 Apr 2019 Deputy Head Wildlife World Wide Fund For Nature Hong Kong Job Highlights Job Description             Working with the Head of Wildlife and Director of Wildlife and Wetlands , Wildlife Project teams,  Communications, and external partners and stakeholders to secure big wins and real, lasting
 progress on priority wildlife conservation issues.       : Work closely with Conservation Program (CP) wildlife project teams to design implement, and communicate their relevant conservation projects and campaigns related to wildlife conservation Manage project teams, project implementation, and project budgets for wildlife trade issues, including, but not limited to, ivory, pangolin, rhino, CITES, shark-fin, and tigers Act as a spokesperson on wildlife issues to the media and public, where needed Monitor and manage the campaign/project deliverables and schedules of wildlife project teams, ensuring a high standard of accuracy, science-based decision-making and delivery, and accessibility
 of messaging to target audiences Provide assistance, where needed, to the Campaign Specialist and Communications Digital Services (CDS), PR and media to deliver communications of WWF-Hong Kong conservation programme for supporters’
 engagement and reaching out to new audience Assist in general media activities like preparing press release and conference and other related content work for social media, website and donor support Assist wildlife project teams in organizing and passing visual material files to CDS within their archival system and WWF ‘HIVE’ Maintain contact with WWF International and Network Initiative staff to be kept reasonably up-to- date on wildlife initiatives that may be relevant to WWF-Hong Kong’s work and provide necessary
 support Keep abreast of proposed, new or amended regulations and developments which may impact wildlife conservation from a global, regional or Hong Kong perspective Work with other conservation and fundraising staff on new proposals and projects for fundraising and manage project budgets ( direct costs, staff costs and CDS costs) Prepare Annual Operating Plans and NPR impact reports as well as manage staff resources within BambooHRIS Carry out other duties as assigned      : Strong familiarity with wildlife conservation issues relevant to Hong Kong, East Asia, and globally Strong familiarity with key stakeholders, partners, and other actors related to wildlife conservation issues prioritized by WWF-Hong Kong Adept at campaign design, implementation, and performance monitoring for conservation-related issues Adept at internal communication and ability to move projects forward strengthened by timely and productive consultation Ability to work with Conservation Project staff to enhance their writing and communication skills so as to maximize their campaign impact   A savvy understanding of messaging and what approaches and issues resonate with target audiences
 – the public, government, private sector, partner NGOs     : Excellent time management and prioritization skills Able to work with diverse personnel in an effective fashion even in high pressure situations Ability to bring together views and approaches of project specialists and work to CDS content timelines aligned with WWF HK campaign and communications
 organisational  plan Ability to function well in and manage projects in dynamic conservation situations Ability to assess risk and strategic impacts of actions effectively Ability to develop close alliances with partners and manage collaborative efforts in a professional fashion Excellent communications skills in English and Chinese with Cantonese / Mandarin essential  Applications would be considered until the post is filled. Additional Information Career Level Senior Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 10 years Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Education allowance, Five-day work week, Flexible working hours, Life insurance, Medical insurance Company details   WWF is the leading conservation organisation in Hong Kong in terms of its advocacy work and on-the-ground conservation activities, to public involvement in nurturing a green
 generation. Mai Po Nature Reserve has been managed by WWF-Hong Kong since 1983. With its high diversity of wetland habitats including  , mangroves, intertidal mudflats and reedbeds, the reserve is an important habitat and staging site for waterbirds.
 Some 60,000 birds make their annual winter migration to roost in Deep Bay. In 1995, the reserve and the Inner Deep Bay wetlands were recognized as a Wetland of International Importance under the Ramsar Convention. Visitors to Mai Po can experience nature first-hand,
 enriching their knowledge of Hong Kong’s natural environment and sustainable development.   Our mission continues as we aim stop the degradation of our planet’s natural environment and build a future in which people can live in harmony with nature. WWF is working
 in partnership with business Government, business and the community to Transform Hong Kong into Asias most sustainable city. ​   We need knowledgeable, talented people who are passionate about engaging and inspiring others.  People who share our optimism that it’s possible to change the world for the better. People
 who are determined to make a difference.

description:

 Technology innovation will be part of the client’s DNA – A.I., Big Data, Blockchain, and so on.
   As an immediate opportunity to join perhaps the most exciting team in the insurance industry, we are looking for a cyber security specialist who
 are strong in not only the latest web technologies but also the more traditional enterprise technology stack to ensure smooth and secure operation of our products and services.   Responsibilities:
 Seeking to build in security during the development stages of software systems, networks and data centres Looking for vulnerabilities and risks in hardware and software Finding the best way to secure the IT infrastructure of an organisation Building firewalls into network infrastructures Constantly monitoring for attacks and intrusions When the cyber security specialist finds a potential threat or attempted breach, closing off the security vulnerability Identifying the perpetrator and liaising with the police if necessary Report to the Chief Technology Officer Requirements:
 Bachelor’s degree in information technology/security or similar diciplines 3-6 years working in a cyber security role Holding these security certificates would be a plus: CISM, CISSP, GSEC Holding these cloud certificates would be a plus: AWS, CCNA, CCNP, MCSE, CMA Familiar with cross-platform security analysis and management Strong IT skills and knowledge including hardware, software and networks Meticulous attention to detail Ability to use logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of IT systems A forensic approach to challenges A deep understanding of how hackers work and ability to keep up with the fast pace of change in the criminal cyber-underworld Ability to seek out vulnerabilities in IT infrastructures Additional Information Career Level Middle Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 3 years Employment Type Full Time Company Website Company details Bó Lè Associates is the largest executive search firm in Asia with a well-developed network of 14 wholly-owned local offices and 380+ staff in the region
 (Beijing, Chengdu, Chongqing, Dalian, Guangzhou, Shanghai, Shenzhen, Suzhou, Tianjin, Hong Kong, Taipei, Bangkok, Jakarta and Kuala Lumpur). We have 330+ experienced consultants and researchers, and 50+ support staff including Finance and Accounting, IT, in-house
 Recruitment and Training, and Marketing and Communication specialists. We have been ranked No. 1 in China and Indonesia, and also in the top three in Malaysia and the Philippines. Bó Lè Leaders is the wholly-owned subsidiary of RGF, the world’s fifth largest
 and Japan’s largest HR service provider.    Our top 10 clients are all Fortune 100 companies. Bó Lè Leaders has been recognized as a leader and top provider of quality services. We were globally voted
 as one of the “Top 10 Executive Search Firm in 2012” in a survey conducted by TopExecutiveSearchFirms.com. For more information, please visit our website at
 www.bo-le.com . title: Digital Analytics Specialist (Mobile App)
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Digital Analytics Specialist (Mobile App) A.S. Watson Group (HK) Limited Shatin Area Salary negotiable Posted on 10 Apr 2019 Digital Analytics Specialist (Mobile App) A.S. Watson Group (HK) Limited Job Highlights Job Description Build a comprehensive reporting pack, including dashboards, monitoring channel performance and present this back to business stakeholders Utilize strong analytical ability to evaluate end-to-end customer experience across multiple channels and customer touch point Work with designers and developers to design, build and implement online experiences that provide measurable gains against primary KPIs Responsible for designing documentation for analytics test plan and test cases by clearly articulating test objectives, steps, and expected results based on the requirements Responsible to identify any tracking discrepancies and follow up on fixes Analyze and understand complex data sources in order to validate developed applications, Business Intelligence solutions, data warehouses, data visualizations, and extract, transform, and load (ETL) procedures Keep up-to-date with industry knowledge and best practices concerning Web/App analytics, digital marketing and A/B testing 3+ years of experience in mobile app and website analytics for an online retailer or similar online business Strong  working knowledge in mobile app analytics or tools such as Firebase, Flurry, MixPanel, AppSee, AppsFlyer, Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics,
 Tag Manager, etc. Experience in Firebase modules such as prediction, Cloud Messaging, A/B testing, dynamic links and deep link is preferred Ability to generate, analyze and interpret data – Certified in Google Analytics Individual Qualification Experience in SQL for Google Big Query Experience developing solutions and visualizations in Tableau/ Data Studio Experience in testing and optimization platforms (Google Optimize, Adobe Target, Optimizely, etc) Hands on experience in mobile application development on iOS or Android Platforms is preferred Excellent verbal and written communication skills, ability to articulate ideas clearly Must be able to work independently and as a strong team player Ability to work in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment running multiple projects simultaneously Interested parties please e-mail your full resume in WORD FORMAT with expected salary to our company email (shown in our Company Profile). We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from all qualified candidates. The information provided will be treated in strict confidence and be used only for consideration of your application for
 relevant / similar posts within the A.S. Watson Group. Applicants not hearing from us within 6 weeks from the date of advertisement may consider their applications unsuccessful. All personal data of unsuccessful applicants will be destroyed within 12 months
 from the date of application.  Additional Information Career Level Entry Level Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience Not Specified Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Five-day work week, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus Company Website Company details is what we bring to life, every single day.  has set the standard since 1841 – and we’ve only just begun. A.S. Watson (ASW) is the largest international health and beauty retailer in Asia and Europe with over 14,100 stores in 24 markets. Each year, over three billion customers and members shop with our well-known retail brands. Everyday, we bring   to
 life through our 12 retail brands including Watsons, Kruidvat, Trekpleister, Rossmann, Superdrug, Savers, Drogas, ICI PARIS XL, The Perfume Shop, PARKnSHOP, FORTRESS and Watson’s Wine. At ASW, it is our vision to be the world’s leading health, beauty and lifestyle retailer, and with such ambition in mind we work tirelessly to put a smile on
 our customers’ faces, in order to deliver our commitment “We bring   to life” – to our customers, colleagues, communities and shareholders. Inspired by our passionate commitment “ ”
 is at the heart of the movement at ASW connecting brilliant talent around the world by inspiring them with the higher purpose of working at ASW – “Bringing   to
 life” by making people healthy and beautiful.  isn’t just a job. It’s your share in the global success of our brands. Together we’re   than you can imagine.  When the Hong Kong Dispensary opened its doors to customers 175 years ago, nobody could’ve imagined it would one day grow into the A.S. Watson Group we know today. The A.S. Watson Group story is already an extraordinary one. But there’s much more to come. Help us write the next chapter. Join us, and  !    If you are interested to know more about our global brands, explore our different teams and hear our amazing employees’ stories, please
 visit our career website,  www.aswatsoncareers.com .    You are welcome to register at our career website for job application or directly send your full resume with expected salary to A.S. Watson Group

title: Manager - System Development
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Manager - System Development HGC Global Communications Limited Tsing Yi Salary negotiable Posted on 10 Apr 2019 Manager - System Development HGC Global Communications Limited Job Highlights Job Description Responsibilities: Work with multiple stakeholders to digitize workplace including ERP system, HR system, future ways of working, and digital workplace solution,
 the incumbent will scope, lead technology decisions,execute programs, and implement solution. Major focus on Finance/ Human Resources/ internal processes aspects for feasibility studies of projects, improvements via system customization
 on ERP, HRM, CRM, etc., development and deployment for internal clients in various functions. Project Management - Identifying requirements with clients, setting budgets, deadlines, implementation (leading 5-10 people), and post implementation
 reviews with clients by, Identifying business need and solving problems; Performing GAP analysis and Business Process Re-engineering (BPR) to boost up the performance in the related departments; Defining the project objectives align with business strategy that manages ricks, issues, financials and resources of the project; Managing all deliverable under the project adopted with agreed scope, time, cost and quality; Planning, tracking milestones and changing of the project to achieve business goals; Driving and reviewing with any outsourcing parties to develop to delivery to ensure project objective if necessary  Requirements: Degree holder or Higher Diploma in Computer Science, Information Systems or related disciplined with one or more professional certifications/
 training in project management; 7-10 years experience in telecommunication / IT system development and project management experience in IT industry, preferably 5+ years managerial
 experience demonstrating strong management skills; Hands-on experience in system development / IT project management with the following technologies: Operating System: Windows, Linux, Unix, and Open OS; Programming: Java, Javascript & Node-js, Jquery, MobileApp language (Objective-C / Swift / Android), PL/SQL, Power Builder, Python, Secure Coding,
 Shell Script, Web Service (SOAP, REST), XML, JSON; Software / System / Tool / DevOps: Apache, IIS, JBOSS, Tomcat, Weblogic; Virtual Server - Vmware, Virtual box; Marketing Automation, Open CMS - Word Press, Web Analytic tools, Web Security, Big-Data tools, like Hadoop, Splunk; AppScan, Azure, Jmeter; Flex Workflow, OBIEE, Oracle SOA Suite, Data integration Suite would be an advantage; Jira, GitLabs, etc. Database & tool: Oracle, My SQL, MS SQL, Redis, ODI Competencies - motivating others, negotiating, interpersonal savvy, business acumen, dealing with ambiguity Fluent in spoken and written English, Cantonese and Mandarin   We offer competitive salary package and career development opportunity. Free company coach is
 provided.  Interested parties, please quote our reference number and apply with full resume, present and expected salary, by clicking “APPLY NOW”.    Additional Information Career Level Senior Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 7 years Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Dental insurance, Five-day work week, Free shuttle bus, Medical insurance, Performance bonus Company details HGC Global Communications Limited (HGC) is a leading fixed-line operator, IT service provider, carrier’s carrier and one
 of Hong Kong’s largest-scale Wi-Fi service providers. HGC empowers local and overseas customers with one-stop international, corporate, data centre and residential broadband services. HGC owns and runs an extensive optical-fibre network, coupled with four
 cross-border routes integrated with three of mainland China’s tier-one telecoms operators, plus a world-class international network. The company is committed to developing cloud computing services and offering high-speed Wi-Fi service under the “HGC On Air”
 brand. title: Executive Assistant - REQ1538 (Based in Hong Kong)
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Executive Assistant - REQ1538 (Based in Hong Kong) Melco Resorts & Entertainment Limited Central Salary provided Posted on 10 Apr 2019 Executive Assistant - REQ1538 (Based in Hong Kong) Melco Resorts & Entertainment Limited Job Highlights Job Description POSITION SUMMARY: To provide administrative and clerical support to the Vice President.  Responsible for all systems applications and filing of processes required to complete the department’s
 objectives.   PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES: Perform administrative functions to the Vice President, make discretionary decisions and interface with all appropriate internal departments Maintain a comprehensive calendar and files for Vice President, ensure required reports are properly prepared and submitted on a timely basis Organize appointment schedules and arrangement of business meetings Prepare and facilitate travel arrangements for the Vice President Organize data on excel Assist in formatting and creation of PowerPoint presentations Familiarity with all IT processes, applications and usage Assist team members in project organization, support documents preparation or gifts organization Assist in answering correspondence, compose memoranda and letters Maintain confidentiality of sensitive materials and its filing Apply for POs, manage all system required processes for the team’s projects Manage all department paperwork and items: collate, screen, distribute, file Meet the attendance guidelines of the job and adhere to departmental and company policies Coordinate with the other departments’ Executive Assistants and to work as a team Perform other related duties as assigned KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS: Open minded, positive, to-do attitude; detail-orientation, accuracy, motivation and self-improvement Timely submission of all systems applications and systematic filing of records for easy referencing and retrieving Strong organizational skills and independently motivated to ensure progress for the list of tasks given Passion and dedication in completion of all tasks assigned, big or small, accepts accountability Builds constructive relationships with team members and partnering teams QUALIFICATIONS: Minimum five years working experience Minimum three years computer experience, with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint & Visio Minimum three years executive secretarial experience preferred University graduate Fluent in Cantonese and English Adheres to and supports the Company’s Vision and Values A team player, an enthusiastic participant in achieving team objectives and common goals Embraces challenges positively and learns from experiences to meet changing circumstances Strong interest in self-improvement Thoughtful, detail-oriented, friendly, positive, professional attitude to all, at all times Problem-solver: Anticipate and assess issues, risks or opportunities facing the tasks and applies effective, creative solutions Self-motivated: Achieves agreed objectives and accepts accountability for results Open-minded, passion for learning and understanding the department’s goals Understand the objectives of being employee and customer-oriented, always looking to satisfy the parties involved To apply or for more information, please visit our website: https://mycareer.melco-resorts.com/ Suitable candidates will be invited for an interview within 4 weeks of their application. All information collected will be used for recruitment purposes only. Additional Information Career Level Middle Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 5 years Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Company details Melco Resorts & Entertainment (NASDAQ: MLCO), a leading developer, owner and operator of casino gaming and entertainment resort facilities in Asia.  The Company currently owns and operates City of Dreams,
 its flagship integrated resort and home to the world’s largest water extravaganza - The House of Dancing Water; Studio City, a cinematically-themed integrated resort; Altira Macau, a Forbes 5-star luxury hotel; and the Mocha Clubs, a series of lifestyle and
 entertainment clubs in Macau.  In the Philippines, a subsidiary of the Company operates and manages City of Dreams Manila, an integrated resort in the Entertainment City complex in Manila. description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Account Executive Deliveroo Hong Kong Limited Sheung Wan Salary negotiable Posted on 11 Apr 2019 Account Executive Deliveroo Hong Kong Limited Job Highlights Job Description We are looking for an Account Executive to join our fast-growing commercial team. This is a unique opportunity to join a fast growing and well-funded company while playing a critical role in our growth and development.  As an Account Executive, you will manage some of the business' largest restaurant portfolios, cultivating existing relationships and helping them increase their online sales. The role will require strong communication skills as most communication will be held through phone and email. Face to face relationship building skills will be a plus.  The ideal candidate will know how to build successful relationships, have strong work ethics, and have a keen analytical eye. Maintaining and growing relationships between Deliveroo and restaurant partners Supporting marketing initiatives and incorporating your valuable accounts Data analysis, reporting, and entry Manage Deliveroo restaurant admin pages Proactively monitor and tweak restaurant menus to increase conversion rates Supporting restaurants with invoicing resolutions Streamlining administrative support 1-2 years working experience, ideally in a commercial environment where you have to deal with many  clients/customers . However, we will also consider highly accomplished fresh graduates. You must be a strong communicator through phone, email and in person You must have a keen commercial sense and be results oriented You must be a self-starter, hard-worker and well organized You should be comfortable using different technology Excel experience is preferred but not essential BENEFITS Have a real impact on the Company's growth and evolution Attractive commission structure Open, respectful, fun company culture Work with people who love what they do every day BIG Friday lunches -  Deliveroo'd to the office of course! Deliveroo PLUS – never pay the delivery fee when you order food! Mobility laterally or upwards within the company – show us you love what you do and are good at it, and we’ll notice. Additional Information Career Level Middle Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience Not Specified Employment Type Full Time Benefits Dental insurance, Five-day work week, Medical insurance, Performance bonus, Transportation allowance Company details Deliveroo is on a mission to transform the way the world thinks about food delivery. It’s not a chicken chow mein and a night on the sofa anymore, it’s your favourite local restaurant, it’s a dinner party, a date. We’re four years in, and along the way our team have taken hundreds of ideas from brainstorms to global rollouts, like Deliveroo Editions bespoke kitchens designed to host a locally curated selection of restaurants. Editions are our solution to ensuring that our customers have access to the best of the food scene, no matter where they live. And that’s just what we’re like at Deliveroo, no compromise allowed and lots of food inspired challenges to get your teeth into. Out of the box, thinking is actively encouraged and we move quickly to make great ideas happen. We’re energetic, fast-paced and blow off steam with free for all Friday lunches. It’s a formula that’s working too we’re bringing great food to customers in 12 countries and over 200 cities.
