title: Senior Marketing Executive/Marketing Executive
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Senior Marketing Executive/Marketing Executive Price.com.hk Limited Kwun Tong Salary provided Posted on 11 Apr 2019 Senior Marketing Executive/Marketing Executive Price.com.hk Limited Job Highlights Job Description Join us to create new values to the online offline commerce communities Price.com.hk, being one of the most popular online platforms* in Hong Kong, strives to bring extra values to merchants and consumers by not only connecting
 them seamlessly with our state-of-the-art technology but co-creating a community that encourages a more user centric shopping experience combined with the application of big data analytics. 
 
 We start with a goal to minimize market information costs incurred upon consumers allowing them to find their favorite products easier and faster and at
 the same time enable merchants to successfully run their brick and click strategies to reach their targeted consumers at the lowest costs possible. Today, we are serving 2M+ monthly unique visitors. We cannot accomplish that without working together with individuals

 will also be in charge of building partnerships and working relationships with employees, guests, community, suppliers and shareholders. • Head of Restaurant Management Team • Hire, lead, coach and develop staffs • Conducts daily pre-shift briefings to employees on preparation, service and menu • Liaises with the kitchen and bar on daily operations, quality control and operational plans • Coordinates all venue repair and maintenance • Lead and maintain highest level of standard for customer experience • Conducts monthly inventory checks on all operating equipment and supplies • Meetings and Administration • Reporting to Director of Operations   •  • At least 5 years’ experience in Food & Beverage management • Proven ability to build partnerships and working relationships with employees, guests, community, suppliers & shareholders • Proven ability to lead and manage a medium team • Strong strategic and operational decision-making experience • Strong technical knowledge of ‘operating a venue’ • Is a hands-on manager and is present at all times in the outlet, especially during busy periods • Extremely organized and great communication skills • Proven roster and payroll management • Proven experience in operating a business through several business cycles with the ability to adjust business plans based on the learning obtained from those cyclical reviews •  • Discretionary Bonus • Medical Insurance • Work in a great team environment and for one of the most awarded restaurant groups in Hong Kong • Discounts in Maximal group venues • Great staff parties and team bonding   For further information about this position and to submit your application, please submit your application enclosing your full resume with current and expected salary by clicking “Apply

A contract employment will be offered to the successful candidate. Contract renewal will be subject to mutual agreement between the Club and the individual. How to Apply  Please send your resume, complete with expected salary and job reference  by clicking "Apply Now" button or to:  The Human Resources Department  The Hong Kong Jockey Club  1 Sports Road, Happy Valley  Hong Kong We are an equal opportunity employer. Personal data provided by job applicants will be used strictly in accordance with the Club's notice to employees and prospective employees relating to the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance. Additional Information Career Level Senior Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 5 years Employment Type Contract, Full Time Company Website Company details Founded in 1884, The Hong Kong Jockey Club is a world-class racing club that acts continuously for the betterment of our society. The Club has a unique integrated business model, comprising racing and racecourse entertainment, a membership club, responsible sports wagering and lottery, and charities and community contribution. Through this model, the Club generates economic and social value for the community and supports the Government in combatting illegal gambling. In 2017/18, the Club made a record return to the Government of HK$22.6 billion in duty and profits tax and contributed HK$1.2 billion to the Lotteries Fund. Approved charity donations were HK$4.2 billion. The Club is Hong Kong's largest single taxpayer and one of the city’s major employers. Its Charities Trust is also one of the world's top ten charity donors. The Club is always "riding high together for a better future" with the people of Hong Kong.    香港賽馬會（「馬會」）成立於1884年，是致力建設更美好社會的世界級賽馬機構。馬會透過其結合賽馬及馬場娛樂、會員會所、有節制體育博彩及獎券，以及慈善及社區貢獻的獨特綜合營運模式，創造經濟及社會價值，並協助政府打擊非法賭博。2017/18年度，馬會透過各項博彩稅及利得稅，為政府庫房帶來破紀錄的226億港元收入，並向獎券基金撥款12億港元。另外，已審批慈善捐款達42億港元。馬會是全港最大的單一納稅機構，也是香港主要僱主之一，其慈善信託基金位列全球十大慈善捐助機構。馬會將繼續與香港市民「同心同步同進　共創更好未來」。 More Jobs from this employer Part-time Research Assistant Posted on  1 hour ago Veterinary Pharmacy Technician (One-year temporary) Posted on  2 hours ago Part-Time Customer Relations Assistant (TRC) Posted on  3 hours ago View all jobs from this employer About JobsDB About jobsDB FAQ Career @ jobsDB Contact us Contact us International partners Bdjobs (Bandladesh) Brighter Monday (East Africa) Catho (Brazil) Jobberman (West Africa) JobStreet (S.E. title: M&A Tax Manager / Assistant Manager, Deal Advisory, M&A Tax
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs M&A Tax Manager / Assistant Manager, Deal Advisory, M&A Tax KPMG Central Salary provided Posted on 12 Apr 2019 M&A Tax Manager / Assistant Manager, Deal Advisory, M&A Tax KPMG Job Highlights Job Description Our Hong Kong M&A tax team advises on all aspects of an M&A transaction, including on the investment, divestment and post-acquisition stages.  We work with a range of clients, including multi-national corporations, high profile asset management companies, and  regional and global private equity funds. Our main focus is working with clients to manage their investment risks and identify opportunities in Hong Kong and abroad.  We work closely with our Transaction Services team and project and client teams are typically cross-disciplined. A large part of our work involves advising clients on regional and global projects, and provides exposure to international markets and high-profile transactions.    - Reporting directly to Partner / Director or Senior Manager / Manager , you will use your proven technical ability and utilise your client relationship skills to win and develop new business  - Working closely with internal and external clients on cross-border/M&A transactions, international tax advisory engagements, tax structuring and ad hoc projects  - Develop and implement innovative ways to approach client needs - use research into client businesses (the issues they face, the state of markets, key developments) to initiate new service and product offerings to clients.  - Undertake business development activities and market tax services to clients and non-clients.  - Keep abreast of new technical developments and solutions, and confidently market these applications to both clients and Partners  - You will be responsible for managing a group of people. - Delegate work to members of multiple teams, ensuring follow up strategies are in place.    - A degree in Accounting / Finance, law or any other business related discipline and ideally a professional qualification (accounting or legal)  - 3-7 years experience (including advisory) in a professional firm / Big 4 firm or as inhouse-tax advisor.  - Strong written and communication skills with the ability to communicate clearly and work with all levels of management - Excellent project management skills with the ability to work effectively under time critical deadlines  - Excellent organisation, analytical and problem-solving skills - A proven history of managing and developing others, developing business and acting autonomously. - Experience working on M&A transactions or cross-border transactions or in international tax is preferred - Proven ability to develop and manage people effectively through leadership, appropriate delegation, coaching and mentoring of staff  - Chinese (Mandarin or Cantonese) skills preferred, but not essential We offer successful candidates an attractive remuneration package and the opportunity to work in a dynamic and exciting environment.  Personal data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only.  © 2018 KPMG, a Hong Kong partnership and a member firm of the KPMG network of independent member firms affiliated with KPMG International Cooperative ("KPMG International"), a Swiss entity. Instead, we deliver both. Our team in Hong Kong is the fastest growing division within KPMG China and represents a young and enthusiastic team that always pushes itself to succeed. Since our creation, we've developed in-depth knowledge of an incredibly broad spread of sectors and services. We are looking for director candidate for our ITA Risk and Assurance service area. title: Senior Consultant, Financial Management
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Senior Consultant, Financial Management KPMG Central Salary provided Posted on 12 Apr 2019 Senior Consultant, Financial Management KPMG Job Highlights Job Description In Management Consulting, you’ll join a large and rapidly growing team, contributing to a range of projects that help clients address some of the biggest issues they’re facing in the boardroom. By helping them to add lasting value to the bottom line and make huge improvements in their performance, you’ll support them in transforming the way they do business. Our approach involves both strategy and implementation, which means we’re not just thinkers, but practical doers, creating client strategies that are designed to work in the real world. In Financial Management, we improve the effectiveness and efficiency of the finance function and generate real insights to help deliver value to the business. As digital disruption affects more industry sectors, Chief Financial Officers (CFOs) find it increasingly challenging to deliver sustainable growth in profits and dividends, whilst managing costs. Join this team and we can ensure you’re equipped to support and advise CFOs in this constantly changing world by training you in at least one of these capabilities: - How to develop a company’s finance strategy - Process improvement, including what good looks like for each of the key finance processes - Implementing systems changes specifically in cloud-based technology solutions, using our powered solution - Implementing process enhancement through digital and robotic technologies  - Organisational change and specifically designing and implementing a shared service centre - Regulatory changes Armed with these skills and supported to continue developing your expertise, you’ll help our Finance Transformation teams advise CFOs in one of these areas: -   - enabling finance to add more value to the business by improving processes such as business planning, forecasting and the provision of regular management information -   - enabling finance to deliver these services quicker, cheaper and with better controls -   - providing clients with the necessary guidance to meet the changing demands of regulation -   - enabling finance functions globally delivery a consistent level of cost effective service to all their customers / markets We are looking for a Senior Consultant candidate with prior experience as business analyst or PMO within the Finance area. Candidates with either experience in the commercial sector or a professional service firm will be considered. The individual will have - Experience in a Big 4 professional firm or Finance functions in a large corporation - Bachelor Degree in Business Administration, Commerce, Accounting or other related disciplines preferred - Accounting qualification (CPA, ACA, CIMA or equivalent) preferred - Experience supporting managers in project planning, scheduling, coordination and reporting activities - Ability to work closely with project managers to deliver high quality projects or assignments - Develop rapport and working relationships with working-level clients  - Ability to produce client ready deliverables that require limited review effort - Proficient in MS Office including Word, Excel and, in particular, PowerPoint - Strong written and verbal communication skills in English - Cantonese speaking candidates are preferred We offer successful candidates an attractive remuneration package and the opportunity to work in a dynamic and exciting environment. Instead, we deliver both. Our team in Hong Kong is the fastest growing division within KPMG China and represents a young and enthusiastic team that always pushes itself to succeed. Since our creation, we've developed in-depth knowledge of an incredibly broad spread of sectors and services. We are looking for Senior Consultant for our IT Risk and Assurance service area. The roles are client-focused and involve planning, supervising and delivering IT audit and assurance-based engagements for clients, including internal and external IT audits, IT assurance activities such as IT risk management and IT compliance reviews, They also involve providing IT advisory services to both public and private sector clients. The role entails being responsible for completing all aspects of the engagement lifecycle, including engagement execution and delivering, supervision and coaching of junior staff, transferring technical knowledge, writing reports, and communicating with engagement partners. Responsibilities - Plan and execute the day-to-day activities of IT audit and assurance engagements - Coach junior staff on engagements and provide proper feedback - Assist with scoping, financial management, delivery risk management and the initial review of deliverables - Identify and communicate IT audit findings to senior management and clients - Help identify performance improvement opportunities for assigned clients - Conduct fieldwork and manage small project teams to deliver value-added assurance services to clients - Develop internal networks and maintain excellent relationships with colleagues across KPMG, in particular in the wider Consulting, Audit and Advisory areas Qualifications - Proven experience of successfully delivering IT audit and assurance services (including external / internal audits) to clients within a Big Four firm (or 3 - 5 years' experience in any of the following areas: internal or external IT audit, risk assessment or business process reengineering) - Experience in business analysis and understanding of core business processes within industry sectors - Experience of systems environments within industry sectors - Recognised relevant qualification (e.g. CISA or HKICPA) - Bachelor's / Master's degree in an appropriate field from an accredited college / university - Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and Chinese (Mandarin or Cantonese) and exceptional interpersonal skills; able to gain the confidence and respect of senior level executives - Ability to identify and assess complex IT risks and controls, to relate them to the wider business environment and express opinions clearly to all levels of staff - Excellent reporting and presentation skills - Ability to deliver work within tight timelines, on budget and at a high level of quality - Strong teamwork ability and able to work independently We offer successful candidates an attractive remuneration package and the opportunity to work in a dynamic and exciting environment. title: DB Service Engineer Trainee
description:

 Requirements
 : Diploma or above in Computer Science or related discipline. working experience in ANY of followings : Oracle DB installation and configuration or Oracle RAC installation and configuration or DB2 database installation and configuration or Redhat Linux shell scripts or AIX Unix shell scripts or Docker container deployment or Openshift DevOps deployment Knowledgeable in database HA, DR solutions: RAC, Data Guard, HADR will be an advantages Willing to learn new technologies and software solutions Excellent communication skills in Cantonese and English Candidates with more experience can be considered to a senior position. Attractive
 salary package will be offered to the right candidate with excellent career development opportunities. Please submit your application IMMEDIATELY enclosing your full resume and expected salary to our company We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from all qualified candidates. The information provided will be treated in strict confidence and used only
 for consideration of application for relevant/similar post(s) within  our group. Applicants not having heard from us within 8 weeks from the date of this advertisement
 may consider their application unsuccessful. All personal data of unsuccessful applicants will be destroyed after the recruitment exercise when no longer required. Additional Information Career Level Entry Level Qualification Non-Degree Tertiary Industry Job Function Years of Experience 1 year Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Dental insurance, Five-day work week, Free shuttle bus, Life insurance, Medical insurance Company details Tech Data Computer Service is a premier IT solution provider that specializes in systems infrastructure, software solutions and professional services located in Hong Kong and Macau. The
 company was founded in 1982 and became part of  Tech Data Corporation  (Nasdaq: TECD) via acquisition in 2017. We serve as a vital link in the evolving technology ecosystem–we are essential to our customers’ success. Our innovative approach and proven experience in the data center, cloud computing,
 security, analytics, mobility, cognitive computing and IoT help customers create the solutions best suited to maximize business outcomes. Working in partnership with industry-leading technology partners, we have incredibly diverse end-to-end portfolio of products, services and solutions, highly specialized skills and expertise
 in next-generation technologies—all backed by a world-class team. We provide best-in-class service to customers across various industries, include banking and financial services, casino and resort, IT, logistics, manufacturing and distribution, government
 and public services. Tech Data is ranked No. 83 on the Fortune 500® and has been named one of Fortune’s “World’s Most Admired Companies” for eight straight years. We are seeking the best and brightest people to fill up the following position. Exciting opportunities will be offered to qualified job applicants. title: Senior Fund Accountant / Fund Officer
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Senior Fund Accountant / Fund Officer Intertrust Resources Management Limited Wan Chai Salary provided Posted on 12 Apr 2019 Senior Fund Accountant / Fund Officer Intertrust Resources Management Limited Job Highlights Job Description This role will be responsible to provide professional fund services to our clients. You will report directly to the Senior Manager of Fund
 Services Division. Review and process subscription applications Maintain financial books and records and reconcile bank accounts Allocate income to partners in accordance with terms of partnership agreements Prepare and issue quarterly financial statements, in accordance with US GAAP or IFRS Assist with year-end financial reporting and audit Prepare and distribute partner capital statements Calculate and process capital calls and distributions Interact with clients and counter-parties including auditors and tax representatives and provide information as needed Handle ad-hoc assignments Degree holder or above in Accounting, Finance, Economics or related discipline
 3-5 years of experience in  accounting and fund field (e.g. Big 4, fund house, fund administration etc.) Candidates with more experience will be considered as Fund Officer Qualified member or student member of HKICPA/ACCA or equivalent Good understanding in Private Equity/Real Estate funds operations Strong concept of accounting standard (IFRS/USGAAP) Strong knowledge in Investran is welcomed Fluent in both written and spoken English and Chinese, with conversational Mandarin Good team player, independent, meticulous, pro-active, attentive to details, self-motivated, keen to learn and able to adapt in
 new challenges and with excellent communication skills We offer Working at Intertrust means entering a dynamic, international and growth-orientated company.
 We provide you with outstanding opportunities for your professional and personal development through our local and global mobility exchange program, which enables talented employees to gain working experience abroad.  We offer a competitive salary and benefits,
 commensurate with your qualifications and experience. Interested? Interested candidates, please contact us at 2901 2115 for more information. We are looking forward to meeting you! We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from all qualified candidates.
 All personal data collected will be used for recruitment purpose only and will be destroyed within 6 months. Additional Information Career Level Middle Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 3 years Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Dental insurance, Education allowance, Five-day work week, Flexible working hours, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus Company details Intertrust is a global leader in providing expert administrative services to clients operating and investing in the international business environment. We enable
 global businesses to grow sustainably by helping our clients with their administrative challenges to grow and implement solutions to operate their business efficiently and responsibly. We have 2,500 specialists across 41 offices in 29 jurisdictions in Europe,
 the Americas, Asia and the Middle-East. We deliver high-quality, tailored corporate, fund, capital market and private wealth services to our clients, with a view to building long-term relationships. We work with global law firms and accountancy firms, multinational
 corporations, financial institutions, fund managers, high net worth individuals and family offices. Intertrust is  an Authorized Employer of the Hong Kong Institute of Certified Public Accountants (HKICPA) and Approved Employer
 of the Association of Chartered Certified Accountants (ACCA). To learn more about Intertrust Group, please visit our website at  https://www.intertrustgroup.com/ . If
 you are interested in taking the challenge and opportunity, please send your full resume with current and expected salary to  h . Collect and analyze all marketing information. Enhance customer relationships. Manage all activities and coordinate between Huawei and our service provider accounts. Identify key customer requirements and coordinate with Product Management and Engineering to ensure that these requirements are implemented in the products. Ability to understand the customer’s needs in order to design the desired solution.  Over 5 years direct IT experience with a proven track record in an international IT equipment company. Previous work experience at distributor or partners of IT vendor or experience at vendor such as IBM, HP, Dell, EMC, NetApp, Fujitsu, HDS and are a big plus. Have end to end experience of winning IT project Proven ability to partner with service providers and develop new business models for service subscribers using new technologies. Proven ability to manage customer accounts in cooperation with Sales management at CxO and technical level Proven track record of building long-term relationships with strategic enterprise accounts. title: Lead Solution Architect - Leading Financial Institution
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Lead Solution Architect - Leading Financial Institution Pinpoint Asia Limited Not Specified HK$90,000 - 120,000 /month (negotiable) Posted on 13 Apr 2019 Lead Solution Architect - Leading Financial Institution Pinpoint Asia Limited Job Highlights Job Description It is a fantastic opportunity to join a leading financial institution, our client is looking for a Lead Solution Architect. The selected candidate
 will be driving the technology innovations, architecture, standard and governance across the whole firm. Rare position with a great responsibility. Working directly with their Chief Architect and CTO. Responsibilities: Manage the Technology Architecture in establishing policies, standards, reference architecture, and roadmaps.
 Provide technical guidance and to business domain and technical domain architects in related to architecture activities.
 Provide technical advice to Chief Architect and CTO on various technology topics and aspects.
 Lead the creation of solution architectures considering business needs and technology limitations, with a selection of technology standards, describe configuration paradigms,
 and identify demand for reference architecture.  Drive global enterprise architecture goals, initiatives and IT standards across the group and Asia region.
 Identify latest Information Systems trends and emerging technologies, and provide recommendations for enhancements or modifications to existing applications and system where
 appropriate. Provide an assessment of associated risk and cost on related technology investment.
 Ability to see "the big picture" across the entire group and different business units from both technology and business aspects.
 Develop, communicate and deploy Enterprise Architecture Governance process with standards and policies.
 Required Skills/Experience: Extensive Information Systems design and delivery experience involving enterprise-level architecture, systems, and databases.
 Extensive experience with Enterprise Architecture.
 Proven ability to identify innovation opportunities, define and deliver innovative business function. Experience in working with multiple development methodologies including Waterfall, Agile etc.
 Experience in designing enterprise services across multiple domains in a large enterprise environment. 
 In-depth knowledge and practical experience in delivering service-oriented architecture (SOA) designs Experience in building enterprise Open-Cloud platform (AWS or Azure) is a great plus.
 Effective influence, negotiation and collaboration skills to work across counterparts and stakeholders.
 Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work effectively with all levels of the organization; Ability to draft high quality written products that
 are comprehensive, accurate, and tailored to the audience An innovative mindset, ability to identify and resolve complex project issues with new ideas.
 Experience with standard architecture methodologies such as TOGAF and Zachmann.   If this outstanding opportunity sounds like your next career move, please send your resume in Word format to
 at and put
 in the subject header. Data provided is for recruitment purposes only. title: Senior Accountant
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Senior Accountant Canadian Solar Energy Holding Company Limited Not Specified Salary provided Posted on 13 Apr 2019 Senior Accountant Canadian Solar Energy Holding Company Limited Job Highlights Job Description Canadian Solar Inc. (NASDAQ: CSIQ) is one of the three biggest solar companies in the world by revenue. We employ over 12,000 people and operate on 6 continents.
 We are committed to improving the lives of all those who interact with our brand in the communities we operate in. As a leading manufacturer of solar photovoltaic modules and provider of solar energy solutions, Canadian Solar also has a geographically diversified
 pipeline of utility-scale power projects in various stages of development. For more information of our company, please visit our website:  www.canadiansolar.com .   Work with various project development/project financing teams and understand project cost and funding structure; Develop weekly project cash flow forecast based on project cost and funding structure; Initiate and participate in various business meetings to understand the progress of a project in development, EPC and financing stage; Read through all the investment documents & memos and financial models to assess the profitability and funding requirement of an investment; Ensure the preparation of full set of accounts (AR, AP, daily book-keeping, bank reconciliation, inter-company transactions, forecast, cash flow statements, billing, inventory and costing)
 for management review; Develop and maintain monthly financial reporting, forecasts and budget packages; Deliver actionable items or recommendations based on findings through thorough research and analysis; Develop an effective process and ensure that all issues are adequately identified and driven to closure by working with relative owners in operations or finance; Prepare Accounting Memo for Project related transactions, for example, VIE assessment, Revenue recognition assessment and Lease assessment; Assist with regional consolidation reporting.   Qualifications and Experience: Bachelor degree or above in Accounting or Finance. Qualified Accountant with over 6 years of experience in financial analysis/accounting in a large MNC. Strong Excel skills and SAP experience is preferred. Strong communication skills in English. Ability to solve problems independently in a fast paced environment. Strong desire to learn and grow. Big 4 training or audit experience is an advantage. I nterested parties please send your full resume with Current and Expected Salary and Date of Availability by
 clicking "Apply Now"   Canadian Solar Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from all qualified candidates. Data collected will be treated in
 strict confidence and used for recruitment purpose only.      Additional Information Career Level Middle Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 6 years Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Dental insurance, Five-day work week, Medical insurance, Performance bonus About JobsDB About jobsDB FAQ Career @ jobsDB Contact us Contact us International partners Bdjobs (Bandladesh) Brighter Monday (East Africa) Catho (Brazil) Jobberman (West Africa) JobStreet (S.E. title: Uber Eats HK - Marketing Executive, CRM (Contract)
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Uber Eats HK - Marketing Executive, CRM (Contract) Uber (Asia) Limited Causeway Bay Salary negotiable Posted on 14 Apr 2019 Uber Eats HK - Marketing Executive, CRM (Contract) Uber (Asia) Limited Job Highlights Job Description At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the
 world. We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative
 spirit, work with us, and let’s move the world forward, together. About the role We’re looking for a passionate CRM marketing executive to engage eaters and enhance loyalty through CRM campaigns. You'll have the opportunity to work with a group of marketing
 professionals to shape and deliver a strategy that engages millions of consumers. We’re looking for candidates who are passionate about working with the city team on the next generation of Uber Eats CRM campaigns.  The
 ideal candidate will have a strong ability to think strategically and analytically about business and product opportunities. A keen sense of ownership, speedy execution, and scrappiness/hustle is a must. Job Description Design, plan, and execute weekly eater eDM strategy and content
 Collaborate with Ops and other teams to come up with the right content, message, and promotions (if any) Generate data-driven analysis on campaign efficiency and effectiveness to help evolve CRM strategy
 Assist CRM manager to track the performance and behavior of each segment. Based on data and results, design experiments to optimize promo structure, content, channels, and touch point
 frequency Ad-hoc marketing campaign or product launch eDMs Skills & Requirements Bachelor degree in any discipline. Major in Marketing, Data/Information Science, Statistics or Finance are preferred. Fresh Graduates & Candidates with ~1 year of experience are welcome Hands-on execution - be able to complete a project from end to end - from campaign design and planning to execution & tracking Analytical - Proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets is a must, SQL is a plus Experimental - Enjoy challenges & perform experiments and tracking with abundance of data Sense of ownership
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills
 Native in Cantonese/Traditional Chinese and business English Compensation Package & Perks Full-­time salary negotiable based on experience Ground floor opportunity with the team: shape the strategic direction of the company The rare opportunity to build a startup within a startup. We’re not just another social web app, we’re moving real people and assets and reinventing transportation and logistics globally Sharp, motivated co­-workers in a fun and relaxed office environment Free catering from Mon to Thu Notes: Please be reminded to include your resume, expected salary and available date in the application email Personal data will be used for recruitment purpose only Additional Information Career Level Entry Level Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience N/A Employment Type Contract, Full Time Benefits Dental insurance, Five-day work week, Flexible working hours, Medical insurance, Performance bonus, Transportation allowance Company details About JobsDB About jobsDB FAQ Career @ jobsDB Contact us Contact us International partners Bdjobs (Bandladesh) Brighter Monday (East Africa) Catho (Brazil) Jobberman (West Africa) JobStreet (S.E. title: Administrator  - General Management
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Administrator  - General Management Standard Chartered Bank Others Salary negotiable Posted on 15 Apr 2019 Administrator  - General Management Standard Chartered Bank Job Highlights Job Description The Role Purpose To manage and control the following centralized functions / areas of the Bank in Hong Kong, ensuring that services are delivered by either internal staff or vendors in the most efficient and cost effective manner, and in compliance with the agreed service levels and quality standards.   Correspondence handling Courier service   The Role Responsibilities Handle the incoming mails from various channels (i.e. Post Office, Courier, Client) and identify the recipient for further dispatching. Supervise the outsourced mailroom assistants. Respond to mail enquiry from department / branches. Prepare and maintain records for incoming courier and register mail. Provide support in handling of local and international courier shipment with courier vendor. Reconcile the daily postage meter and outward mail register on a daily basis. Maintain information files to facilitate the correspondence handling.  Assist in preparing journal entries for cost allocation. Data input and prepare periodic volume reports. Support ad hoc project, strategic initiatives and exercises aimed at improving or enhancing the team's performance. The Role Requirements Determine disposition of correspondence to the right individual or department. Review the effectiveness of mailroom service provided by vendor. Ensure accurate records of mails received. Maintain up to date information files.  Efficiently ensured acknowledgement of Inward Mail Register Adherence to the timeline to complete routine tasks and report submission. Ensure accurate output quality under the key responsibilities. Timely to respond and follow up the mail enquiry.  Constructive feedback for improving the process / service. title: Accountant / Senior Accountant, Regional Finance Team, Hong Kong
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Accountant / Senior Accountant, Regional Finance Team, Hong Kong  FTI Consulting (Hong Kong) Limited Quarry Bay Salary provided Posted on 15 Apr 2019 Accountant / Senior Accountant, Regional Finance Team, Hong Kong  FTI Consulting (Hong Kong) Limited Job Highlights Job Description Position Summary We are looking for bright, energetic and highly motivated individuals to join our growing regional Finance team. The successful candidate will need to apply strong accounting and taxation knowledge to complete month end close process and assist in statutory audits and tax filings. The candidate
 will have strong analytic skills to perform analysis on financial information and able to generate accurate management reports to facilitate the data analysis. Key Responsibilities Prepare month-end close journals. Prepare balance sheet reconciliations and accounting schedules on a monthly basis.
 Perform analytical reviews on financial results on a monthly basis.
 Prepare quarterly financial results packages for the U.S head office. Prepare audit schedules and liaise with auditors for completing statutory audits of Asia Pacific entities. Prepare or review annual and regular tax filings of Asia Pacific entities. Assist in maintaining internal controls in compliance with SOX. Involve in other ad-hoc duties or projects for the Asia Pacific Region as required. Respond to enquiries from and provide guidance to the offices in the Asia Pacific Region. Key Requirements Qualified accountant or degree holder majoring in Accountancy.
 3 - 6 years of related work experiences. MNC and/or Big 4 audit experience is highly preferred.
 High proficiency in Excel (Vlookup, pivot table, etc) and knowledge in Macro would be advantageous. Strong analytical and reporting skills, able to handle large volume of data. Good written skills in English and communication skills in both English and Mandarin/Cantonese. Self-motivated and able to work independently and meet tight deadlines. Meticulous with excellent attention to detail. Strong accounting and taxation knowledge in Hong Kong, Mainland China, Singapore and other Asian countries would be advantageous. Desirable Preference will be given to suitably qualified candidates who are available immediately.   Key Relationships This position reports to the Regional Finance Manager and will be working closely as a team member of the general accounting team. This position will liaise/interact closely with
 business segments and other APAC offices and communicate well with external professionals.   More experienced candidates will be considered as Senior Accountant. Additional Information Career Level Middle Qualification Not Specified Industry Job Function Years of Experience Not Specified Employment Type Full Time Benefits Five-day work week, Flexible working hours, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus Company Website Company details Company Background FTI Consulting, Inc. is a global business advisory firm dedicated to helping organisations protect and enhance enterprise value in an increasingly complex legal, regulatory
 and economic environment. With more than 4,600 employees located in 28 countries, FTI Consulting professionals work closely with clients to anticipate and manage all aspects of the risks they face: financial, transactional, operational, dispute, reputational,
 political and regulatory. In Asia, FTI Consulting has a team of more than 350 professionals situated in 10 business centres across the region. We deliver solutions through our market-leading business
 practices of Corporate Finance & Restructuring, Economic Consulting, Forensic & Litigation Consulting, Strategic Communications and Technology. Is it a big goal or small steps? Professional or personal? We’d like to know because at JLL, we make your ambitions our business. And if you have ambitions in Integrated Facilities Management, join us to be inspired by the best.    What this job involves: Lead the HR Services Team to provide high quality of shared services support covering the Greater Bay Area including Hong Kong, Macau, Taiwan and Southern China Manage the day-to-day HR operations throughout the employee life cycle including but not limited to employee on/off-boarding support, enquiries handling, employee movement, mobility support, HRIS management, L&D support, HR dashboard preparation, etc  Develop standard operation procedures to align and streamline operational procedures for achieving operational efficiency and productivity  Ensure adherence to risk, compliance, and data protection standards across designated process areas Partner closely with Regional/Greater China HR and other COE to facilitate the implementation of Global/Regional projects and initiatives   Sound like the job you’re looking for? Before you apply, it’s also worth knowing what we are looking for: Degree holder, preferably in Human Resources Management or Business Management  8 years of working experience with focus on HR service delivery, HR operations and HRIS management in sizeable multinational organizations covering Hong Kong, Macau, Taiwan and Southern China Self-motivated and committed to drive change Able to work in a dynamic and matrix business environment Effective problem solving & analytical skills Team player with excellent interpersonal and communication skills, especially in managing different stakeholders Well-versed in China, Hong Kong, Taiwan and Macau Employment Ordinance and HR practices Project management experience an advantage Good command of English and Mandarin   What you can expect from us You’ll join an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. One where we succeed together – across the desk and around the globe. Where like-minded people work naturally together to achieve great things. Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your ambitions in career, recognition, wellbeing, benefits and pay. We’ll offer you a competitive salary and benefits package.  Join us to develop your strengths and enjoy a fulfilling career full of varied experiences. Keep those ambitions in sights and imagine where JLL can take you...   Apply today! In 2017, JLL had revenue of $7.9 billion and fee revenue of $6.7 billion; managed 4.6 billion square feet, or 423 million square meters; and completed investment sales, acquisitions and finance transactions of approximately $170 billion. At the end of 2017, JLL had nearly 300 corporate offices, operations in over 80 countries and a global workforce of 82,000.  As of December 31, 2017, LaSalle had $58.1 billion of real estate assets under management. JLL is the brand name, and a registered trademark, of Jones Lang LaSalle Incorporated. For further information, visit  . JLL has over 50 years of experience in Asia Pacific, with over 37,000 employees operating in 96 offices in 16 countries across the region.  members bring their children to play, dine and relax.   Our food is super yummy! We don't have a separate children's menu at Maggie & Rose, just big and little portions. We cook as healthily as possible

 the brasserie team to ensure they deliver the Maggie & Rose service proposition, the next, helping a Club Member find a beloved toy in the soft play area. This is not a role for the faint hearted.  You will ace the daily running of the Brasserie while working with the Restaurant Manager
 and the Director of Food and Beverage, to ensure we are delighting our members, all in a day's work for our Restaurant Manager.  As Restaurant Supervisor/Assistant Manager, you play an important role in providing a
 warm welcome to members and guests, as well as fast, efficient, and friendly service. You will also ensure our littlest members are provided with a great experience to ensure they have enough energy to get on with the serious business of playing in our Clubs.  You are the epitome of our core values - Be Extraordinary, Support & Nurture, Think Visually and Inspire Creativity. We offer 5.5 day work week ( weekend and public holiday work will be required),
 competitive remuneration and medical benefits for full time staff. Interested parties please send full resume with availability and expected salary by clicking "Apply Now". title: Teacher
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Teacher Maggie & Rose Hong Kong Limited Not Specified Salary provided Posted on 15 Apr 2019 Teacher Maggie & Rose Hong Kong Limited Job Highlights Job Description Maggie & Rose is a family lifestyle brand, with the first family members' club established in London in September
 2006.  It has 2 sites in London and is a becoming a high-end international brand with branches open in China and Singapore.  We provide a home away from home for families, run amazingly creative classes and put on the best kid’s birthday parties ever. With
 all that on the go, we're on the lookout for energetic and passionate individuals for our clubs in Repulse Bay and Causeway Bay. Maggie & Rose is THE family member’s club with awesome class activities for children.
 We need outgoing, creative, entertaining, and reliable teachers to join our team. This is a diverse role
 where no two days are ever the same. Role:
 Class Teacher You will be responsible for delivering
 our art, music, cooking and creative play classes. Our innovative, educational, and lively classes take little people on big adventures.  
 Priorities:  You will work with children from
 6 months up to eight years old and their parents. The classes require lots of giggles, energy, and fun for all involved. The activities involve a mixture of singing, art, role play, dancing, cooking and games. When not in the classroom, you will assist with
 events, birthday parties as well as doing administrative tasks. 
 Key
 Tasks: Ensure all classes are of a very high standard. 
 Be ‘the face’ of all classes that you teach for members and staff, upholding the Maggie & Rose ethos and values.
 Compliance with all regulatory requirements.  
 Duties
 and Responsibilities: Be prepared and an organised teacher; fully planning and understanding lesson plans, ensuring you have all the equipment/ingredients/materials
 for your lessons, as well as adding your own ideas to extend activities.   Take good care of your teaching space/kitchen ensuring that it’s tidy, safe and clean at all times. Keep on top of re-ordering supplies and replenishing anything that is broken or needs replacing. You must look ahead
 of lesson plans and ensure you have all the ingredients/materials and props you need for the term you are about to teach. 
 Provide a safe and secure environment for participants in your class. 
 Make imaginative use of ingredients/materials and be productive with your ideas and approach.  Updating and adding notes to lesson plans to keep the classes current and fresh as well as keeping photographic records
 of your set up and work.   Noticing children’s progress in your classes and advising when it’s time for them to move up to a more advanced class. 
 Having the ability to assess a difficult situation in the classroom and solve it in a calm and professional manner. 
 Participate in staff meetings and communicate well with the team. 
 Assist in the planning and organising of the teaching timetable, class scheduling, prepping and promotion of term classes
 and holiday camps and classes.   Take interest in all other aspects of the club. Assist in club events, parties and seasonal activities.  
 Take pride in everything you do and show strong leadership skills in class.
 Understand the key words and phrases that should be used throughout your classes.
 Make sure you are fully aware of health & safety and fire procedures, where your nearest first aid box, accident book
 is and what the right protocols are in certain situations such as fires or accidents.  
 Skills
 and Experience: A Maggie & Rose teacher must be a super creative, insanely enthusiastic and incredibly organised team member,
 able to deliver unique arts classes and following the Maggie & Rose core values:
 Think Visually 
 Inspire Creativity 
 Be Extraordinary 
 Support & Nurture  You’ll be able to perform and produce magical, creative and innovative classes for children of all ages. 
 Y ou
 should have knowledge of nursery rhymes and basic art to do well in this role.   If you’ve got some experience in customer services and teaching that would be an advantage too. 
 Good knowledge and love for cooking as well as an understanding of food health and hygiene.
 Experience working with children, especially pre-school age groups. 
 You’ll be super confident with the ability to interact with both adults and children. 
 You’ll have a strong speaking voice, good singing voice and above all a happy disposition and super positive attitude. 
 Some weekend and public holiday work required Reference checks are required if you’re successful  To apply, please submit with your cv by clicking "Apply Now". Personal data collected will be used for recruitment purpose only. title: Web Front End Developer (Data Team)
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Web Front End Developer (Data Team) Ztore HK Limited Lai Chi Kok Salary provided Posted on 16 Apr 2019 Web Front End Developer (Data Team) Ztore HK Limited Job Highlights Job Description Our data team has developed mature data infrastructure, analytics products, and machine learning models. Now is your turn to help build web interfaces to let both our internal teams and customers to consume and interact with these data products.    As a passionate front-end developer, you will work with data scientists, analysts, and data engineers in the team, as well as gather user requirements from other business units to plan and develop the web applications. As a part of the R&D team, you will be working with the latest technologies.   Responsibilities Work with different business units to plan and develop data-rich web interface for internal teams, to: Serve data products for business managers to analyse Allow business users to interact with data products, including setting up automation workflows Develop a customer-facing web application, at prototype/alpha stage. The application will feature dynamic UI to utilize the personalization engine developed in our team  Required Skills & Qualifications Bachelor’s degree 1-2 years of experience in web front end development. Fresh graduates are welcome Any modern JS framework (React/Angular/Vue)  Capable of developing a web front end independently Experience with deployment on cloud platforms is a plus Candidates with all-rounded experience would be considered as full-stack developer The Ideal Candidate You are a competent developer that is looking to utilize cutting edge technology in your projects (cloud environment, machine learning, big data) You have strong passion for UX design You enjoy building applications in their entirety What you will learn You will learn these on the go. It would be a plus if you already know some of them, but they are not required.  Data visualization libraries (D3.js, Plotly) Deployment on cloud platforms (e.g. AWS, GCP) Deployment with Docker  Microservice architecture Digital analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics, Facebook Business Insights) Production level programming practises (e.g. version control, error handling, deployment) Our Stack Python (tensorflow, flask), Scala, R, Node.js (express) Machine Learning: Recommender system, neural network, item embedding, time series forecasting, unbalanced classification Database: MySQL (MariaDB, Aurora)/DynamoDB/MongoDB/BigQuery Distributed stream processing: Apache Beam/Kinesis/Pub Sub Analytics: Tableau DevOps: Docker, ECS What do we offer? Support for learning (Opportunities to attend workshops during working hour, allowance for self-learning, and a team to grow together) Flexibility in assigning tasks to meet your learning and career goals 5-day work Flexible working hour Competitive remuneration   If you are interested, please provide your: CV Cover letter (optional) Current and expected salary Availability Past projects (Github repo or other formats, optional) Additional Information Career Level Not Specified Qualification Not Specified Industry Job Function Years of Experience Not Specified Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Five-day work week, Flexible working hours, Medical insurance, Overtime pay Company details ZTORE  士多  ( ) Our vision is to Deliver A Better Living to our customers through choices that really matter and excellent service.  Ztore has an innovative and open-minded culture.  Ztore blends the Traditional Values with cutting-edge technology.  We develop our people by empowering them with decision-making authorities in everyday-life at Ztore. Ztore is undergoing rapid expansion and we are looking forward to you joining our energetic and creative team. title: Head of IT Audit
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Head of IT Audit Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd Lantau Island Salary provided Posted on 16 Apr 2019 Head of IT Audit Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd Job Highlights Job Description  Group Head of Internal Audit  Internal Audit (IAU) Internal Audit’s mission is to be a high performing, engaged team, protecting and enhancing the business’s value through risk-based and independent assurance,
 advice and insight. This is the third newly-created role within the team in the last two years as the business continues to invest more in the function. The role will be responsible
 for engaging senior stakeholders and managing a co-source relationship with Big 4 audit firms to ensure internal audit’s work provides sufficient coverage across the Cathay Group’s risks. Key Responsibilities Manage the identification and evaluation of the organisation’s risk areas and provide major input to the development of the
 annual audit plan and the risk register process Develop and maintain productive and engaged staff and stakeholder relationships up to Executive Director level through individual
 contacts and group meetings Perform complex level professional IT audit work which involves managing or conducting audit projects as well as providing consulting
 services to the organisation’s management Work independently under general direction with extensive latitude for initiative and independent judgement Provide training, coaching and supervision to internal audit staff Manage the performance of audit procedures, including identifying and defining risks and reviewing and analysing evidence Manage the audit staff (including external/internal guest auditors) in conducting meetings, reviewing documents, preparing working
 papers and identifying and developing audit issues/recommendations Communicate the results of audit and consulting projects via written reports and oral presentations to senior management up
 to Executive Director level Ensure reporting to the Audit Committee is of a high quality standard Pursue professional development opportunities, including external and internal training and professional association memberships,
 and share information gained with team Drive change within the Internal Audit function including suggesting and implementing improvements to ways of working Maintain all organisational and professional ethical standards within the department Requirements Degree from reputable institution and professional IT auditing qualification such as CISA or equivalent designation
 Minimum 10 years broad IT Audit experience in internationally recognized accounting firms or in-house roles At least 5 years’ experience in supervisory role Excellent knowledge of IT infrastructure and application systems, cybersecurity, related regulatory requirements and emerging
 risks Experience of working closely with Senior Management Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to convince and influence others Commercially focused Strong analytical and report writing skills A team leader who is self-initiated, independent and able to meet tight schedules Ability to create and maintain good working relationships with teammates and all levels of staff members from various business
 units Excellent command of English Desirable: experience of setting up a new IT audit function / transforming an existing function Key Competencies Setting Direction Leading and Engaging Teams Driving Business Performance and Change Developing and Recognising Others Application deadline: 30 April 2019 Cathay Pacific is an Equal Opportunities Employer. Personal data provided by job applicants will be used
 strictly in accordance with our personal data policy and for recruitment purposes only. Candidates not notified within eight weeks may consider their application unsuccessful. All related information will be kept in our file for up to 24 months. A copy of
 our Personal Information Collection Statement will be provided upon request by contacting our Data Protection Officer.

 etc.; Responsible for requirement collections and specifications with business users, and prepare technical specification
 according to the requirements; Identify business users' objectives, process, products and services through business analysis activities; Prepare product design documentation, procedures manuals and training materials;
 Conduct testing to ensure the systems is well developed according to the requirements; Coordinate and manage UAT with users, and maintain related documentation and training for users; Keep track of change requests and consolidate with system change priority; Deliver user training, go-live & post implementation support; Liaise with external vendors along the development and maintenance of application solutions; Acting as the bridge between internal user and vendor to clarify system requirements; Assist project manager on project scope, estimation and planning.   Requirements: University degree holder or above in Computer Science, Information Technology or related discipline; At least 2 years solid experience in building/construction industry or large-scale development; Experience in construction project cost management solution will be an advantage; Experience in delivery the full SDLC model in Agile / Waterfall framework; Strong analytical and problem-solving skills are required; Experience in Microsoft SQL, ASP.Net MVC will be an advantage; Relevant experience in AI / IoT / Cloud / Big Data / Machine Learning / BIM integration will be an advantage; Proficiency in MS Office tools (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Projects); Excellent communication and interpersonal skills; Fluency in verbal and written English and Chinese communications essential, including Putonghua; Self-motivated, possess analytical-mind and creative/excellent problem-solving skills; Occasionally travel to PRC is required.   We offer competitive remuneration, 5 days work, life insurance, hospitalization and outpatient medical schemes, and other fringe benefits
 to the right candidate. Interested candidates, please forward your full resume with current and expected salary to Human Resources Department at 9/F, New World Tower 1, 18 Queen’s Road Central, Hong Kong or by e-mail.  14 days’ annual leave, excellent career prospects & attractive remuneration to the right candidate. Interested applicants please submit your CV to mtang @me-consulting.com.hk    1.    Solution

 services such that to create more business opportunities for all clients Pre-sales support on IT solution        Requirements: Degree or above in IT or any relevant disciplines Minimum 6 years' of relevant working experience, with 3 years' experience in IT consultant role is a must Familiar with IT solution technologies (e.g. Virtualization, SAN technology and etc) Solid experience in enterprise IT infrastructure (e.g. Windows, RedHat Linux, UNIX, AS400, hyper-v, VMware, SAN
 storage, Network) Solid experience to deal with clients, getting requirements from business users and/or senior IT management Solid experience to design Virtualization (VMware, hyper-v, Xen server) solution Good command of both written and spoken English and Chinese Self-motivated, independent, good presentation & negotiation skills and able to work under pressure Solid experience to response Government Tender is an advantage Candidate with less experience will be

 of projects Perform detailed analysis of requirements and solutions to ensure effectiveness, relevance, accuracy and robust controls Work closely with customer experience and development teams Produce technical specification for custom development and systems integration requirements Perform and support various testing activities including unit testing, integration testing and user acceptance testing Develop and analyze digital solution options based on business demand Ensure solutions are salable and meet overall business requirements, translating clients’ requirements into architectural
 designs and technology solutions Key Competencies & Requirement Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or related disciplines Experience in enterprise applications design, development, deployment and integration Hands-on experience of programming language in Python/ Java/ C#/ PHP/ .Net is an advantage Willingness to be a challenger to the traditional way Good command of spoken and written English and Cantonese, Mandarin. A minimum of 10 years’ relevant experience in digital solution consulting or development or a production IT environment
 managing enterprise IT infrastructure, hardware, hosting service and network areas. Ability to write architectural design documents or review design documents provided by others. Knowledge and understanding of industry trends and new technologies and ability to apply trends to architectural
 needs Experience in architecture and solutioning of enterprise applications (Cloud-based platforms like AWS, AliCloud)
 and digital capabilities (e.g. APIs, microservices architecture) Experience in working with ICT enterprises, System Integrators, and Consulting firms as solution partners is preferred Experience in concepts, principles and implementation approaches of service oriented architecture (digital) is
 an advantage Experience with Lean UX Design Thinking is an advantage but not essential 1)    
   Lead Presales Consultant – Application Development (IoT / Digital Service) Duty Lead a team to maximize company revenue through exploring business opportunities Lead a business discussion, influence client's decisions and establish / maintain good relationship with clients Obtain and review client’s requirements as to propose the best-fit solutions to fulfill client’s needs Act as a liaison between the IT and business community to make sure the proposed technology can meet the project goals Work with external partners and internal departments and line of business to formulate solution proposal Respond to RFI / tender and responsible for technical write-up, translation of functional and non-functional requirements into a solution design and Scope of Work Responsible for the overall design and architecture of the project delivery Prepare and deliver demonstration / presentation to customers and partners Work with the partners on architectural design, solution planning and feasibility study on infrastructure which included Cloud Computing Services and IoT Technology
 development, etc.   quirement Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related disciplines
 A minimum of 5 years’ experience in IT profession
 Solid technical knowledge is preferred in one of the following areas: Knowledgeable and experienced in systems analysis and design and the overall SDLC
 Application Frameworks for IoT, M2M device integration, web/mobile digital services and APIs

 Development Tools/Environments, e.g. Linux, Eclipse, Git, Maven, Jenkins, Docker, etc.

 Excellent presentation, communication and interpersonal skills Result-oriented, self-motivated and able to work independently Positive attitude, fast-learning, energetic, able to perform in challenging environment Good commend of spoken English and Cantonese   Solution Consultant (Presales CRM) Explore business opportunities and turn them into revenues Lead a business discussion, influence client's decisions and establish / maintain good relationship with clients Obtain and review client’s requirements as to propose the best-fit solutions to fulfill client’s needs Act as a liaison between the IT and business community to make sure the proposed technology can meet the project goals Work with external partners and internal departments and line of business to formulate solution proposal

 and Scope of Work Lead the overall design and architecture of the project delivery

 CRM / SugarCRM Possess technical knowledge of one of the following areas: (Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Marketing Cloud, Community Cloud, Salesforce Platform, Heroku, Lightning)   (Microsoft Dynamics CRM and Microsoft Dynamics 365)  (Oracle Siebel, Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Marketing Cloud, CRM Analytics)  (SAP C/4HANA, Sales, Marketing, Service) Excellent presentation, communication and interpersonal skills Result-oriented, self-motivated and able to work independently Positive attitude, fast-learning, energetic, able to perform in challenging environment A good team player with analytical & problem-solving skills, self-motivation and good interpersonal skills Good command of spoken and written English and Chinese 3. 
 Pre-sales Consultant (Cloud Solutions) R esponsibilities: Work closely with sales team to identify and develop opportunities; Align with internal parties for technical materials including sales presentations, proposals, demonstrations, Proof of Concept and tender bidding Engage in project delivery with project managers and engineers   University graduate in Information Technology or related discipline. Minimum 3 years’ of pre-sales experience in Cloud solutions Excellent communication and presentation skills to technical & non-technical audience Experience in selling cycle of Azure, AWS and/or GCP Familiar with HyperV and VMware environment, holder of VCP is a plus.  and Scope of Work Lead the overall design and architecture of the project delivery
 Source vendors and obtain quotations to meet the customers’ budgets Prepare and deliver demonstration / presentation to customers and partners  Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or related disciplines A minimum of 5 years’ relevant experience in specific functional domains in SAP. Possess technical knowledge of one of the following areas: (SAP S/4HANA, SAP S/4HAHA Cloud, SAP Business One)  (SAP Core HR and Payroll, SAP SuccessFactors, SAP Fieldglass)  (SAP Ariba) (SAP HANA, SAP ABAP, SAP NetWeaver, SAP Leonardo) Excellent presentation, communication and interpersonal skills Result-oriented, self-motivated and able to work independently Positive attitude, fast-learning, energetic, able to perform in challenging environment A good team player with analytical & problem-solving skills, self-motivation and good interpersonal skills Good command of spoken and written English and Chinese   Explore business opportunities and turn them into revenues Lead a business discussion, influence client's decisions and establish / maintain good relationship with clients Obtain and review client’s functional and technical requirements as to propose the best-fit solutions to fulfill client’s needs Act as a liaison between the IT and business community to make sure the proposed technology can meet the project goals Work with external suppliers/partners/subcontractors and internal departments and line of business to formulate solution proposal Respond to RFI / tender and responsible for technical write-up, translation of functional and non-functional requirements into a solution design and Scope of Work Lead the overall design and architecture of the project delivery Source vendors and obtain quotations to meet the customers’ budgets Prepare and deliver demonstration / presentation to customers and partners  Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or related disciplines A minimum of 3 years’ relevant experience in either (a) network security solutions such as firewall, NIPS / NIDS, anti-malware, HIPS/IDS, SSLVPN, advanced persistent threat (APT) protection,
 protection against Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS); (b) system security solutions such as cyber security, privileged identity management and various encryption methodologies; (c) network technologies such as Software-Defined Networking (SDN). Qualification in security (such as CISSP, CISM) and network (CCNA, CCNP, HCNA, HCNP) is preferred Experience in IT security audit or compliance (such as security risk assessment and security audit, ISO27001) is preferred Excellent presentation, communication and interpersonal skills Result-oriented, self-motivated and able to work independently Positive attitude, fast-learning, energetic, able to perform in challenging environment A good team player with analytical & problem-solving skills, self-motivation and good interpersonal skills Good commend of spoken and written English and Chinese   5.    Sales Manager (AV/ELV)    Requirement Degree holder preferably in Engineering, IT, Computer Science, Business or related disciplines A minimum of 5 years experience in sales or consulting capacity Sales experience in the AV, ELV solutions is required, experience in selling anyone of AV/ELV solutions, business process outsourcing, data center/cloud services
 or enterprise applications is highly preferred Strong relationship with Building developers, consultants and E & M contractors Strong acquaintance in clients’ business, up-to-date technology and ELV trend Strong in account management will be a big plus Capable of working independently and establishing relationship with decision makers and senior executives An outspoken, mature, resourceful and aggressive person with strong commitment to deliver excellent result Good presentation, interpersonal and communication skills Good command of verbal and written English & Chinese including Putonghua   6.   Sales Manager (Data center)      Requirement Degree holder preferably in IT, Computer Science, Business or related disciplines A minimum of 10 years experience  in sales or consulting capacity Sales experience in the IT solutions is required, experience in selling data center/cloud services and related managed services is highly preferred Strong acquaintance in clients’ business, up-to-date technology and ICT/e-business trend Strong in account management will be a big plus Capable of working independently and establishing relationship with decision makers and senior executives An outspoken, mature, resourceful and aggressive person with strong commitment to deliver excellent result Good presentation, interpersonal and communication skills Good command of verbal and written English & Chinese including Putonghua Candidates with less experience will also be considered   7.

 (SDLC). Degree holder in Computer Science, Information Technology or related disciplines; Minimum 11 years experience in IT profession with minimum 5 years experience in project management; Possesses certification in PRINCE 2 or PMP; Possessing technical knowledge of JavaEE and / or .Net will be a definite advantage Knowledgeable in managing projects using Agile Methodology will be an added advantage; Experienced in managing virtual teams, adopting best practices of Global Delivery Model; Effective verbal and written communication in English and Chinese; Good leadership, analytical, inter-personal and problem solving skills. Positive attitude, fast-learning, energetic, able to perform in challenging environment;   Additional Information Career Level Not Specified Qualification Not Specified Industry Job Function Years of Experience Not Specified Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Company details M TEL Career Consulting  provides recruitment services to our prestigious clients in
 the Information Technology and Engineering industries. Our services managers have over 20 years of working experience in these industries and they are well qualified to serve the industries with postgraduate qualifications in business management.

description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs .NET / C# Developer  TransUnion Limited Tsim Sha Tsui Salary negotiable Posted on 16 Apr 2019 .NET / C# Developer  TransUnion Limited Job Highlights Job Description Leveraging off Big Data, implementation of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and other cutting-edge technologies, an exciting opportunity has presented itself within Transunion’s growing operations in APAC. As a .Net / C# Developer you will support the growth of the business by implementing innovative ideas and getting involved in the production of latest fin-tech products. Work closely with the Team Leader / Application Manager and users to develop, support and roll out application systems Participate in system and database design  Responsible for system development, implementation and testing  Provide application support and technical trouble-shooting for system enhancement and maintenance  Mainly focus on developing data analytics & data-driven decision-making application  Review program source code & SQL provided from software vendors University graduate in Computer Science or related disciplines  1 - 5 years of work experience with .NET development / support Hands-on experience in MS Visual Studio, ASP.NET, C#/VB.NET, MVC Experience with troubleshooting, debugging, bug fixing, unit testing and quality assurance is a plus  Knowledge on Entity Framework & AngularJS is an advantage  Knowledge on SQL Server 2008/2012 e.g. Stored Procedure, SQL, DTS is a plus Knowledge of Microsoft Technology, including MS.NET Framework, IIS, Active Directory, NTFS is an advantage  Good interpersonal skills and problem-solving skills  Fresh Graduates will be considered     A global leader in credit information and information management services, TransUnion gives businesses, consumers and the global community the power to achieve their goals. Businesses count on us to better manage risk and customer relationships. Consumers are able to better manage credit to achieve their financial goals. And in communities around the world we help build strong economies and give people the power to achieve their dreams. Exceptional opportunities are coming as we build on this strong foundation. Our ambitious growth strategy includes substantial new investment worldwide, a wide range of new solutions to help our customers succeed like never before, and new ideas for expanding our reach in every part of our dynamic and fast-moving industry. We’re on an exciting journey and you can be a part of it. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
