title: Manager, Regulatory Reporting
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Manager, Regulatory Reporting Standard Chartered Bank Others HK$45,000 - 70,000 /month Posted on 17 Apr 2019 Manager, Regulatory Reporting Standard Chartered Bank Job Highlights Job Description About Standard Chartered  We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East.    To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good.    We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base.   Provide timely and accurate financial and non-financial information of the Bank to local regulators and to Group as required. Ensure that an effective and efficient internal control system is in place for the returns submission, and that the reporting requirements and completion guidelines set by regulatory bodies are complied with. Carry out on-going maintenance and enhancement of the reporting systems as required. Identify areas to improve efficiency and quality in reporting to the regulators. This may involve planning and implementing necessary changes and system enhancements Participate in projects to improve integrity of data in various transaction processing systems and to address regulatory reporting issues. Qualified accountant Familiarize with the HKMA reporting requirements with at least 5 years of relevant experience  Good problem solving skill Excellent negotiation and presentation skills are required to deal with different stakeholders Excellent communication skills, conversant in both spoken and written English Strong PC /Excel applications skills   Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions. title: Senior / Application Support Analyst (Level 2)
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Senior / Application Support Analyst (Level 2) TransUnion Limited Tsim Sha Tsui Salary negotiable Posted on 17 Apr 2019 Senior / Application Support Analyst (Level 2) TransUnion Limited Job Highlights Job Description At TransUnion, we believe in building great products using the latest modern technologies, including implementing many current open source frameworks. Do you want to work around a true big data environment? How about helping us determine how to best develop solutions with our petabytes of data? Quality Analysts are a critical and key component to our success. Each engineer can be responsible for leading one to many core applications across TransUnion Hong Kong with the primary responsibility to identify and build “best in class” testing approaches to ensure the quality of our applications. TransUnion Hong Kong is transforming itself and if you want to be a part of setting technical direction at a large data driven company then this is the place for you!   The candidate will be responsible for the ongoing production support, operations, maintenance, and enhancements of various customer solutions/applications across countries within Asia Pacific in accordance to the prescribed Service Level Agreements.  He will actively participate, and at times, lead in the restoration process of the service, conduct of root cause analysis, and is responsible for preparing/writing technical specifications or other relevant documentation.  His interaction includes dealing with external customers and internal or cross-functional teams within TransUnion.   Provide 2  level of application production support to each participating countries of Asia Pacific through stand-by on call and remote system access support Responsible for the diagnosis, repair, recovery, restoration and resolution of reported incidents within the prescribed SLA. Implement changes/fixes following the defined change management process Responsible for delivering enhancements on existing application systems according to the customers signed-off specifications/requirements Assist local IT/technical staff to deliver first level system application support Monitor and maintain application systems health performance to each of participating countries of Asia Pacific to ensure stable system, processes are in good shape, and with minimal business operations interruption. If need be, modifies the solution/applications systems to improve performance, if there are any signs of degradation of the service or the solution/application systems. Provide software technical support to internal, external users including vendor software package support or TransUnion product upgrades Perform root cause analysis, and identify, implement and document corrective and preventive actions/measures to escalated issues/problems Execute service requests within the prescribed SLA At times, he will also be asked to participate as a developer for customer implementations, project deliveries or internal automation projects. Perform other related duties as assigned Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science/Related engineering degree/MCA and equivalent work experience in a technical environment. Must have a hands-on, working experience of at least 3 to 5 years in a similar role, preferably following the IT Service Management framework.  ITIL Certification is a Plus. Must have experience on web site development, back-end development or web services Work experience should include troubleshooting, debugging, bug fixing, unit testing and quality assurance. Good communication skills, both written or spoken, using both local HK language and English Domain knowledge on credit management or decisioning systems for financial institution and utilities industries is s Plus. Experience in .NET, C#, SQL, XML, SOAP, WSDL is a plus. Experience with multiple applications servers (Websphere, Jboss, tomcat, weblogic) and RDBMS (Informix, DB2 or Oracle) is preferable.   A global leader in credit information and information management services, TransUnion gives businesses, consumers and the global community the power to achieve their goals. Businesses count on us to better manage risk and customer relationships. Consumers are able to better manage credit to achieve their financial goals. And in communities around the world we help build strong economies and give people the power to achieve their dreams. Exceptional opportunities are coming as we build on this strong foundation. Our ambitious growth strategy includes substantial new investment worldwide, a wide range of new solutions to help our customers succeed like never before, and new ideas for expanding our reach in every part of our dynamic and fast-moving industry. We’re on an exciting journey and you can be a part of it. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Interested candidates, please forward your resume and indicate current and expected salary by clicking apply now below Data collected will be treated in strict confidence and used for recruitment purposes only. You can also visit our LinkedIN career page at     Additional Information Career Level Middle Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 5 years Employment Type Full Time Benefits Dental insurance, Double pay, Five-day work week, Medical insurance, Performance bonus, Work from home Company details TransUnion  is a global leader in credit information and information management services. For more than 40 years, we have worked with businesses and consumers to gather, analyze and deliver the critical information needed to build strong economies throughout the world. Our dedicated associates provide solutions to approximately 45,000 businesses and approximately 500 million consumers worldwide.  We are  seeking to engage top talents to join our workforce in aggressive expansion of new Business Lines.  We pride ourselves in our corporate culture of multi-dimensional people management and development and have many employees enjoy a long term, satisfying and enriching career with us! title: Identity and Fraud Solutions Product Manager
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Identity and Fraud Solutions Product Manager TransUnion Limited Tsim Sha Tsui Salary negotiable Posted on 26 Mar 2019 Identity and Fraud Solutions Product Manager TransUnion Limited Job Highlights Job Description Dynamics of the Role Riding on the development of the Fintech industry in HK and the recent HKMA Smart Banking, Virtual Banking initiatives, TransUnion has launched a series of business solutions addressing some common industry challenges in the areas of risk management and regulatory compliance as well as enabling modern mobile customer experience.  We have gained a lot of tractions from the market since we launched the solution in 2017 and we are expanding our team in order to support the growth of the business and the ongoing enhancements of the solution. This position will be responsible for ensuring HK’s Identity and Fraud solutions are meeting revenue, profitability goals as well as business performance metrics that satisfy our clients. This includes being responsible for overseeing the defining, analyzing and writing of the business requirements for small to large product management projects. This position will understand the business and/or customer needs through research, usability studies and analyzing available data, as well as seek out new ways to augment this data.  This position will base strategic decisions through a defensible, metrics-driven approach based on ROI, market and customer feedback and analysis of the user experience. In addition, this position provides leadership and initiative within the unit by understanding the industry and its’ strategic direction. How You’ll Contribute Monitors and analyzes product key performance indicators, customer feedback, and the competitive landscape to identify gaps, weaknesses and opportunities in any part of the product delivery. Prioritizes enhancements based on ROI and works with Project Management to develop release schedules and updates the product roadmap accordingly. Manages Business Analysts in the creation of business requirements necessary to achieve the objectives of new enhancements and related product management projects which includes the development of process flow chart diagrams, use cases and user stories. Analyzes the overall nature of the need in terms of feasibility, cost-effectiveness, usability, and practicality.  Meets with Director to provide recommendations and the necessary steps to achieve goals.  May be also required to develop project overviews, budget requirements, and other documentation necessary for a project to proceed.. Meets with Director to provide updates on projects.  Resolves any issues that may result.  Follows through on any suggestions and/or recommendations.  Participates in review sessions with internal departments.  Answers any questions and/or concerns as they occur.  Updates documentation to reflect any changes as they occur.   Conducts user acceptance testing prior to enhancement and product launches. Researches and analyzes the market directly and manages research vendors. Continually monitors the process of the projects ensuring the information is clarified, issues resolved, and process follows previously established timeframes. Following completion of projects, quantifies its impact on revenue, conversion, retention, and profitability. Develops and communicates product strategy across the organization. Performs other related duties as assigned. What You’ll Bring   A Bachelor’s degree required in MIS, Computer Science or other related fields.  Requires a minimum of 3+ years of experience in Product Management and/or Business Analysis for mobile-based consumer facing applications or corporate business solutions. The incumbent must also have a solid knowledge of the industry, business operations, and the integration of them in order to effectively develop work flow processes, determine the feasibility of the project through a business perspective, and communicate these needs to a technical staff.   Experience and knowledge in the areas of machine learning and biometrics will be a big bonus. Experience in digital account opening and transaction fraud or payment fraud experience will be a plus. Excellent oral and written communication.   Must be a problem solver with a ‘get it done’ attitude and strong self-motivated.  Ability to think innovatively and drive changes.  Ability to handle multiple tasks at one time.  Has ability to seek opportunity with ambiguity Programming experience, in specific to mobile development, R or Python is a bonus.   Some travel required Who We Are A global leader in credit information and information management services, TransUnion gives businesses, consumers and the global community the power to achieve their goals. Businesses count on us to better manage risk and customer relationships. Consumers are able to better manage credit to achieve their financial goals. And in communities around the world we help build strong economies and give people the power to achieve their dreams. Exceptional opportunities are coming as we build on this strong foundation. Our ambitious growth strategy includes substantial new investment worldwide, a wide range of new solutions to help our customers succeed like never before, and new ideas for expanding our reach in every part of our dynamic and fast-moving industry. We’re on an exciting journey and you can be a part of it. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Interested candidates, please forward your resume and indicate current and expected salary by clicking apply now below Data collected will be treated in strict confidence and used for recruitment purposes only. You can also visit our LinkedIN career page at   Additional Information Career Level Middle Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 8 years Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Dental insurance, Double pay, Five-day work week, Flexible working hours, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus, Work from home Company details TransUnion  is a global leader in credit information and information management services. For more than 40 years, we have worked with businesses and consumers to gather, analyze and deliver the critical information needed to build strong economies throughout the world. Our dedicated associates provide solutions to approximately 45,000 businesses and approximately 500 million consumers worldwide.  We are  seeking to engage top talents to join our workforce in aggressive expansion of new Business Lines.  We pride ourselves in our corporate culture of multi-dimensional people management and development and have many employees enjoy a long term, satisfying and enriching career with us!  stakeholders Driving subscription and services revenue on Hybrid/Multi-Cloud products through prospects for potential new partners Step up and work with other internal colleagues to enable Sales team in up-selling Cloud product Present new products and services and enhance existing relationships Using knowledge of the market and competitors, identify and develop the company’s unique selling propositions and differentiators Experience to architect the framework and may need to deliver project(s) with customer Requirements University Degree in Information Technology or related discipline 3+ Yrs of Hands-on knowledge, willing to explore and architect the latest cloud offerings (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS) from market-leading

We are now looking for mature and self-motivated persons to join us in order to cope with our business growth. title: Senior Engineer, Machine Learning
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Senior Engineer, Machine Learning Advwhere Limited Kwun Tong Salary negotiable Posted on 29 Mar 2019 Senior Engineer, Machine Learning Advwhere Limited Job Highlights Job Description About Us 
 Powered by Advwhere, Cloudbreakr is a marketing technology company based on Big Data Analytics. With Machine Learning, we analyze various social media channels, provide social analysis services and optimize marketing
 performance for content & influencer campaigns. 
 About Senior Engineer, Machine Learning 
 As the Senior Engineer, Machine Learning, you will work closely with our software engineers and data scientists in building the cutting-edge marketing intelligence products and leverage on the big data infrastructure
 to build machine learning application based on NLP, image & video recognition to do topic modelling, object detection and profile labeling.  In the industry, Cloudbreakr product serves as the integrated tools to help client design an effective PR, marketing, advertising strategy , especially for content & influencer
 marketing. The company also provide various analysis and support to help optimize different campaigns. 
 
 Responsibilities Prepare training data, develop machine learning / deep learning algorithms Develop applications to enhance the machine learning on social media content  A positive attitude and good cultural fit with the team Requirements Experience in deep learning, specifically in the fields of image recognition and NLP (both English and Chinese are
 required) Experience in implementing LSTM, Word2Vec Knowledge of AWS Machine Learning platform, Google Cloud platform or Azure Machine Learning Service is a plus Familiar with open sources libraries including Keras, Tensorflow/Pytorch Previous experience in big data or machine learning development  are advantageous 3+ years of working experience is preferred
 Bachelor’s Degree or above in Computer Science / Mathematics / Statistics / Engineering or related fields   Team C ulture -  Dare to fail  and learn from mistake;  Be Persistent  to Your Work and Belief;  Be Proactive  to Initiate Discussion and Challenge;  Be Flexible  to Adopt to Fast-changing business requirement   Additional Information Career Level Senior Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 3 years Employment Type Full Time Benefits Five-day work week, Medical insurance, Performance bonus Company details Powered by Cloudbreakr is Asia's leading intelligent marketing platform and influencer network based in Hong Kong, Taiwan, Malaysia and Singapore.
 Based on machine learning and big data analysis, we help brand creates the best content that influence people and provide influencer marketing solutions covering 7+ APAC regions. Cloudbreakr is a platform built by Advwhere Limited, an incubation Company of
 HK Science & Technology Park. title: Senior Solutions Consultant - Risk & eKYC
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Senior Solutions Consultant - Risk & eKYC TransUnion Limited Tsim Sha Tsui Salary negotiable Posted on 02 Apr 2019 Senior Solutions Consultant - Risk & eKYC TransUnion Limited Job Highlights Job Description Solution Consultant is responsible for achieving the annual revenue targets for TransUnion products and solutions, and for continually expanding and enhancing TransUnion’s suite of ISG solutions.  The candidate will be reporting to the Head of Solution Consulting.   Under limited supervision, this position is responsible for consulting with the customer and sales team to define the customer’s business needs, defining and delivering the solutions utilizing TransUnion products and services.  Participate in the investigative and definition process on qualified opportunities, define the solution, work with other TU divisions or 3rd parties to design the total implementation, participate in the presentation and demonstration, provide a high-level development and ongoing cost estimate to the sales team.  Participate in the RFP and proposal processes on qualified opportunities bringing both a business and a technical understanding of the requirements.      Work as a consultant and member of key account teams for qualified customers and contribute to account strategy, product/solution positioning, sales planning, solution definition, cost and duration estimation, product/business value, and ROI analysis   Facilitate sales contacts, research customer and industry needs and participate in determining the market strategies and goals for each product and service  Identify, evaluate and respond to key business issues of qualified accounts and develop, present and demonstrate Analytic Decision Services capabilities to the potential customer Develop, deliver and lead implementation of professional solution proposals.  Research solution requirements.  Develop diagrams, process flows and technical requirements.  Review and edit responses to proposals Manage a variety of key projects and activities related to attaining new business opportunities Strategize with the sales team and consulting staff to address technical issues and participate in the development of the strategy and objectives for all customer meetings Provide solution documentation to Project Managers so they can effectively provide accurate, detailed estimates in a timely manner, and be available for ongoing direction and consulting to the Project Managers during the project lifecycle as necessary Perform other duties as required to ensure the goals and objectives of the function/department are met   A Bachelor’s degree required in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, or other related fields.  Requires a minimum of 3+ years of experience in credit, financial services consulting or financial services industry.     Minimum of 2 years hands-on experience in analytics required.  Strong understanding of statistical tools and solutions.   Excellent oral and written communication.  Ability to communicate and apply a consultative/solution-based approach.   Must have a “solutions-based” approach to solving customer requirements Must be a problem solver with a ‘get it done’ attitude and strong self-motivated.  Ability to think innovatively and drive changes.  Ability to handle multiple tasks at one time.  Has ability to seek opportunity with ambiguity Demonstrates a high level of consultative behavior when working with customers.  Ability to seek out new contacts and conduct research to assess feasibility of new ideas.  Ability to represent TransUnion in a professional, credible manner Hands-on knowledge and experience combining data, analytics and technology to deliver real-time transaction processing solutions High degree of computer literacy and previous programming experience required.  Must be proficient with Microsoft Office suite.  Prior experience using statistical software, such as SAS, R, preferred.  Some travel required Interested candidates, please forward your resume and indicate current and expected salary to apply at  https://transunion.taleo.net/careersection/tuext/jobdetail.ftl?job=18000954 Data collected will be treated in strict confidence and used for recruitment purposes only Additional Information Career Level Middle Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 5 years Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Dental insurance, Double pay, Five-day work week, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus, Work from home Company details TransUnion  is a global leader in credit information and information management services. For more than 40 years, we have worked with businesses and consumers to gather, analyze and deliver the critical information needed to build strong economies throughout the world. Our dedicated associates provide solutions to approximately 45,000 businesses and approximately 500 million consumers worldwide.  We are  seeking to engage top talents to join our workforce in aggressive expansion of new Business Lines.  We pride ourselves in our corporate culture of multi-dimensional people management and development and have many employees enjoy a long term, satisfying and enriching career with us! title: Analyst, Financial Planning & Analysis - APAC
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Analyst, Financial Planning & Analysis - APAC TransUnion Limited Tsim Sha Tsui Salary provided Posted on 02 Apr 2019 Analyst, Financial Planning & Analysis - APAC TransUnion Limited Job Highlights Job Description Dynamics of the Role The incumbent will support budgeting and management reporting for revenue and expense variance monitoring, reporting and providing
 explanation on the trends. He or she will pick up detail knowledge on system, process, product and report on a monthly basis.   How You’ll Contribute
 Analytical Skills: Prepare monthly management reports with analysis on evaluating business performance Technical Skills: Applies knowledge of the various systems and processes associated with reporting of the APAC Region including PeopleSoft,
 Hyperion, Excel and other MS office. Interpersonal:  Develops and maintains cooperative relationships throughout the APAC Region and other departments in order to accomplish
 work.  Educates, interacts and assists management and associates with reporting responsibilities. Presents work, projects and ideas to peers and customers in a clear and logical manner. 
 Teamwork:  Work collaboratively within Finance, as well as other departments (Sales, IT, Product) for annual budgeting, quarterly forecast
 and improve reporting accuracy and efficiency.   Communication:  Effectively communicate both verbally and written to senior management and other departments to ensure comprehension of ideas,
 initiatives, requirements, and issues to drive progress with regards to management reporting. 
 Must be able to work independently to drive processes without significant oversight, and understand when it is appropriate to escalate issues. Performs ad hoc analyses and other related duties as assigned.   What You’ll Bring The duties and responsibilities described above are the essential functions of the job.  The qualifications below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities
 required.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Bachelor's Degree in Finance or Accounting and three to four years of accounting and analytical experience.
 Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Access, Word, PowerPoint and Windows. Knowledge in Hyperion and PeopleSoft is preferable. Strong verbal and written communications skills in English and Cantonese.
 Ability to produce a high volume of work quickly and accurately with a sense of urgency.  
 Highly organized you can process a high volume of data coming from various sources Strong analytical, numerical skills, detailed orientated and logical approach to problem solving. Detail oriented with organizational, time management and follow-up skills.    
 Self-managed with the ability to effectively manage multiple conflicting priorities, take verbal direction and perform with minimal guidance
 or supervision.  Ability to interact effectively with all levels of management.     A global leader in credit information and information management services, TransUnion gives businesses, consumers and the global community the power to achieve their goals. Businesses count
 on us to better manage risk and customer relationships. Consumers are able to better manage credit to achieve their financial goals. And in communities around the world we help build strong economies and give people the power to achieve their dreams. Exceptional opportunities are coming as we build on this strong foundation. Our ambitious growth strategy includes substantial new investment worldwide, a wide range of new solutions to
 help our customers succeed like never before, and new ideas for expanding our reach in every part of our dynamic and fast-moving industry. We’re on an exciting journey and you can be a part of it. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status,
 protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Interested candidates, please forward your resume and indicate current and expected salary by clicking apply now below Data collected will be treated in strict confidence and used for recruitment purposes only. You can also visit our LinkedIN career page at    Additional Information Career Level Entry Level Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 4 years Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Dental insurance, Double pay, Five-day work week, Flexible working hours, Life insurance, Performance bonus, Work from home Company details TransUnion  is a global leader in credit information and information management services. For more
 than 40 years, we have worked with businesses and consumers to gather, analyze and deliver the critical information needed to build strong economies throughout the world. Our dedicated associates provide solutions to approximately 45,000 businesses and approximately
 500 million consumers worldwide.  We are  seeking to engage top talents to join our workforce in aggressive expansion of new Business Lines.  We pride ourselves in our corporate culture of multi-dimensional people management and development
 and have many employees enjoy a long term, satisfying and enriching career with us!  Generate reports, annotated code, and other projects artifacts to document, archive, and communicate your work and outcomes

 Supervise the production of new algorithms into operational processes, measure the results and improve continuously. Develop specific tools, processes and reportings or data visualizations to deliver a high level of service of the solution
 implemented and measure their impacts on business  Job Requirements:   Bachelor’s Degree in a “STEM” major (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) 1-3 years of experience Knowledge / experience in implementing R or Python machine learning algorithms Demonstrated skills at data cleansing, data quality assessment, and using analytics for data assessment Demonstrated skill in the use of applied analytics, descriptive statistics, and predictive analytics
 Developers and Mathematical approach Being able to work in a fast-paced multidisciplinary environment; Having the ability to query databases and perform statistical analysis; Being able to develop or program databases; to advice senior management in clear language about the implications of their work for the

description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Data Scientist / Computational Scientist Clustertech Limited Shatin Area Salary provided Posted on 04 Apr 2019 Data Scientist / Computational Scientist Clustertech Limited Job Highlights Job Description Job Description: Solve practical problems by using computational skills and cross-category approaches of data mining/statistics/artificial intelligence/mathematical optimization; Utilize user characteristics and behavior data, financial data to do data mining and model building analysis; Participate in client research to collect users’ need, prepare reports of clients’ behavior analysis; Be required to travel to the mainland on a need basis;  Job Requirements: Major in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics or related disciplines; 1-2 years hands on relevant working experience; Good at analytical thinking with solid mathematics knowledge; Good master of foundation theories and approaches of data mining or statistics field; Proficiency in Java, Python, R or at least one programming language; Knowledge of data structure and algorithm; Experience in processing mass data, model building, and product improvement by mathematical approach is preferable; Knowledge of MYSQL,ORACLE database operation with excellent tuning skills is an advantage; Knowledge of machine learning or statistics field with experience in data mining projects is preferred; Team spirit, proactive in idea sharing with good communication skills (Chinese and English); Preference will be given to candidates with high integrity, team spirit, strong sense of responsibility, and passion for the application of modern computing technology in China;    We offer competitive remuneration package including 5-day work and 15 days annual leave to the right candidate with excellent career advancement.  All applications will be treated in strict confidence. Personal information collected will be used solely for the purpose of recruitment. If you are not invited for an interview within 4 weeks, your application will be filed for a further 2 years and be considered for any other appropriate positions within the company or related companies.   For more information about  ClusterTech , please visit our web site at  . Additional Information Career Level Not Specified Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 1 year Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Five-day work week, Life insurance, Medical insurance Company Website Company details   is committed to providing value to clients through advanced computing technologies including Cloud, High Performance Computing,  AI & Analytics and  Big Data. We provide a comprehensive range of services and products to solve problems in massive data processing, large-scale computing, in-depth analysis, artificial intelligence, and uninterrupted service. Our business areas include financial engineering (investment analysis, risk management, derivatives pricing, etc.), business intelligence (sales forecasting, customer management, inventory management, etc.), environmental science (weather forecast, heavy rain and turbulence forecasting, analysis and prediction of pollution, etc.), smart city (information gathering, information analysis, optimisation and management), and internet applications (massive image processing, video storage and delivery). We also provide public cloud, private cloud and hybrid cloud solutions for businesses of all sizes.  of certainty no other firm can match. TCS offers a consulting-led, integrated portfolio of IT, BPS, infrastructure, engineering and assurance services. This is delivered through its unique Global Network Delivery Model™, recognized as the benchmark of excellence

title: General Manager 能源業務總經理
Advisor, Credit Risk Solutions
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Advisor, Credit Risk Solutions TransUnion Limited Tsim Sha Tsui Salary provided Posted on 10 Apr 2019 Advisor, Credit Risk Solutions TransUnion Limited Job Highlights Job Description Dynamics of the Role We are seeking an Advisor of Core Credit Solutions to join a dynamic and fast paced team. This position is responsible for achieving TransUnion core
 credit bureau solution revenue in the Hong Kong region while delivering and executing against a plan to drive incremental growth above and beyond current projections. This position builds and executes product roadmap for analytics and risk management solutions to support the region’s strategic growth plan, drives
 greater awareness and adoption of TU existing and new products. This position leads expansion of TU global IP, by adopting and adapting TU global core credit product and go-to-market strategies and enabling sales, IT and delivery teams in the region to drive
 NPI revenue and product innovation, and deliver long-term, happy customer experience. The Core Credit Advisor works in partnership with the Strategy and Planning team to understand and assess market opportunities, with IT to build new products, with marketing
 to drive awareness of our products and with sales to drive adoption and revenue.   How You’ll Contribute: Achieve core credit NPI (new product initiative) annual revenue plan. Through the sales force, increase pipeline, average deal size
 and win rate of sales opportunities. Develop sales materials and GTM playbook. Develop and execute against comprehensive sales training plan to increase awareness of our solutions and improve effectiveness of sales. Support sales by providing additional sales
 tools, assisting with account planning and participating in sales conversations as the Subject Matter Expert (SME) Develop long-term product roadmap and plan that exceeds current revenue projections. Identify market opportunities for share gain
 or product innovation. Work with international Product Center of Excellence to evolve and adapt overall core credit product line strategy; capture and feed new product ideas to Product CoE and work together to develop business cases to support growth aspirations.
 Set aspirational revenue goals and work with sales/IT to develop plans to achieve that goal I ncrease mindshare and overall perception of TransUnion
 with clients as a consultative risk solutions provider. Serve as an active member and core credit solution SME on sales calls and engagements. Establish or lead solution advisory boards to gain deeper market insight from customers, lead customer engagement
 in new product ideation, product development and validation. Represent TransUnion and promote TU thought leadership position through industry events, articles and client engagement Oversee core credit solution portfolio, and set overall product strategy. Track revenue, deliver monthly forecast that provides clarity
 and transparency across products, sales and IT teams to monitor product adoption and GTM execution Develop and ensure region’s core credit innovation agenda is coherent with technology advancement and TU global technology roadmap. Facilitate
 analytics capability upgrade by supporting and adapting new technology platforms or tools that improve operational efficiency, project quality and customer experience   What You’ll Bring: The successful candidate will be a proven product leader with extensive client engagement and sales experience. This position requires
 a minimum of 10 years progressive experience in credit, financial services consulting or other financial services industry area. Prior experience and successful track records in an analytics field is higher desirable. A bachelor degree is required, while a
 master degree is preferred. Proficiency:  Must possess expertise knowledge
 in credit risk management and/or marketing in consumer credit and consumer lending area. Must understand the full credit life cycle and the profitability dynamics over economic cycles. Must be recognized as a subject matter expert in credit risk management
 or analytics Strategic thinking/visioning:  Must be able
 to see and communicate the big picture in an inspiring way. Determines opportunities and threats through comprehensive analysis of current and future needs.  Have a general manager mindset that keeps sales, operations, P&L, strategy and implementation in balance Product Management Experience:  Must be able
 to conceptualize, develop and direct the execution of complex solutions and go-to-market strategies. Experience in launching and/or selling products is highly desirable Organization & Planning:  Able to plan, schedule
 and budget in an efficient, productive manner. Track records in managing complex projects with high output and minimal supervision. Comfortable to make tough trade-off decisions and focus on key priorities. Copes effectively with complexity and change Aggressiveness & Persistence:  Moves quickly
 and takes a forceful stand without being overly abrasive. Demonstrates tenacity and willingness to go the distance to get something done Communication:  Must possess excellent verbal
 and creative writing skills. Comfortable speaking in front of large groups as an expert. Able to translate technical product information into compelling stories. Proficiency in English is required. Other Asian languages a plus Teamwork:  Comfortable in a matrix environment.
 Reaches out to peers and motivates /cooperates with partners to establish an overall collaborative and effective working relationship Culture Awareness:  understand cultural differences.
 Able to work effectively with diverse markets simultaneously. Willing to travel when required Interested candidates, please forward your resume and indicate current and expected salary to apply at  https://transunion.taleo.net/careersection/tuext/jobdetail.ftl?job=17001381 Data collected will be treated in strict confidence and used for recruitment purposes Additional Information Career Level Senior Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 10 years Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Dental insurance, Double pay, Five-day work week, Flexible working hours, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus, Work from home Company details TransUnion  is a global leader in credit information and information management services. For more
 than 40 years, we have worked with businesses and consumers to gather, analyze and deliver the critical information needed to build strong economies throughout the world. Our dedicated associates provide solutions to approximately 45,000 businesses and approximately
 500 million consumers worldwide.  We are  seeking to engage top talents to join our workforce in aggressive expansion of new Business Lines.  We pride ourselves in our corporate culture of multi-dimensional people management and development

The Club has a unique integrated business model, comprising racing and racecourse entertainment, a membership club, responsible sports wagering and lottery, and charities and community contribution. Through this model, the Club generates economic and social value for the community and supports the Government in combatting illegal gambling. In 2017/18, the Club made a record return to the Government of HK$22.6 billion in duty and profits tax and contributed HK$1.2 billion to the Lotteries Fund. title: Associate Director / Manager – Big Data Practitioner, Data & Analytics
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Associate Director / Manager – Big Data Practitioner, Data & Analytics KPMG Central Salary provided Posted on 29 Mar 2019 Associate Director / Manager – Big Data Practitioner, Data & Analytics KPMG Job Highlights Job Description In KPMG's Management Consulting practice, we do not limit ourselves to either strategy or implementation. Instead, we deliver both. Our team in Hong Kong is the fastest growing division within KPMG China and represents a young and enthusiastic team that always pushes itself to succeed. Since our creation, we have developed in-depth knowledge of an incredibly broad spread of sectors and services. Our Data & Analytics team focuses on assisting clients to execute their strategy by optimising the use of information. We enable business to realise their objectives through insights from the data and provide the right information to the right people at the right time. The role of an Associate Director within KPMG has three specific areas of focus: 1. Business Development - Building strong and lasting client relationships through excellent interpersonal skills - Identifying and developing new opportunities at existing and new clients - Working with Partners and Directors to develop compelling propositions which target relevant client issues - Supporting the development of RFP responses to clients - Building their network within the firm to help drive the capability and their own visibility 2. Client Service - Delivery of high quality advisory and / or technical services to our clients - Planning, managing and executing the delivery of engagements or projects, including responsibility for the review and quality assurance of deliverables - Building lasting relationships with their key client stakeholders - Identifying and managing risks, whilst maximising profitability and ensuring the Firm's frameworks are implemented appropriately and effectively 3. Practice Development - Utilising their previous and growing experience to build and develop knowledge within the team - Developing and building on both their consulting and delivery capability - Delivery and attendance to key training - Helping our junior team members to develop through mentoring and monitoring in the role of a Performance Manager and by disseminating their own experience throughout the team As part of this team, you will be providing specialised consulting services in Big Data Strategy, Planning and Implementation to clients across different industries The individual will have: - Bachelor's degree, preferably in Computer Science, Information Systems, and Engineering - 10+ years of Big Data and data warehousing experience, candidates with less experience will be considered as Manager - Hands-on experience in leading the design, development and implementation of the big data software platform - Extensive understanding of database and analytical technologies including MPP and NoSQL databases, data warehousing, BI, and Dashboard design - Extensive understanding of Hadoop technologies. Programming or scripting languages like Java, Linux, C++, PHP, Ruby, Python, R and Matlib - Expert knowledge in different (NoSQL or RDBMS) databases such as Hbase, Hive, MongoDB and Cassandra - Strong understanding of cloud technologies platform like AWS or Azure is highly preferred - Great communications skill to work with business stakeholders on analytics, project management, and advisory - Proven project management skills including planning, designing and shaping project work streams, managing progress, resolving issues and limiting risks - Ability to work at pace whilst delivering pragmatic and high quality outcomes - Good English language skills. Prefer to be fluent on Mandarin We offer successful candidates an attractive remuneration package and the opportunity to work in a dynamic and exciting environment. Personal data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only. © 2019 KPMG, a Hong Kong partnership and a member firm of the KPMG network of independent member firms affiliated with KPMG International Cooperative ("KPMG International"), a Swiss entity. All rights reserved. Additional Information Career Level Middle Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 10 years Employment Type Full Time Company Website Company details KPMG China operates in 19 cities across China, with around 12,000 partners and staff in Beijing, Beijing Zhongguancun, Changsha, Chengdu, Chongqing, Foshan, Fuzhou, Guangzhou, Hangzhou, Nanjing, Qingdao, Shanghai, Shenyang, Shenzhen, Tianjin, Wuhan, Xiamen, Xi'an, Hong Kong SAR and Macau SAR.   KPMG is a global network of professional services firms providing Audit, Tax and Advisory services. We operate in 154 countries and territories, and have 200,000 people working in member firms around the world. Job Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or, Business Administration with a concentration in Information Systems 2-4 years of experience in project management Project management knowledge and development methodologies such as waterfall and agile is a mus Experience managing/leading a small cross functional project team Understanding of Big Data and software development is highly preferred Must be a strong communicator with a high level of written and verbal business communication skill, preferably with multi-cultural, multi-regional project management experience Experience with integration projects and productionalization is highly preferred Technical knowledge such as SQL, R or Python is highly preferred Proficient in MS Excel, Word, PowerPoint, MS Project Fluency in English and

We also provide public cloud, private cloud and hybrid cloud solutions for businesses of all sizes. title: Big Data Analytics Modelling Analyst (Betting)
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Big Data Analytics Modelling Analyst (Betting) The Hong Kong Jockey Club Shatin Area Posted on 12 Apr 2019 Big Data Analytics Modelling Analyst (Betting) The Hong Kong Jockey Club Job Highlights Job Description The Department
 The Customer and International Business Development Division (C&I) is responsible for providing quality wagering experience marketing, and CRM to
 local and overseas customers of the Hong Kong Jockey Club. The ultimate aim is to provide an impressive total customer experience leading to sustainable turnover growth in a responsible manner. The Job You will  assist in the development of trading algorithmic models for new products and new markets to expand the existing portfolio of betting products provide strategic input to the development, implementation and delivery of product innovations along with pricing and service improvements and
 requirements assist in the development of all model and statistical analysis for automated trading tools assist in the development of Trading Systems and Quantitative Finance engines with the objective of improving efficiency and profits exclusively
 in the trading environment assist in ad-hoc projects About
 You  You should have  a degree in Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related disciplines, MSc and above a real bonus
 minimum 3 years working experience, preferred in a modeling/analysis/statistics role (statistical, Artificial Intelligence & Operational Research
 techniques or other disciplines)  strong computational background, with experience in some of C#, VBA, Matlab, R, SQL and other data and code manipulation methodologies formal training in big data analysis and knowledge in usage of software named HADOOP a must a keen interest in sports and statistical analysis is essential as well as a good understanding of the gaming industry passion, enthusiasm and curiosity about Football Trading plus interests in other sports such as Horse Racing, Basketball, etc. fluency in written and spoken English 
 The level of appointment will be commensurate with qualification and experience. A contract employment will be offered to the successful candidate. Contract
 renewal will be subject to mutual agreement between the Club and the individual.  Please send your resume, complete with expected salary and job reference by clicking "Apply Now" button or to: The Human Resources Department The Hong Kong Jockey Club 1 Sports Road, Happy Valley Hong Kong   Additional Information Career Level Middle Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 3 years Employment Type Contract, Full Time Benefits Gratuity, Performance bonus Company Website Company details Founded in 1884, The Hong Kong Jockey Club is a world-class racing club that acts continuously for the betterment of our society. The Club has a unique integrated business model, comprising racing
 and racecourse entertainment, a membership club, responsible sports wagering and lottery, and charities and community contribution. Through this model, the Club generates economic and social value for the community and supports the Government in combatting
 illegal gambling. In 2017/18, the Club made a record return to the Government of HK$22.6 billion in duty and profits tax and contributed HK$1.2 billion to the Lotteries Fund. Approved charity donations were HK$4.2 billion. The Club is Hong Kong's largest single
 taxpayer and one of the city’s major employers. Its Charities Trust is also one of the world's top ten charity donors. The Club is always "riding high together for a better future" with the people of Hong Kong.   香港賽馬會（「馬會」）成立於1884年，是致力建設更美好社會的世界級賽馬機構。馬會透過其結合賽馬及馬場娛樂、會員會所、有節制體育博彩及獎券，以及慈善及社區貢獻的獨特綜合營運模式，創造經濟及社會價值，並協助政府打擊非法賭博。2017/18年度，馬會透過各項博彩稅及利得稅，為政府庫房帶來破紀錄的226億港元收入，並向獎券基金撥款12億港元。另外，已審批慈善捐款達42億港元。馬會是全港最大的單一納稅機構，也是香港主要僱主之一，其慈善信託基金位列全球十大慈善捐助機構。馬會將繼續與香港市民「同心同步同進　共創更好未來」。 More Jobs from this employer Part-time Research Assistant Posted on  1 hour ago Veterinary Pharmacy Technician (One-year temporary) Posted on  2 hours ago Part-Time Customer Relations Assistant (TRC) Posted on  3 hours ago View all jobs from this employer About JobsDB About jobsDB FAQ Career @ jobsDB Contact us Contact us International partners Bdjobs (Bandladesh) Brighter Monday (East Africa) Catho (Brazil) Jobberman (West Africa) JobStreet (S.E. GSG works with C-level executives to identify, structure and help solve their most critical strategic issues across the economic and transaction cycles. We are seeking exceptional individuals who have a passion for identifying and creating solutions for clients.  Working within our Strategy team, our Financial Services cluster are a fast growing team of specialists focused on Banking, Insurance and Asset Management. We leverage KPMG’s strong financial services brand and package together KPMG’s leading functional specialties such as Risk, Compliance, IT, AML, Financial Management, People & Change to develop truly holistic business and operating model solutions for our clients from Strategy to Results. With the forces of technology, regulation and sector convergence reshaping the industry like never before, the need for clear strategy in the sector has never been stronger and we are well placed to help our clients respond to these challenges and win in the market. It is an exciting time to join the Global Strategy Group as we are growing rapidly owing to our unique propositions and strength of client relationships. As a team, we are a group of bright individuals who are passionate about having fun both inside and outside of work.    - Lead, design and finalise client deliverables, including shaping the overall problem solving approach  - Lead complex storyboarding and shape the overall problem solving approach to develop recommendations  - Build client relationships to be seen as the ‘go to’ person and a trusted advisor by senior executives  - Support the identification, pursuit and conversion of a pipeline of business development opportunities for GSG  - Actively develop own knowledge and expertise across Banking, Insurance and Asset Management  - Motivate, coach and develop project team members and appraisees, and give constructive 360 degree feedback  - Identify, design and lead critical and complex practice development initiatives, coordinating other members of the team    - A minimum of eight years of relevant experience in:     - Tier 1 & 2 strategy houses      - Strategy consulting or Transaction advisory or Management consulting in a big 4 / similar firm     - Corporate strategy / Corporate development / M&A team of a large Financial Institution  - Degree from a leading University  - Considerable experience of leading and managing complex projects with multi-disciplinary teams in a consulting, corporate or public sector environment  - Track record of working closely with clients to deliver high impact recommendations   - Ability to build and commercialize relationships with senior executives   - Analytical mindset, intellectual curiosity, structured thinking, and creativity  - Confidence, people skills, ambition and pragmatism  - Excellent written and oral communication skills in English; title: Associate Director, Insurance, Financial Management
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Associate Director, Insurance, Financial Management KPMG Central Salary provided Posted on 29 Mar 2019 Associate Director, Insurance, Financial Management KPMG Job Highlights Job Description In Management Consulting, you’ll join a large and rapidly growing team, contributing to a range of projects that help clients address some of the biggest issues they’re facing in the boardroom. By helping them to add lasting value to the bottom line and make huge improvements in their performance, you’ll support them in transforming the way they do business.  Our approach involves both strategy and implementation, which means we’re not just thinkers, but practical doers, creating client strategies that are designed to work in the real world. In Financial Management, we improve the effectiveness and efficiency of the finance function and generate real insights to help deliver value to the business.  As digital disruption affects more industry sectors, Chief Financial Officers (CFOs) find it increasingly challenging to deliver sustainable growth in profits and dividends, whilst managing costs. Join this team and we can ensure you’re equipped to support and advise CFOs in this constantly changing world by training you in at least one of these capabilities: - How to develop a company’s finance strategy - Process improvement, including what good looks like for each of the key finance processes - Implementing systems changes specifically in cloud-based technology solutions, using our powered solution - Implementing process enhancement through digital and robotic technologies  - Organisational change and specifically designing and implementing a shared service centre - Regulatory changes Armed with these skills and supported to continue developing your expertise, you’ll help our Finance Transformation teams advise CFOs in one of these areas: -   – enabling finance to add more value to the business by improving processes such as business planning, forecasting and the provision of regular management information.  -   – enabling finance to deliver these services quicker, cheaper and with better controls.  -   – specifically in the insurance sector with IFRS 17 change programmes -   – enabling finance functions globally delivery a consistent level of cost effective service to all their customers/ markets. We are looking for an Associate Director candidate with prior experience as Project Manager / Senior Project Team Members in the Insurance sector. Candidates with either experience in the commercial sector or a professional service firm will be considered. The individual will have: - Understanding of key business and performance challenges across Financial Services, being able to translate industry challenges into strategic solutions  - Extensive experience working in a Big 4 professional firm focusing on the insurance industry or in the Finance functions of an insurance company  - Accountancy qualification with strong post qualification experience (or equivalent experience)  - Good understanding of the recent developments in the insurance industry, including but not limited to IFRS17 - Strong people manager, able to lead large teams and develop others  - Self-starting, pro-active team player that is experienced in working in challenging environments and within a multi-disciplined team  - Ability to liaise with senior Finance stakeholders  - Ability to create and deliver high level presentations and output reviews to senior executives/stakeholders and business managers  - Experience in performing business development  - Ability to review and challenge information that has been provided by other team members, ensuring the information is ‘fit for purpose’ and at the right level of granularity  - Ability to perform structured analysis on business models to provide best practice knowledge  - Comfortable working with emerging technology and digital solutions - Strong written and verbal communication skills in English - Cantonese speaking candidates are preferred                                We offer successful candidates an attractive remuneration package and the opportunity to work in a dynamic and exciting environment. description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Manager, Consumer Markets, Financial Management KPMG Central Salary provided Posted on 29 Mar 2019 Manager, Consumer Markets, Financial Management KPMG Job Highlights Job Description In Management Consulting, you’ll join a large and rapidly growing team, contributing to a range of projects that help clients address some of the biggest issues they’re facing in the boardroom. By helping them to add lasting value to the bottom line and make huge improvements in their performance, you’ll support them in transforming the way they do business. Our approach involves both strategy and implementation, which means we’re not just thinkers, but practical doers, creating client strategies that are designed to work in the real world.   In Financial Management, we improve the effectiveness and efficiency of the finance function and generate real insights to help deliver value to the business. As digital disruption affects more industry sectors, Chief Financial Officers (CFOs) find it increasingly challenging to deliver sustainable growth in profits and dividends, whilst managing costs. Join this team and we can ensure you’re equipped to support and advise CFOs in this constantly changing world by training you in at least one of these capabilities - How to develop a company’s finance strategy - Process improvement, including what good looks like for each of the key finance processes - Implementing systems changes specifically in cloud-based technology solutions, using our powered solution - Implementing process enhancement through digital and robotic technologies  - Organisational change and specifically designing and implementing a shared service centre - Regulatory changes Armed with these skills and supported to continue developing your expertise, you’ll help our Finance Transformation teams advise CFOs in one of these areas -   – enabling finance to add more value to the business by improving processes such as business planning, forecasting and the provision of regular management information  -   – enabling finance to deliver these services quicker, cheaper and with better controls  -   – providing clients with the necessary guidance to meet the changing demands of regulation -   – enabling finance functions globally delivery a consistent level of cost effective service to all their customers/ markets We are looking for a   with prior experience as Project Manager/Senior Project Team Members in  . Candidates with either experience in the commercial sector or a professional service firm will be considered. The individual will have - Understanding of key business and performance challenges across consumer sectors (e.g. retail, luxury), being able to translate industry challenges into strategic solutions  - Experience working in a Big 4 professional firm or in the Finance functions of a large corporation - Bachelor Degree in Business Administration, Commerce, Accounting or other related disciplines preferred - Accountancy qualification with strong post qualification experience (or equivalent experience)  - Strong people manager, able to lead large teams and develop others  - Self-starting, pro-active team player that is experienced in working in challenging environments and within a multi-disciplined team  - Ability to liaise with senior Finance stakeholders  - Ability to create and deliver high level presentations and output reviews to senior executives/stakeholders and business managers  - Experience in performing business development and supporting Associate Directors, directors and Partners to do so in pursuing new business opportunities - Ability to review and challenge information that has been provided by other team members, ensuring the information is ‘fit for purpose’ and at the right level of granularity  - Ability to perform structured analysis on business models to provide best practice knowledge  - Comfortable working with emerging technology and digital solutions - Strong written and verbal communication skills in English - Cantonese speaking candidates are preferred We offer successful candidates an attractive remuneration package and the opportunity to work in a dynamic and exciting environment. Personal data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only. © 2019 KPMG, a Hong Kong partnership and a member firm of the KPMG network of independent member firms affiliated with KPMG International Cooperative ("KPMG International"), a Swiss entity. All rights reserved.  Additional Information Career Level Middle Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience Not Specified Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Company Website Company details KPMG China operates in 19 cities across China, with around 12,000 partners and staff in Beijing, Beijing Zhongguancun, Changsha, Chengdu, Chongqing, Foshan, Fuzhou, Guangzhou, Hangzhou, Nanjing, Qingdao, Shanghai, Shenyang, Shenzhen, Tianjin, Wuhan, Xiamen, Xi'an, Hong Kong SAR and Macau SAR.   KPMG is a global network of professional services firms providing Audit, Tax and Advisory services. We operate in 154 countries and territories, and have 200,000 people working in member firms around the world. title: Data Engineer
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Data Engineer Techson Consulting Limited Not Specified Salary negotiable Posted on 27 Mar 2019 Data Engineer Techson Consulting Limited Job Highlights Job Description Job description Lead and grow a team of skilled data scientists and data analysts. Collect requirements from internal and external users through various means including but not limited to questionnaires, surveys, and interview. Collaborate and work tightly with the product development team to create, enhance and manage the data system for the platform. Oversee and ensure the output quality of the data team, including validation of methodology and techniques used and overall integrity of the data. Create and refine data models to handle large volumes of data. Develop predictive data-driven services by leveraging machine learning techniques. Adopt best practices in data management and security, ensure compliance with HKSAR's PDPO, and possess a working knowledge of EU’s GDPR. Pro-actively engage in data discovery to uncover insights obtained from data acquired through the platform. Present regular reports based on KPI and findings based on data discovery methods to management.   Job requirement Bachelor’s degree or above in Computer Science or a quantitative discipline such as Applied Mathematics, Statistics or Engineering. Minimum of 5 years hands-on experience developing software applications with languages such as R, Python, Java, Scala, C, among others. Knowledge of SDLC and experience with developing scalable and robust enterprise applications will be considered a plus. Minimum 2 years of project management experience in leading software engineering or big data initiatives. Minimum 2 years experience in a managerial or team leader role. Strong knowledge of database systems, particularly with SQL in association with data transformation, data investigation, and reporting. Proficient with cloud-based big data technologies. Solid story-telling and presentation skills, with the ability to make deep data topics comprehensible to a non-technical audience. Familiarity with business intelligence and data visualization tools like Tableau, and able to leverage these tools to transform data into stunning and easy-to-understand visualizations. Prior experience with geolocation data and / or retail-centric analysis is a plus. To apply, please send your detailed resume or contact Andy at 3707 1549 for a confidential discussion. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.  Applicants who are not contacted within two weeks may consider their applications unsuccessful. All data collected will be used for recruitment purpose only & will be used strictly confidential. Techson Consulting Limited 2005-2007 Kai Tak Commercial Building 317 Des Voeux Road Central Hong Kong Tel: (852) 3996 8090   Website:  Additional Information Career Level Middle Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 2 years Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Dental insurance, Double pay, Education allowance, Five-day work week, Flexible working hours, Housing allowance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus Company details Techson Consulting Limited is a member of Conners Consulting Group, found in 2010 by a group of professionals with a wide range of networks and extensive experience in the field. ​ We provide diversity talent search and selection services for clients across the region.  Techson is managed by team of Human Resources professional, offering permanent placements cover Executive Search, Human Resource​s, Finance, Information Technology, Legal & Compliance, Sales & Marketing and Luxury Retail sectors. description:

The candidate should make sure goods and services are
 produced efficiently and that the correct amount is produced at the right cost and level of quality. Responsibilities: Oversee the food production process, drawing up a production schedule Ensure that the food production is cost effective Decide what resources are required Draft a timescale for the job Estimate costs and set the quality standards Monitor the production processes and adjust schedules as needed Be responsible for the selection and maintenance of equipment Monitor product standards and implement quality control programmes Liaise among different departments, e.g. suppliers, managers and senior management Work with managers to implement the company's policies and goals Ensure that health and safety guidelines are followed Supervise and motivate the production team Review worker performance Identify training needs. Must prepare a report after the completion of the production work with all necessary documents. Vigilant in forecasting the risk problems before commencing the work. Development of new food products welcomed by the market needs and promote it in an effective way. Need to ensure the quality and hygiene of the product. Must develop, implement and monitor the optimum nutrition of the products. Oversee the hiring, orientation and training of technical and non-technical food manufacturing personnel Requirements: 5+ years' culinary experience Ability to work well under pressure and in a fast-paced environment Capable of conducting and assessing restaurant inventory Experience with delegating tasks and maintaining fast speed of services This job & person spec is a guideline only and not exhaustive.  You may be required to perform other duties which are not expressly listed but are in keeping with the general purpose of your

jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Financial Planner / Wealth Management Manager (Native English Speakers Wanted) AIA International Limited Quarry Bay Salary provided Posted on 31 Mar 2019 Financial Planner / Wealth Management Manager (Native English Speakers Wanted) AIA International Limited Job Highlights Job Description We are Looking for: Native English Speakers Bachelor's degree holder in any discipline  Mature, self-motivated and willing to learn  Positive, driven attitude to strive for excellence Our young   team is committed to recruit, assist and foster candidates who are passionate and dedicated in
 client-based services. We are currently seeking individuals who are continuously striving for excellence with a positive outlook. In turn, we provide unlimited opportunities on career development, achievement recognition and massive support within our ever-growing
 multi-cultural team. We Offer:  Attractive commission package and comprehensive fringe benefits  Incentive trips and overseas business conventions  Well-structured and comprehensive training programs  Strong leadership and support through an international team and well recognised mentors  Opportunity to explore PRC and CIES business  Gain accreditation from the internationally acclaimed Million Dollar Round Table association.    Job Nature:  Identify HNW clients’ needs and provide professional, comprehensive financial advice  Provide risk management, wealth protection, investment, MPF, retirement planning services  Corporate solution planning and employee benefits solutions for corporate clients  Update HNW clients with financial news and benefits  Provide quality after-sales services to maintain good customer relationship Requirements:  Minimum of 1 year of working experience  Good interpersonal and communication skills  Overseas fresh graduates are welcomed     ** Will  ONLY  consider candidates with Permanent HK ID, IANG and/or Dependent Visa **    Interested Candidates, please send your detailed CV by clicking "  APPLY NOW  “.  Personal data collected will be used for employment-related purposes only. AIA reserves the right to modify the terms and conditions of package offered.  Additional Information Career Level Entry Level Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 1 year Employment Type Contract, Full Time Benefits Education allowance, Flexible working hours, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus, Transportation allowance, Travel allowance, Work from home Company details About Us   AIA International Limited and its subsidiaries (collectively “AIA” or “Group” ) comprise the largest independent
 publicly listed PAN-ASIAN life insurance group in the world. It has wholly-owned main operating subsidiaries or branches in 14 markets in Asia Pacific through an extensive network of 250,000 agents and over 20,000 employees.   AIA Hong Kong prides itself on its culture of service excellence and professional integrity, and has always embraced
 the core value of membership of the  Million Dollar Round Table (MDRT) . The key feature of the  AIA Premier Academy  is that it focuses exclusively on helping candidates achieve excellence
 and strive towards the target of joining MDRT.   When they have gone through our groundbreaking development programme, these professionals will achieve the highest
 standard of sales excellence and be recognised as the best and brightest in the industry. description:
