 brands (including Walch, Seika, etc.) which are famous in the international market.   To cope with our expansion, we are looking for professionals of high caliber who are willing to join our Hong Kong office. Job Description Perform internal audit procedures including financial, operational, system and compliance audit engagements; Identify weaknesses and develop recommendations for improvements Prepare internal audit reports and perform follow-up and monitoring works to ensure proper implementation of recommendation Liaise with local and overseas business units on various projects Perform analytical review on business unit performance; Handling ad hoc investigation assigned by the senior management Requirements University degree in Accounting or related disciplines;
 Holder of professional Accounting Bodies, like CPA / CIA / CA Qualified
 At least 3-5 year in-house Internal audit experience in FMCG industry Good knowledge in internal controls and risk management Mature and able to work independently, good time management and organized; Have strong commercial sense and be able to analyze work processes Well versed in MS Word, Excel and Chinese word processing, etc Good command of English, Mandarin and Cantonese Japanese would be a plus  Willing to travel  We offer attractive remuneration package to the right candidate. Interested candidates please send full resumes with  current and expected
 salary and date of availability.   All Personal data collected will be used for recruitment purpose only.   Additional Information Career Level Middle Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 5 years Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Five-day work week, Medical insurance, Performance bonus Company details We are one of the well-known FMCG companies in Hong Kong.   We currently have the second largest global market share in laundry ball products, and we own multiple
 Household Care product brands (including Walch, Seika, etc.) which are famous in the international market.   To cope with our aggressive expansion worldwide, we are looking for professionals of high caliber who are willing to work and grow with the company. title: HR Associate
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs HR Associate TUS International Limited Pok Fu Lam Base salary + high commission Posted on 03 Apr 2019 HR Associate TUS International Limited Job Highlights Job Description A Hong Kong Listed Technology Company (400+ employees worldwide) is hiring a HR Associate: Responsibilities
 Recruitment:
 Conducting recruitment/exit interviews and recording them accordingly Facilitating newcomers joining formalities Reviewing and updating job descriptions for all positions regularly
 Compensation & Benefits:
 Handling monthly payroll and yearly forms for employees.
 Liaising with all government agencies to ensure adherence to compliance laws and regulations Follow up on confirmation records statutory obligations - PF, ESIC, taxes, gratuity, bonus etc.
 HR Administration:
 Communicating and explaining the organization's HR policies to the employees Handling administration of all contract labor. Preparing and submitting all relevant HR letters/documents/certificates/ attendance as per the requirement in consultation with the management
 HR Management: 
 Handling all employee enquiries & grievances.
 Dispute settlements according to labor law, Factory rules & compliance guidelines.
 Educational Requirements
 Minimum of a Bachelor degree or equivalent in Human Resources, Business, or Organization Development.
 Additional Job Requirements
 Must be adept at problem-solving, including being able to identify issues and resolve programs in a timely manner Must possess strong interpersonal skills Must be able to communicate clearly, both written and orally, as to communicate with employees, members of the HR management team, and in group presentations
 and meetings Must be able to effectively read and interpret information, present numerical data in a resourceful manner, and skillfully gather and analyze information Must be able to prioritize and plan work activities as to use time efficiently Must be organized, accurate, thorough, and able to monitor work for quality Must be dependable, able to follow instructions, respond to management direction, and must be able to improve performance through management feedback Experience Requirements
 Speak Mandarin fluently  Minimum 3 year of experience in an HR Associate or higher post.
 Knowledge and experience in employment law, compensation, organizational planning, recruitment, organization development, employee relations, employee engagement.
 Additional Information Career Level Middle Qualification (N/A) Industry Job Function Years of Experience 3 years Employment Type Full Time Benefits Five-day work week, Free shuttle bus, Medical insurance, Performance bonus Company details  is principally engaged in the smart mobility business and actively expanding into the advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS) and smart mobility
 solutions fields. The Group has established an international M&A team, which is actively seeking M&A opportunities in the domestic automobile industry, at the same time evaluates overseas (especially the United States and Europe) automobile acquisition opportunities
 and strives to expand the related businesses in the China market. The Group will continue to leverage Tsinghua’s reputation, technologies and talent pool and actively implement the smart and connected automotive strategies outlined in Made in China 2025 to
 become a leading enterprise in the smart mobilty sector and guide the construction of an industrial ecosystem. title: HUMAN RESOURCES AND ADMIN SENIOR MANAGER
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs HUMAN RESOURCES AND ADMIN SENIOR MANAGER Big Cat Group Limited Causeway Bay Salary negotiable Posted on 03 Apr 2019 HUMAN RESOURCES AND ADMIN SENIOR MANAGER Big Cat Group Limited Job Highlights Job Description Causeway Bay   Assist in project planning, coordination and implementation as a Human Resources Business Partner role Act as a change agent to promote and implement change programs and to cultivate and desired culture Collaborate with team members in various stages of project cycle as to meet the pre-defined objectives and timelines Conduct risk assessment and make recommendations for individual staff cases Assist in communication materials to facilitate good understanding of new initiatives Liaise with management team, representative from line departments, and supporting units Responsible for full spectrum of Human Resources functions for the group, including manpower planning, recruitment and selection, reward management, benefits administration,
 payroll administration, leave and personnel database administration and employee relationship. Work with HR Director to establish and enhance policies and programs to support overall business operations Build and maintain harmonious employee relations and strong communication network with all levels both internally and externally Support outlet managers for new projects, daily staff management and business planning 3-5 years above relevant working experience Experience working in the F&B industry
 Proficiency in Microsoft Office, especially Excel Detail oriented Able to work efficiently with high quality University graduate in HR Management or equivalent Proficiency in both spoken and written Chinese and English Well knowledge of HR related policies and procedures and with good understanding of employment related ordinances and regulations Proactive, good interpersonal and communication skills, resilient and able to work under pressure A competitive remuneration package and career advancement opportunities will be offered to the right candidate.  Interested parties should apply
 with resume, expected salary and contact details. Interested parties please submit your application to HUMAN RESOURCES DEPARTMENT via email: by clicking "Apply Now" 
Equal opportunities are extended to all candidates and the information provided will be used for the consideration of your application within the Company.  All personal data collected will be for recruitment purposes only.  Data of unsuccessful applicants will
 be destroyed. Additional Information Career Level Senior Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 3 years Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Company details The Company Hong Kong-based Big Cat Group Ltd. (BCG) was founded by William Lyon in 2014, with an ambition to support exciting consumer brands grow in the region. BCG first acquired
 the exclusive franchise rights to develop Jamie Oliver restaurants across the Greater China region. Since then, BCG has opened three flagship Jamie’s Italian restaurants in Hong Kong and Taiwan, and the first Jamie’s Deli in Asia-Pacific. In 2017, BCG expanded its business to become the Brand Partner for the iconic British retail and hospitality brand Fortnum & Mason. BCG is responsible for managing
 Fortnum’s existing wholesale relationships with Lane Crawford, business development in the Asia-Pacific region and management support services for their Hong Kong operations. In 2018, BCG became management partner for a third brand, HAWKR. Founded by Ivan
 Pun and Jake Astor in 2017, HAWKR is a Southeast Asian “grab and go” concept with two outlets in Hong Kong. title: Assistant Manager, Internal Audit
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Assistant Manager, Internal Audit Johnson Electric Industrial Manufactory Limited Shatin Area Salary provided Posted on 11 Apr 2019 Assistant Manager, Internal Audit Johnson Electric Industrial Manufactory Limited Job Highlights Job Description Responsibilities: Carry out the vision and mission of Corporate Audit to implement a systematic and disciplined approach to evaluate risk and controller-ship Coach auditors in conducting financial, operational and compliance audits Review and evaluate the adequacy and effectiveness of internal controls, and to ensure the compliance with corporate policies and procedures Identify and define audit issues and root causes. And to recommend corrective action plans with improved internal controls and business processes
 for further presentation to management Promote a zero tolerance control environment for fraud or noncompliance Requirements: Degree or above in Accounting, Finance or related disciplines with certified public accountancy accreditation
 6 years or above related experience, preferably with both external and internal audit experience Interact well with different people and able to work in multi-cultural environment Possess excellent written and oral communications skills Have excellent coaching skills and can contribute to the team auditors’ professional development Equip with strong analytics skills
 Able to work in a team environment Willing to be engaged in frequent travel for global assignments Candidate with more experience will be considered as Manager   Personal data provided by job applicants will be used strictly for recruitment purpose only, a copy of which will be provided upon request. Unless otherwise instructed in writing by the applicant
 concerned, applicants may be considered for other suitable positions within the Company. Applicants who do not hear from us within 8 weeks may consider their application unsuccessful and their data will be destroyed within 24 months of receipt. Additional Information Career Level Middle Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 6 years Employment Type Full Time Benefits Five-day work week, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus, Transportation allowance Company Website Company details Established in 1959, Johnson Electric Group is a global leader in motion products, control systems and flexible interconnects. It
 serves a broad range of industries including automotive, building automation and security, business machines, defense and aerospace, food and beverage, home technologies, HVAC, industrial equipment, medical devices, personal care, power equipment and power
 tools. The Group’s business strategy is based on the twin pillars of providing “technology leadership” and being the “safe choice” for its customers. The Company supports
 its long term customers through complete product life from new product introduction to mature high volume production.
 Johnson Electric offers a comprehensive combination of application knowledge, breadth of technology,
 design engineering, manufacturing and logistics excellence. Our unique “Productizing Process” and the “Johnson Electric Production System” (JEPS) combine to deliver product differentiation and supply chain performance to our customers. The JEPS for each product
 is created in parallel with Research & Development to create a seamless flow from design to production, resulting in defect free and on time start-up of manufacturing. JE’s global footprint positions its engineering and manufacturing resources close to where its customers are doing their businesses. Engineering proximity with customers
 enhances collaboration and the creation of product differentiation. Local technical and customer support throughout the world increases the quality of communication, resulting in on-time project completion, scheduling flexibility and assurance of supply. The Group employs more than 40,000 employees and subcontract workers in over 23 countries. Its innovation and product design centers are located in Hong Kong, China,
 Switzerland, Germany, Italy, Israel, Japan, UK and USA.  JE has strong presence in China, with multiple manufacturing sites located in various cities, including Shenzhen, Beihai, Shanghai and Nanjing. The Company has established
 sizable manufacturing operations in Shenzhen where we hire 22,000 employees and workers. In  2016,  JE Hong Kong was recognized as a Caring Company by the Hong Kong Council of Social Service and one of Asia’s Best Companies To Work For by HR  Asia  Magazine.   In  the  same  year,  JE  won 2 Gold Awards on Talent Acquisition 
 and  Employee  Relations  awarded  by  the American Chamber of Commerce  China  HR  Best Practices Management Association.  The Group will continue  to live its core values by attracting and retaining top talent in support of the Company’s ambitious growth
 strategy. Johnson Electric Holdings Limited is listed on the Stock Exchange of Hong Kong. (Stock Code: 179) . Company Web Address: http://www.johnsonelectric.com 
 US$3.2 Billion in 2017 
   40,000 employees and subcontract workers in over 23 countries.

Our company strives to offer superior service experience and to become the preferable digital partner for customers. We are preserving an environment with trust, responsibility and caring. At CMHK, we commit to maximizing people’s potential and paving the way toward success for every striver. We are now inviting high caliber professional to join us.   Department: Transmission Network Operation & Maintenance   In this position, you will :  Plan and manage backbone and access network Network design, acceptance and cutover execution Daily operation maintenance, emergency support, follow-up support issues, trouble-shooting interworking problems Report preparation on performance analysis and capacity usage monitoring Assist in system upgrade, expansion, site preparation and integration to live environment   To be successful in this position, you should meet the following requirements:  Degree holder in Electronic / Computer Engineering At least 2 years relevant working experience in telecom industry or computer network Good Knowledge in DWDM/ SDH , GPON, OLT, BNG, MetroEthernet, Layer 2/3 switching, IP product, Routing Protocols, MPLS, Firewall, BGP, CCNA/CCNP Experience in mobile and fixed network, Unix/windows base programming is an advantage Hardworking and willing to learn Good command of spoken/written English/Cantonese/Mandarin Knowledge of UNIX/ Linux OS platform and TCP/ IP Candidate with less experience will be considered as Assistant Engineer     When you work:  5 days work 8 hours/day What you enjoy: Double pay  Discretionary bonus  Performance bonus  Life insurance  Medical insurance Meal allowance Education subsidies  Transportation allowance Birthday gift Marriage leave Birthday leave  Staff discount   CMHK is committed to be an equal opportunity employer. We offer exceptional benefits package and the opportunity to work in a challenging environment. Personal data provided by applicants will be treated strictly in accordance with our personal data policy and for recruitment purposes only.    Please submit your application to us by clicking  button and send your full resume with your availability, current and expected salary to us. title: SALES & EVENTS COORDINATOR
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs SALES & EVENTS COORDINATOR  Big Cat Group Limited Causeway Bay Salary negotiable Posted on 17 Apr 2019 SALES & EVENTS COORDINATOR  Big Cat Group Limited Job Highlights Job Description This is a unique role where you will be part of the rapidly growing Jamie Oliver Restaurant event and sales team. Your role will be focused around
 two key areas – driving group party bookings and delivering an awesome guest experience. Your time will be focused on events sales and management, and you will work closely with the Head of Corporate Sales & Events to make sure the events and catering sales
 goals are achieved and work closely to ensure that the event strategy is aligned. You will also take a leading position in defining and shaping the right offer for different target groups and customers, and in walking your trade-zone
 building relationships and sales leads. No day will be the same, as you will have the opportunity to develop new sales leads each day. The role is dynamic and challenging, and requires
 a person with great communication skills and a passion for hospitality excellence and public relations. You will also be very well organised and able to respond to customers quickly and in a professional way. This position working location will mainly be at the Causeway Bay office, but also in between Causeway Bay and TST restaurants to conduct regular
 site visits with prospect clients, meetings & to supervise events ensuring that operations are ready and the customer has an awesome experience.   Events and Catering Services Sales Drive sales with the local neighbor-hoods in which we operate: Main point of contact for small/medium events including birthday parties, local office events and regular cooking classes Building mid-long-term relationships with local residences,
  to drive events like kids parties, cooking classes, graduation parties and catering sales via offices visits, sales meetings and direct sales calls Support Jamie’s Partner programme by building relationships surrounding hotels and serviced apartments’ Concierge to pitch their guests’ business Contribute to achieving the departmental goals via the events and catering revenue generation Conduct market intelligence researches on competitors for critical analysis and insights Understand client’s needs to work out customized menus and awesome events proposals Work with the Kitchen team so menus offers are as practical as possible to operate in order to ensure kitchen can deliver and that clients have
 a great dining experiences Update our events excel template with costing for each menu item, projected sales and gross profits to ensure reaching the minimum target set
 by the company   Events and Catering Services Management Communication Plan and conduct pre-event meetings with clients and Operations team to identify ways to enhance the guest experience Communicate with
 
about high potential and keep updated events calendar Attend weekly Sales & Marketing Meeting and
 Hosting Meet and greet the clients upon arrival and make sure that they feel a Jamie-style welcome Supervise the organization of post-event feedbacks collection and follow-up, identifying further business opportunities Assist on a smooth execution of small/medium size events that take place at the restaurants, some exhibitions or caterings events   Ideally with a sales and events working experience. Food strong knowledge preferred but not required. You just need to have a passion to learn
 and try to anticipate what would be needed to create an awesome event experience for our customers, whether coming for a group dinner, a birthday party, a friend’s gathering or else Minimum 3 years of sales work experience in hospitality preferred Excellent verbal and written communication skills and personally presentable – knowing what to wear Enjoy working independently and willing to work flexible hours (e.g. evenings, weekends sometimes for specific events) Confident in dealing with simple excel and numbers to work out food cost and menus quotations Able to send out clear emails and use Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint and Excel) Please send your CV and current and expected salary by clicking "Apply Now". All Personal data collected will be used for recruitment purpose only. description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Senior Application Manager / Application Manager – Technology & Digital Services New World China Land Limited Central Salary negotiable Posted on 19 Mar 2019 Senior Application Manager / Application Manager – Technology & Digital Services New World China Land Limited Job Highlights Job Description Responsibilities:  Collaborate with business teams and senior management to  ideate and introduce digital & innovative solutions for value creation; Ensure digital / innovation solution meet business requirements with responsive delivery (via in house bespoke or vendor offerings) according to NWCL Group standards including architecture, delivery methodology, security coding and integration; Lead the end-to-end planning, requirement formulation, design & development, testing, training, implementation, rollout and continuous improvement of enterprise wide digital & innovative platforms; including both internal, external and group wide solutions; Manage application architecture design including data definition, process / data modeling and integration; Conduct training and sharing session to facilitate awareness of best practices, group wide & vendor digital / innovative solutions;  Engage strategic vendors for evaluation, collaborative development of digital / innovative solutions from proof-of-concept to realization; Collaborate with application & technology infrastructure teams for addressing seamless integration and protection of business data;  Drive the rollout of digital / innovative solutions as Group standard to all NWCL business units and regional teams;  Lead the application team in resolving incidents in mission-critical production systems and facilitate sustained operation & continuous improvement upon go-live.   Requirements: Bachelor or higher degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or related discipline, degree holder with strong association with Business Administration will also be considered; At least 8 years related to digital / innovation solution development and deployment with mobile / web-based (include APP & WeChat mini program) / workflow solution development background is preferred; Strong experience in  Microsoft SQL, MS.Net environment with C# and Visual Studio, ASP.NET / Entity Framework / jQuery / AngularJS; with K2 and Python experience an advantage; Strong understanding of the key trends in technology innovations, particularly real estates and customer services with experience in managing proof-of-concept and/or adopt agile approach for accelerated solution delivery;  Strong communication, negotiation, influencing skills, with the ability to interact with senior management and external partners; Well organized, independent, self-motivated and good team leader; Proficient in both written and spoken English and Chinese, including Putonghua; and occasional PRC travel is required; Knowledge in Big Data/ Machine Learning / IoT / BIM integration and experienced in building/construction industry will be an advantage; Candidate with higher qualification will be considered as Senior Application Manager. We offer competitive remuneration, 5 days work, life insurance, hospitalization and outpatient medical schemes, and other fringe benefits to the right candidate. Interested candidates, please forward your full resume with current and expected salary to Human Resources Department at 9/F, New World Tower 1, 18 Queen’s Road Central, Hong Kong or by e-mail. (Personal data collected will be used for recruitment purpose only. All collected information will be kept on our files for 24 months.) The NWCL vision is embodied by a humanistic spirit inspiring us to create fulfilling places and thriving cities that people love to call home. Guided by insight, we inject innovation into large-scale mixed-use commercial landmarks, offices, shopping centres, residential neighbourhoods and hotels while preserving local heritage, creating sustainable developments that allow people, city and nature to flourish in harmony. We bring the “Soul of the City” to life. title: Supply Chain Executive (1 year renewable contract)
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Supply Chain Executive (1 year renewable contract)  Philip Morris Asia Ltd Southern Area Salary negotiable Posted on 20 Mar 2019 Supply Chain Executive (1 year renewable contract)  Philip Morris Asia Ltd Job Highlights Job Description OUR VISION  You may have heard of Philip Morris International (PMI), the world’s leading Tobacco Company and the maker of Marlboro – the undisputed number one cigarette brand in the world.  But PMI is about more than cigarettes. We’ve made a significant or momentum business decision to go “smoke-free” and work towards a world where non-combustible tobacco and nicotine products may one day replace cigarettes. Find out more on https://www.pmiscience.com/  We’re now laying the foundation to make our smoke-free vision a reality (read about our transformation here: https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2017-03-08/big-tobacco-has-caught-startup-fever), and we are looking for a talented Manager Device Product and Process Improvement to work at our Hong Kong office to make it happen. YOU You will be employed in Hong Kong under Philip Morris Asia Limited (PMAL). PMAL operates as a subsidiary of Philip Morris International, Inc.  RISE TO THE CHALLENGE  You will be leading day-to-day supply planning processes with RRP device/components production centers in Asia with the key objective to ensure supply to market OTIF. This includes leading the communication and ensuring the market requirements are transmitted in an adequate way of continuous improvement and simplification of processes are key to ensure mutual understanding and smooth supply planning process Key Accountabilities  Work with EMS on supply plan to fulfill monthly demand with the objective of 100% OTIF. Resolve issues to ensure demand are met. Communicate shipment plan with S&OP team. Communicate unconstrained forecast with supplier incl. ensuring clarity of data. Leveling/Constraining plan: taking into account all operational constraints (e.g. installed capacity, uptime, shutdowns, components supply) and trigger all feasible actions by supplier and RRP SC to remove constraints.  Manage Short Term Plan (STP) Changes, i.e. planning of regular & adhoc non-commercial requirements while giving the right prioritization to RRP Production Centers in Asia.  New product material readiness - Provide initial forecast, reserve capacity, order new materials within lead time, highlight potential risks. Optimize stock policy to support demand requirement with agreed flexibility, Reconcile PMI total potential cost exposure, monitor supplier & ensure management is updated monthly via executive summary. Perform analysis on pricing updates to ensure price is maintained in an adequate manner. Manage price list updates based on contracts and release SKU quotes. Consolidate and analyze spend/saving reports. Manage supplier creation, ad hoc activities, such as data gathering, consolidation & analysis. Support Finance on adequate data to run budget cycle from the Procurement side.  Support reporting and analysis on supply planning area. Identify opportunities for continuous improvement on current process Essential Skills and competencies: A minimum of 5 years of experience in Supply Planning with exposure to a multinational environment preferable in the electronic business environment. A College/University degree in Supply Chain Management/ engineering or equivalent is required. Project Management Experience, Action oriented, Priority Setting, Problem Solving, Standing Alone, Learning on the fly, Listening, Organizational Agility Functional skills: Good knowledge of SAP, Excellent MS Office skills [particularly Excel – including creation & analysis of large database] and Workpoint Displaying the following traits would be an advantage: Detail-oriented Action oriented, and bring strong analytical skills and good problem solving skills Team player Pro-active   JOIN A GLOBAL MARKET LEADER PMI is the world's leading international tobacco company, with six of the world's top 15 international brands and products sold in more than 180 markets. In addition to the manufacture and sale of cigarettes, including the number one global cigarette brand, and other tobacco products, PMI is engaged in the development and commercialization of Reduced-Risk Products ("RRPs"). RRPs is the term we use to refer to products that present, are likely to present, or have the potential to present less risk of harm to smokers who switch to these products versus continued smoking. We have a range of RRPs in various stages of development, scientific assessment and commercialization. Because our RRPs do not burn tobacco, they produce far lower quantities of harmful and potentially harmful compounds than found in cigarette smoke. For more information, see www.pmi.com and www.pmiscience.com. FIND A NEW PATH Our company offers you a fresh perspective. Here, you will never stop exploring and discovering. We take on-the-job learning to another level, giving you every opportunity to develop your career and reach your full potential. With innovative technologies, services and processes, backed by a competitive salary and compensation package, you will work in a professional setting with clients and team members from all over the world.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status. If you believe you would be a good fit to the requirements of the role, and you would like to explore further a career path within PMI, please apply now so that we can start the conversation.         Additional Information Career Level Not Specified Qualification Not Specified Industry Job Function Years of Experience Not Specified Employment Type Contract Benefits Dental insurance, Double pay, Flexible working hours, Medical insurance, Travel allowance Company details More Jobs from this employer Manufacturing Integration Manager Posted on  5 hours ago Failure Analysis Senior Engineer Posted on  08-Apr-19 Senior Devices Process Development Engineer Posted on  08-Apr-19 View all jobs from this employer About JobsDB About jobsDB FAQ Career @ jobsDB Contact us Contact us International partners Bdjobs (Bandladesh) Brighter Monday (East Africa) Catho (Brazil) Jobberman (West Africa) JobStreet (S.E. The proposed recruitment targets a talented professional to play a pivotal part as in the team to support ongoing business expansion and marketing initiatives. Perform various data analysis covering customer sentiment / behavior / profiling / segmentation, precision marketing initiatives and firm-wide financial / operational optimization modelling; Drive analytics data strategy, including data capture, data enhancement, data cleansing - with internal / external data management capability to enable quality analytics; Manage BU analytics through A.I. modelling, visualization design and insight generation process, provide expertise when advanced analytics is required; Partnering with business to deliver the value adding analytics insights into relevant business actions; Effectively present business insights gained from MI/ analytics reports to senior management for business decision making; Coordination of joint-up with external startups and/or Fintech entities for development of innovative technology, such as Blockchain, linking with the BOCI ecosystem; and Project management of innovation development activities within BOCI. Requirements: Degree in Statistics, Math, Computing, Engineering, Actuarial, etc. (preferably with post-graduate degrees Up to 4 years of relevant working experience   Good knowledge of predictive modelling, big data analysis, and data science projects: machine learning, statistical modeling, and data mining techniques & algorithms (e.g. logistic regression, linear regression, random forest, neural network, deep learning, cluster analysis, time series, survival analysis etc.) Must have proficiency in scripting/programming language(s) like Python, R, Alteryx, SAS or SQL / NoSQL DB, etc. Knowledge of text mining / Natural Language Processing (NLP) / web analytics is preferred. Proficiency in written and spoken English and Chinese is essential. Good Chinese writing and/or presentations preparation skills are definitely welcomed Exposures to digital marketing / eCommerce will be an asset Previous Big Data Team applicants who attempted the written tests last year are welcomed to re-apply if interested. Please apply in strict confidence with full resume, academic record, current and expected salaries. And we always attribute the company success to every single team member.   GT grew from a small scale startup to a family with more than 300 passionates over 5 regional offices.  With expertise and excellent teamwork, over 500 highly creditable mobile apps, web services and over 150 long-term partnerships were formed with many MNCs including AIA, AXA, Prudential, HSBC, BOCHK, Apple Inc, BMW etc.    Everyone in GT is our treasured asset, we value on personal growth and communication among teams. title: Consultant - Developer - Analytics & Information Management - Consulting - Hong Kong
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Consultant - Developer - Analytics & Information Management - Consulting - Hong Kong Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Admiralty Salary provided Posted on 22 Mar 2019 Consultant - Developer - Analytics & Information Management - Consulting - Hong Kong Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Job Highlights Job Description Deloitte Consulting is the world's largest management consulting practice. In China we are one of the top consulting firms. Our team comprises around 1,600 bilingual consulting talents located in eight cities in China including Shanghai, Beijing, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Guangzhou, Cheng Du, Chong Qing and Harbin. In global, we have over 44,000 professionals spreading in over 100 countries/locations. Deloitte Consulting is ranked No.1 in global consulting marketplace by revenue by Kennedy, a leading publisher of consulting marketplace analysis products. In China, Deloitte Consulting is ranked as one of the top 3 consulting service providers by Gartner, a global leading IT research and advisory company. Deloitte consulting is awarded as "the Best HR Consulting Firm".   Deloitte Consulting Technology Service Area aims to provide the end-to-end consulting services by helping clients in different industries to re-engineer the business process, design the enterprise level application system architecture and modules, implement the application systems, manage the changes of business along the whole process, and realize the digital transformation. Deloitte Technology Consulting team is the world-leading enterprise application consulting organization, and continuously ranked as "leader" in the enterprise application consulting market in China for years.    Analytics & Information Management (A&IM) service line aims to help clients get transformation based on insights from data. The service portfolio includes advanced data analytics, big data, data management, enterprise performance management and enterprise data platform etc. The business domain of A&IM covers almost all kinds of business function of clients, like marketing, finance, risk and operation etc. Deloitte’s A&IM service has been ranked as ‘Leader’ by Gartner for several times in recent years. Work in a fast growing and challenging environment with like-minded people who are eminent in their respective technical field; Develop solutions through collaboration and discussion, within our teams and with clients; Continue your professional development to reinforce and expand your chosen career path in a wide range of industries; Work with high profile clients on a variety of local and international engagements; Take part in Business Development and contribute ideas to grow the consulting practice.   Requirement:  Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Statistics, Finance or a related discipline is preferred. Other degree holder will also be considered; Experience in management consulting or technology consulting environment; Minimum 2 years' hands-on implementation experience in at least one of the following areas:  o SQL, PL/SQL, Java, Shell scripts  o Microservices, ESB, API  o Docker, OpenShift, Kubernetes, etc.  o Node.js, react.js, TensorFlow.js, etc.  o Cloud services: AWS, Azure, etc. Good verbal (fluency in English, proficiency in Cantonese, and/or Putonghua) and written (English and Chinese) communication skills; Good team and interpersonal skills; Excellent analytical and problem solving skills; Initiative, commitment and motivation; Proven effectiveness of working independently and in teams  Ability to work well under pressure.    Please submit an online application via our careers site (https://jobs2.deloitte.com/cn/en/job/DELOA003X287440/Consultant-Developer-Analytics-Information-Management-Consulting-Hong-Kong )   For more details, please visit our careers site ( )   Deloitte is an equal opportunity employer. Personal data provided will be used strictly in accordance with our Personal Data Policy, a copy of which can be found at the above website. Additional Information Career Level Not Specified Qualification Not Specified Industry Job Function Years of Experience Not Specified Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Five-day work week, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus Company Website Company details About Deloitte China The Deloitte China network of firms, backed by the global Deloitte network, deliver a full range of audit, consulting, financial advisory, risk advisory and tax services to local, multinational and growth enterprise clients. We are one of the leading professional services providers in this marketplace with 21 offices in Beijing, Hong Kong, Shanghai, Changsha, Chengdu, Chongqing, Dalian, Guangzhou, Hangzhou, Harbin, Hefei, Jinan, Macau, Nanjing, Shenyang, Shenzhen, Suzhou, Tianjin, Ulaanbaatar, Wuhan and Xiamen in China. The  Deloitte purpose  is about making an impact that matters to our clients. Our extensive service spectrum enables us to help clients become leaders wherever they choose to compete. Deloitte is committed to investing in our people and empowers them to achieve more than they could elsewhere. Our work combines advice with action and integrity. We believe that when our clients and society are stronger, so are we. To learn more about how Deloitte makes an impact that matters in the China marketplace, please connect with our Deloitte China social media platforms via www2.deloitte.com/cn/en/social-media. title: Senior Consultant/ Manager – ServiceNow – Deloitte Digital – Consulting - Hong Kong
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Senior Consultant/ Manager – ServiceNow – Deloitte Digital – Consulting - Hong Kong Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Admiralty Salary provided Posted on 22 Mar 2019 Senior Consultant/ Manager – ServiceNow – Deloitte Digital – Consulting - Hong Kong Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Job Highlights Job Description   Deloitte Consulting is the world's largest management consulting practice. In China we are one of the top consulting firms. Our team comprises around 1,600 bilingual consulting talents located in eight cities in China including Shanghai, Beijing, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Guangzhou, Cheng Du, Chong Qing and Harbin. In global, we have over 44,000 professionals spreading in over 100 countries/locations. Deloitte Consulting is ranked No.1 in global consulting marketplace by revenue by Kennedy, a leading publisher of consulting marketplace analysis products. In China, Deloitte Consulting is ranked as one of the top 3 consulting service providers by Gartner, a global leading IT research and advisory company. Deloitte consulting is awarded as "the Best HR Consulting Firm".     About Technology Deloitte Consulting Technology Service Area aims to provide the end-to-end consulting services by helping clients in different industries to re-engineer the business process, design the enterprise level application system architecture and modules, implement the application systems, manage the changes of business along the whole process, and realize the digital transformation. Deloitte Technology Consulting team is the world-leading enterprise application consulting organization, and continuously ranked as "leader" in the enterprise application consulting market in China for years.     is a bold and innovative part of Deloitte Consulting, a world leading management consulting practice. We offer everything digital from strategy, multi-channel, bespoke development and managed solutions. Deloitte Digital is an innovative leader in online and mobile strategy, design and development, offering world-class knowledge and resources from the leading global business and technology consultancy. We work with a wide range of iconic local and global organizations, helping them understand and profit from the online and mobile revolution.   Our focus is on the areas of digital strategy, mobile, social/web, content management and managed services. Underpinned by digital tech architecture, application implementation and development expertise. We approach our work with great energy and passion as we align our client's business aspirations to the goals of the end user.   About ServiceNow Deloitte’s innovative process and service-focused solution model offers a perfect complement to progressive on-demand Service Management solutions like ServiceNow. To enhance our ServiceNow delivery capability Deloitte is looking for high caliber, multidimensional ITSM/ Employee Experience/ Customer Experience and ServiceNow Business Analysis experts with proven skills in assisting organizations in adopting Agile best practices. Successful candidates will have a blend of expertise in Agile and ServiceNow requirements definition/design.   You will be working with our clients to complete the sales and delivery cycle through the evangelizing of technology, conveying the art of the possible and showcasing business value to our clients leveraging the ServiceNow platform.       Client Management: Manage day to day interactions with executive clients and sponsors  Project Strategy and Assessment: Conduct strategic analysis to identify the client’s current organizational maturity within the PPM space. Activities include conducting stakeholder interviews, performing gap analyses, developing a future state roadmap, and assisting with the vendor selection process  Implementation and Delivery: Manage and deliver ServiceNow related client engagements that identify, design, and implement technology and creative business solutions for large companies. Understand and explain the various lifecycle components of the service management space, including:  IT Operation Management - Receiving, evaluating, and deciding upon the execution of IT service requests  Project/Program Management - Managing and controlling project progress, resources, risks, issues, financials, scope, and quality  Results Management - Managing, tracking, and reporting project results in comparison to the approved business case  Portfolio Management - Monthly management of the overall portfolio. Constantly reassessing and improving processes  Customer Service Management – Managing the customer service lifecycle to fulfill the order with good customer experience  Responsibilities include, among others, managing teams in the identification of business requirements, functional design, process design (including scenario design, flow mapping), prototyping, testing, training, defining support procedures.  Business Development: Develop and maintain contact with top decision makers at key clients; organize and lead pursuit teams; participate and lead aspects of the proposal development process; contribute to the development of proposal pricing strategies  People Development: Perform role of counselor and coach; provide input and guidance into the staffing process; actively participate in staff recruitment and retention activities; provide leadership and support for delivery teams and staff in local offices  Internal Development: Socialize and evangelize the full capabilities of the ServiceNow Platform to Internal Lead Client Service Partner (LCSP)      Understand key objectives for clients and Deloitte, align people to objectives and set priorities and direction  Influence clients, teams, and individuals positively, leading by example and establishing confident relationships with increasingly senior people  Deliver exceptional client service; maximize results and drive high performance from people while fostering collaboration across businesses and borders  Develop high-performing people and teams through challenging and meaningful opportunities  Act as a role model, embracing and living our purpose and values, and recognizing others for the impact they make     8+ years related experience progressively responsible experience as a Project Delivery Manager, Senior Consultant, Consultant, or a related occupation  At least 2 years of experience managing large technology engagements.  Knowledge of ITSM or HR or Customer Service function, processes, and best practices  Knowledge of Case Management, Knowledge Management best practices and design  Demonstrated prior experience in managing teams of 5+ resources through design, development, and/or operations of complex technology environments.  Experience in responding RFPs and presenting solutions to executives  Experience designing and/or implementing an shared services center  Experience with the ServiceNow Service Delivery application is preferred  ServiceNow certified is preferred  External big 4 consulting experience is preferred     Please submit an online application via our careers site (https://jobs2.deloitte.com/cn/en/job/DELOA003X250234/Senior-Consultant-Manager-ServiceNow-Deloitte-Digital-Consulting-Hong-Kong )   For more details, please visit our careers site ( )   Deloitte is an equal opportunity employer. Personal data provided will be used strictly in accordance with our Personal Data Policy, a copy of which can be found at the above website. Additional Information Career Level Not Specified Qualification Not Specified Industry Job Function Years of Experience Not Specified Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Five-day work week, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus Company Website Company details About Deloitte China The Deloitte China network of firms, backed by the global Deloitte network, deliver a full range of audit, consulting, financial advisory, risk advisory and tax services to local, multinational and growth enterprise clients. We are one of the leading professional services providers in this marketplace with 21 offices in Beijing, Hong Kong, Shanghai, Changsha, Chengdu, Chongqing, Dalian, Guangzhou, Hangzhou, Harbin, Hefei, Jinan, Macau, Nanjing, Shenyang, Shenzhen, Suzhou, Tianjin, Ulaanbaatar, Wuhan and Xiamen in China. title: Senior Consultant, Data Scientist, D&A, Management Consulting
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Senior Consultant, Data Scientist, D&A, Management Consulting KPMG Central Salary provided Posted on 22 Mar 2019 Senior Consultant, Data Scientist, D&A, Management Consulting KPMG Job Highlights Job Description In KPMG's Management Consulting practice, we do not limit ourselves to either strategy or implementation. Instead, we deliver both. Our team in Hong Kong is the fastest-growing division within KPMG China and represents a young and enthusiastic team that always pushes itself to succeed. Since our creation, we have developed an in-depth body of knowledge of an incredibly broad spread of sectors and services.  Our Data & Analytics has both applied Data Science and Big Data architecture capabilities. In KPMG, you’ll work with a diverse team of sophisticated data and analytics professionals to explore solutions for our clients. This means your ability to find answers is limited only by your creativity in leveraging a vast array of techniques and tools. Be a part of a high-energy, diverse, fast-paced, and innovative culture of a leading global consulting firm. For you, that translates into the chance to work on a wide range of projects, covering technologies and solutions from traditional data analytics to machine learning and Natural Language Processing (NLP).  The role of a Senior Consultant within KPMG has three specific areas of focus:    - Support building strong and lasting client relationships through excellent interpersonal skills - Working with Senior Management and Leadership to develop compelling propositions which target relevant client issues - Identifying project opportunities and supporting the development of proposals   - Taking a supporting role in managing initiatives to appropriately market Data & Analytics capabilities and services     - Delivery of high quality advisory and/or technical services to our clients - Managing and executing the delivery of engagements or projects - Building lasting relationships with key client stakeholders - Identifying and managing risks whilst maximising profitability and ensuring the Firm's frameworks are implemented appropriately and effectively    - Utilising previous and ongoing experience to build and develop knowledge within the team - Developing and building delivery capabilities by either working as a developer or subject-matter expertise - Supporting key training and sharing knowledge within team  As part of this team, you will be providing specialised consulting services in Data Science, including solution design, solution development and system implementation, to clients across different industries.    - Bachelor's degree or above in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Information System or any discipline with strong quantitative elements - 3+ years experience relating to Data & Analytics, with at least 2 years in delivery experience for statistical modelling and data science related works - Demonstrated expertise in machine learning techniques – e.g., logistic regression, random forest, support vector machine, cluster analysis, KNN, naive Bayes, dimensionality reduction, Bayesian methods and time series modelling - Hand-on scripting and programming experience with at least two of the following common data science tools: Python, R, SQL, Matlab or Scala - Experience in Natural Language Processing (NLP) or text mining is preferred - A data-oriented mind-set, enjoy facing new challenges and learn new data science technology skills - Strong communication skills with capability of translating business requirement into technical needs and articulating technical concepts or results to non-technical audience - Flexible and adaptive to work either independently or lead remote development teams in a fast-paced environment - Experience working in a consulting environment is preferred - Good English language skills; Mandarin skills preferred but not required  We offer successful candidates an attractive remuneration package and the opportunity to work in a dynamic and exciting environment.  Personal data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only.  © 2018 KPMG, a Hong Kong partnership and a member firm of the KPMG network of independent member firms affiliated with KPMG International Cooperative ("KPMG International"), a Swiss entity. All rights reserved. With an all round understanding and experience in analytics and how it plays into financial services, you will be able to work with clients to understand what their problem is, pull together the right resources into a solution team and work with them to implement a quality solution. With a view on holistic solutions for Banking clients, you will have the chance to work on new innovations leveraging the KPMG stack of capabilities. Likely to have experience in other consultancy firms, this is an opportunity to build a new team in a growing practice and take on new challenges as a key individual in our client support. Responsibilities include - Drive and lead the creation of a Data & Analytics team and capability to support one of our key financial services clients in China - Be responsible and accountable for revenue as part of the wider team – help to identify and convert opportunities to successful engagements - Be part of a wider technical capability team involved in design, development and execution of new solutions meeting the needs of our clients. - Further build out the existing Data & Analytics capability and accelerate delivery of key initiatives against business goals. This is primarily focused on creation of alternative data solutions, insights platforms and big data analytics. - Demonstrable success in cross jurisdictional and complex project delivery - Manage senior stakeholders and budget owners and be able to provide appropriate messaging at the right time - Serve as a trusted advisor to the customer, building long-lasting relationships and maintaining knowledge of the technical architecture within our key accounts - Demonstrate expertise in relevant practices by speaking at industry conferences - Establish and maintain a high performing, open culture based on integrity and strong partnership and financial responsibility.  - Maintain strong relationships with partners supporting managed services business lines, partner firm team and other technology functions. Qualifications and experience - 15+ years of demonstrated leadership roles in the financial industry or a related field with a strong understanding/focus on Technology/Data/Analytics management - Exceptional analytical, logical thinking and detail orientation  - Bachelor degree in analytics, computer science, information technology or a related field - Experience leading large teams and driving business success - Successful track record as a change leader - Ability to communicate a vision and inspire others to deliver - Ability to engage and influence stakeholders at all levels within an organization  - Strong written and spoken English language skills essential We offer successful candidates an attractive remuneration package and the opportunity to work in a dynamic and exciting environment. title: Audit Analytics Manager, IT Audit
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Audit Analytics Manager, IT Audit Hang Seng Bank Ltd Not Specified Salary provided Posted on 22 Mar 2019 Audit Analytics Manager, IT Audit Hang Seng Bank Ltd Job Highlights Job Description IT Audit Department Hang Seng's Internal Audit (INA) function provides independent, objective assurance to management and the Audit Committee over the risk management, governance and controls framework, including financial controls to add value and to improve operations through process and control enhancement recommendations. Our Internal Audit function accomplishes its objectives by bringing a systematic, disciplined approach to the evaluation and improvement of the effectiveness of risk management, control, and governance processes and thereby helps the Bank to achieve its own objectives within its stated risk appetite and in accordance with Bank ethics, values and standards.    We are currently seeking a high caliber professional to join our department as  .   The role of the Audit Analytics Manager is to support the individual audit teams in designing, delivering and utilizing innovative, automated analytical tools to improve the overall effectiveness of the execution of audit activities.  The successful candidate will be a curious and critical thinker, passionate to design insightful analytics making optimum use of structured and unstructured data and communicating outputs in simple, elegant means.    The capture of risk drivers in individual Hang Seng Lines of Business and Functions that allow Hang Seng INA to monitor and make more timely and better informed decisions on when, where, and how to deploy audit resources and/or change the timing, frequency, and scope of audit work;  Innovative tests of control utilizing digitized artifacts (data);  Continuous tests of control using advanced analytics ;  Evaluate and implement new tools that will enable Audit Analytics to meet the technology needs of Hang Seng INA;  Develop and follow sustainable processes to support the Audit Analytics operational requirements, including management of risk associated with performance of the analytic (e.g. cross-border data transfer);  Develop their knowledge of data sources, structures, meta-data, etc. existing in select Lines of Business or Functions and regions for possible use by the Audit teams;  Design, build, and deliver data analytics solutions to meet the needs of Audit;  Implement and follow an agile, iterative, adaptive approach during the development/delivery of audit technology solutions to meet the timely needs of Audit and add the most value;  Drive discussion and collaborate with INA teams to identify areas where technology can add value and existing data can be used to improve audit tests and audit knowledge;  Utilize network to source data as needed, observing internal policy and relevant regulations (e.g. cross border, data transfer);  Lead the evaluation and implementation of new tools to meet the technology needs of Hang Seng INA;  Build and leverage an internal support network (IT, Business Intelligence, Centre of Excellence, Business Users, etc.) to help in solving problems and eliminating hurdles in delivering audit technology solutions;  Deliver meaningful and timely results to the teams supported;  Exercise effective project management over the projects assigned / led. Track record in data analytics, Big Data platforms, including data engineering, analysis and modeling; Solid experience with Business Intelligence / analytical tools and programming (e.g. SAS, SQL, Python, R, Tableau, Qlikview, Hadoop); Experience of statistical techniques, data mining and machine learning algorithms such as regression techniques, neural networks, decision trees, clustering, pattern recognition, probability theory, stochastic systems, Bayesian inference, statistical techniques;  Experience of Internal or External audit would be a plus; Bachelor or Master degree in information systems, mathematics, statistics or other quantitative disciplines, big data / data science or related field and equivalent experience; Strong analytical, decision making, interpersonal, time & project management and problem solving skills; Enthusiastic, collaborative and customer oriented;  Resourceful and results driven;  Fluent in written and spoken English;  Effective presentation and influencing skills.   Candidates with less experience will be considered for the position of  Assistant Audit Analytics Manager, IT Audit . All information provided by applicants will be used only for recruitment purposes and will be used strictly in accordance with the Bank's personal data policies, a copy of which may be obtained by the applicant upon request. Unless otherwise instructed in writing by the applicant concerned, applicants may be considered for other suitable positions within the Bank and its related companies. The personal data of unsuccessful job applicants may be retained for a maximum of two years from the date when the job application is rejected and such data may be retained for a longer period if there is a subsisting reason that obliges the Bank to do so, after which the personal data will be destroyed. Additional Information Career Level Middle Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience Not Specified Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Company Website Company details A Career with Hang Seng Bank  Hang Seng is committed to service excellence. Our people are our most important asset and play a vital role in our efforts to continually enhance our performance for customers and provide best-in-class products and services. We seek to attract high-calibre talent by offering a dynamic working environment, good career development opportunities and competitive compensation packages.  doing Assist in different events as required Immediate availability is highly preferred Requirements: Experience using multi-media software is essential Cheerful and positive working attitude Responsible, kind, patient and passionate about children Proficient in both English and Cantonese, intermediate Mandarin is a bonus Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Good at time management   Benefits: 5 days off per month Split shift Staff meals provided Medical insurance   The Big Things Playground opens 7 days a week from 10am to 8pm. Candidates will need to work shifts according to the roster of the company. Work will be required
 on Saturdays, Sundays and Public Holidays.   Interested parties please send your resume clearly stating your expected salary and your date availability to start work, in English to The Big Things Playground.
 Personal data collected from job applicants will be used for recruitment purposes only. Additional Information Career Level Not Specified Qualification Not Specified Industry Job Function Years of Experience Not Specified Employment Type Full Time, Part Time Benefits Medical insurance Company details Join our team to be The Big Things! About The Big Things: A unique nature themed playground, masterminded by The Big Things and created through the collective efforts of Lappset Finland and our Hong Kong team, is opening in April! Immerse yourself in rare animals, insects, volcanoes and surround yourself with the wonders of the earth. This is the perfect place for children to learn about nature through sensory play and physical
 activities, in a safe indoor environment. We hope to encourage children gain a better understanding of the world they live in. When hunger strikes, we have the perfect place to satisfy your appetite. The Big Things Kitchen is a haven of delicious, balanced delights. title: Finance Manager
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Finance Manager  Safari Asia Limited Yau Tsim Mong Area Salary provided Posted on 22 Mar 2019 Finance Manager  Safari Asia Limited Job Highlights Job Description Job Description: Perform all round of finance and accounting duties, including but not limited to, manage financial reviews, analysis, corporate budget and forecast, cash flow,
 tax, operation and annual reporting; Perform finance and accounting functions of funds; Work closely with the investment team to understand investment structure and support   investment execution;   Prepare monthly
 consolidation, management report, analysis and FRR monitoring; Possess knowledge of HK SFO Rules and relevant regulatory requirements to ensure all activities and duties are compliant with all statutory requirements;   Develop and maintain
 internal controls for both financial and operational aspects. Ensure internal controls are proper and sufficient to maintain all levels of compliance, continuously review and improve where necessary; Provide professional financial and tax planning advice to management; Liaise with external auditors, bankers, legal, compliance, transfer agents and custodians;   Assist Management
 for the execution of special projects as assigned.   Requirements: Degree or above holder in Accountancy and Finance or related discipline; CPA with at least 3 years of relevant experience in finance and accounting, managing finance functions in asset management firms/ brokerage/ financial institution; Comprehensive experience in handling daily financial operations and management reporting and in the operations of an asset management organization; Solid experience in securities accounting and FRR preparation is a MUST;  Big 4 external audit training is a MUST; Experience as Company Secretary is a plus; Strong leadership, presentation, analytical and problem-solving skills;   Good command
 of written and spoken English and Chinese;  Candidates with more experiences will be considered as a senior role.  Please submit the application by clicking APPLY NOW with your current and expected salary.
 Personal data will be used for recruitment purpose only. title: AI Project Manager (Public Institution)
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs AI Project Manager (Public Institution) Kelly Services Hong Kong Limited Central & Western Area Salary provided Posted on 22 Mar 2019 AI Project Manager (Public Institution) Kelly Services Hong Kong Limited Job Highlights Job Description Selected candidate will be assigned to Public Institution Responsibilities:  Work with internal IT team, business users and vendors to develop AI / Analytics solutions   Responsible for planning and negotiating with different levels of users to prioritze tasks   Conduct business process analysis, requirement analysis, design workshops, prototype sessions with users   Ensure the projects will be delivered on time, within budget, meeting users’ requirements and comply with all established policies, standards and procedures   Responsible for the delivery of maintenance and support services adopting problem/ incident management and vendor management processes.   Supervise your sub-ordinates and contractors to carry out the project and maintenance support works and liaise with other IT teams.   Plan, budget and monitor variances for projects and system support activities in your responsible areas. Business travel may be required.  Requirements: Good knowledge in Machine / Deep Learning, Natural Language Processing, Speech to Text, Text to Speech Good knowledge in AI solutions including virtual agents, video analytics, intelligent search, Robotic Process Automation Good knowledge in AI vendor platforms – IBM, Google, Amazon, Microsoft Good knowledge of Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, Pig, Hive, Spark and so forth Good knowledge of developing cloud solution Good people and vendor management skills are essential. Solid experience in using industry standard methodology and data modelling techniques Solid experience with end-to-end bespoke application development lifecycle including requirement analysis, application design, coding, testing, data conversion, debugging and documentation Knowledge in various business applications and business domain will be an added advantage. Self-motivated with good communication, interpersonal, liaising and supervisory skills Fluent in speaking Cantonese, Putonghua and English Good command of English and Chinese writing To apply for this position, please send your full résumé to contract @kellyservices.com.hk in word format indicating the reference number and title. title: Senior Accountant
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Senior Accountant Canadian Solar Energy Holding Company Limited Not Specified Salary provided Posted on 23 Mar 2019 Senior Accountant Canadian Solar Energy Holding Company Limited Job Highlights Job Description Canadian Solar Inc. (NASDAQ: CSIQ) is one of the three biggest solar companies in the world by revenue. We employ over 12,000 people and operate on 6 continents. We are committed to improving the lives of all those who interact with our brand in the communities we operate in. As a leading manufacturer of solar photovoltaic modules and provider of solar energy solutions, Canadian Solar also has a geographically diversified pipeline of utility-scale power projects in various stages of development. For more information of our company, please visit our website:  www.canadiansolar.com .   Work with various project development/project financing teams and understand project cost and funding structure; Develop weekly project cash flow forecast based on project cost and funding structure; Initiate and participate in various business meetings to understand the progress of a project in development, EPC and financing stage; Read through all the investment documents & memos and financial models to assess the profitability and funding requirement of an investment; Ensure the preparation of full set of accounts (AR, AP, daily book-keeping, bank reconciliation, inter-company transactions, forecast, cash flow statements, billing, inventory and costing) for management review; Develop and maintain monthly financial reporting, forecasts and budget packages; Deliver actionable items or recommendations based on findings through thorough research and analysis; Develop an effective process and ensure that all issues are adequately identified and driven to closure by working with relative owners in operations or finance; Prepare Accounting Memo for Project related transactions, for example, VIE assessment, Revenue recognition assessment and Lease assessment; Assist with regional consolidation reporting.   Qualifications and Experience: Bachelor degree or above in Accounting or Finance. Qualified Accountant with over 6 years of experience in financial analysis/accounting in a large MNC. Strong Excel skills and SAP experience is preferred. Strong communication skills in English. Ability to solve problems independently in a fast paced environment. Strong desire to learn and grow. Big 4 training or audit experience is an advantage. I nterested parties please send your full resume with Current and Expected Salary and Date of Availability by clicking "Apply Now"   Canadian Solar Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from all qualified candidates. title: Financial Reporting Manager / Finance Manager
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Financial Reporting Manager / Finance Manager Canadian Solar International Limited Not Specified Salary negotiable Posted on 23 Mar 2019 Financial Reporting Manager / Finance Manager Canadian Solar International Limited Job Highlights Job Description Canadian Solar Inc. (NASDAQ: CSIQ) is one of the three biggest solar companies in the world by revenue. We employ over 12,000 people and operate on 6 continents. We are committed to improving the lives of all those who interact with our brand in the communities we operate in. As a leading manufacturer of solar photovoltaic modules and provider of solar energy solutions, Canadian Solar also has a geographically diversified pipeline of utility-scale power projects in various stages of development. For more information of our company, p lease visit our website:  www.canadiansolar.com . The position reports to Corporate Controller and  assists in overseeing the SEC and financial reporting functions of  Canadian Solar Inc. (NASDAQ: CSIQ): Review the financial reporting of certain entities and ensure that they are accurate and in compliance with U.S. GAAP; Prepare certain notes to the financial statements and certain items in annual report and form 20-F; Prepare or review accounting memos and analyze complicated or unusual transactions in accordance with U.S. GAAP;  Participate in development and continuous improvement of monthly/quarterly/annually financial reporting process; Assist in the establishment and continuing improvement of accounting policies and procedures; and Perform other duties as required. Bachelor degree in finance or accounting; Minimum 6 years work experiences in big 4 or U.S. listed company; Familiar with U.S. GAAP and knowledge of relevant SEC rules and regulations; Trustworthy, mature and proactive; Team player with good interpersonal skill; Excellent communication skills, both written and oral;  Willing to work hard and under tight schedule; and  Willing to travel.
