title: Senior Credit Analyst
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Senior Credit Analyst Apple Others - China Salary negotiable Posted on 25 Mar 2019 Senior Credit Analyst Apple Job Highlights Job Description Team up with Apple, one of the most influential technology leaders in the industry. Join Apple Finance organization and make a positive impact on a Company that is known for
 its impressive lineup of products, including iPhone, iPad, Mac, iTunes and Watch. At Apple, you’ll share in a commitment to excellence by collaborating with world-class managers, all with one unified vision—creating innovative products that delight customers.
 We do this by hiring quality individuals with integrity, personal accountability, partnership, excellence, and dedicated thinking. If you exemplify our values and want to be part of something big, contact us today.
 We are looking for Credit Manager with relevant knowledge, skills and passion for credit. Apple’s Credit Managers are responsible for portfolios of customer credit lines and
 consequently the position also requires strong credit analysis skills, a hands-on approach towards detailed credit analysis, and exceptional interpersonal skills for communication within the Credit team, with our customers, Sales leaders and the broader Finance
 Team. 10 to 15 years of dynamic commercial credit and risk assessment experience Direct credit analysis, scoring, and underwriting in a commercial bank or large multinational in the technology sector is preferred Ability to quickly understand financial statements, use Excel based models, credit rating agencies and other third party research Ability to effectively articulate risks and mitigating factors for high risk accounts, including both financial and qualitative analysis Strong writing that succinctly articulate credit analysis, customer relationship and recommended actions Well-versed in customer contract credit language, credit risk mitigation structures and implementation (e.g. collateral, credit insurance, bank support, parent support,
 etc.) Comfortable operating independently with minimal direct supervision, reliable judgment, and using deductive and inductive reasoning to resolve a variety of highly complex
 issues in creative and effective ways Ability to influence while working in a collaborative team environment Proven and deep understanding of how credit fits within the broader finance and business operations Customer focus with strong customer relationship competency Meet customers on a regular basis to assess performance and credit worthiness Analyze information to establish credit limits to facilitate sales while limiting losses Prepare periodic credit reviews and bad debt reserve analysis and reporting Monitor changes in economic, industry, and customer conditions and maintain communication with various business divisions to evaluate potential changes to customers' credit
 worthiness and credit limits Make recommendations to mitigate risk when needed Manage security and collateral process and documentation as needed Assist Collection team in resolving customer late payments Maintain financial data and analysis on customers in the portfolio Manage bad debt workouts if needed Build strong relationship with work partners in Sales Finance, Sales, Operations, Global Finance Shared Service Bachelor’s degree in business, finance or accounting required, MBA and/or bank credit training is a strong plus Interested parties click "APPLY NOW" to submit your application. Personal data collected will be used for recruitment purpose only. Additional Information Career Level Senior Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 10 years Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Company Website Company details Apple is a place where extraordinary people gather to do their best work. Our community is made up of every kind of individual: artists and designers,
 engineers and scientists, thinkers and doers. Together we create things and experiences people once couldn't have imagined — and now can't imagine living without. So if you're excited by the idea of making a real impact, a career with Apple might be your dream
 job. Just be ready to dream big. title: Internal Control: Senior Associate / Assistant Manager
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Internal Control: Senior Associate / Assistant Manager  SenseTime Group Limited Shatin Area Salary provided Posted on 26 Mar 2019 Internal Control: Senior Associate / Assistant Manager  SenseTime Group Limited Job Highlights Job Description We are looking for a highly motivated and competent individual, responsible for planning, executing and reporting on operational, regulatory and compliance related audit reviews with a team of internal control professionals,
 and is to provide advice on internal controls on new business initiatives and review/update the Company’s policies.
 Responsibilities: Coordinate, oversee, lead and manage the key aspects of internal control activities including risk assessments, audit planning, audit testing, control evaluation, report drafting, recommendation
 for risk mitigation; Liaise with stakeholders to evaluate, test and report on the adequacy and effectiveness of internal controls in accordance with company and professional standards Perform monitoring of periodic operational data to analyze patterns and trends for risk and control implications; Review and ensure the compliance of local regulatory and corporate standard; Identify associated risks and gaps, provide constructive recommendations and work with operating team in implementing the action plans; Develop policies and operating guidelines as well as conduct trainings across the group.
 Perform ad-hoc assignments as required. Requirements: CIA and/or CPA with Bachelor degree or above in related disciplines; Minimum 4 years solid experience in internal control field, preferably from big 4 or in I.T. industry; Knowledge of internal control frameworks and regulatory requirements would be a definite advantage; Excellent planning, organizing, controlling, and problem-solving skills; Strong communication skill, and hands-on role with proactive and can-do working attitude; Sound analytical and report writing skills; High level of integrity, objectivity and confidentiality; Fluency in written and spoken English and Putonghua is required; Willingness to travel occasionally (expected travelling rate: 20-25%) Location Shatin, Hong Kong Additional Information Career Level Not Specified Qualification Not Specified Industry Job Function Years of Experience Not Specified Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Dental insurance, Five-day work week, Medical insurance, Performance bonus, Travel allowance Company details SenseTime is the world’s most valuable artificial intelligence (AI) unicorn focused on computer vision and deep learning technologies. Its leading AI technologies
 have powered many industries such as smart city, smartphone, mobile Internet, automobile, finance, retail, and robotics, etc. Its core technologies include face recognition, image recognition, character recognition, medical image recognition, video analysis
 and autonomous driving.   SenseTime boasts more than 700 leading strategic partners and customers including MIT, CUHK, Qualcomm, NVIDIA, Honda, Alibaba, Suning, China Mobile, UnionPay,
 Wanda, HNA, Huawei, Xiaomi, OPPO, vivo, Weibo, iFLYTEK, and so forth.   In May 2018, SenseTime raised $620 million in its series C+ round of funding. The company now enjoys a total financing of more than US$1.6 billion and a valuation
 of over US$4.5 billion, maintaining its position as the world’s largest and most valuable AI unicorn. The company has offices in Hong Kong, Beijing, Shenzhen, Shanghai, Chengdu, Hangzhou, Kyoto, Tokyo and Singapore.   Join us, in this journey of our mission towards a better world for a better future.   For more information, please visit SenseTime’s  website ,
 WeChat and  Weibo . title: Senior Engineer / Engineer, Electric Design
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Senior Engineer / Engineer, Electric Design Hong Kong Applied Science and Technology Research Institute Company Limited (ASTRI) Shatin Area Salary provided Posted on 26 Mar 2019 Senior Engineer / Engineer, Electric Design Hong Kong Applied Science and Technology Research Institute Company Limited (ASTRI) Job Highlights Job Description Perform power system’s project design including simulation, circuit design, layout, testing and debugging, and meet existing or future power system project requirements. Develop different power electronic topologies, such as Boost/Buck, LLC resonant converter, phase shift full bridge, three-phase PFC etc. Understand and propose to improve the device-level electrical performance and reliability of power electronics semiconductors, especially for the 3rd generation semiconductor devices (SiC
 & GaN). Provide cross-functional co-ordination among electrical, thermo-mechanical, materials and process, test and reliability groups for product implementation. Participate and contribute to the project proposal writing process and develop key IPs/patents of power electronics technology. Bachelor degree or above in Electric/Electronic Engineering or related disciplines with 6 years of experience in electric circuit design, or Master’s degree with 3 years of experience,
 or PhD in related area. Candidates with less experience will be considered as Engineer. In-depth understanding of the complete project’s developments of power systems ( solar inverter, energy storage system, charger, UPS, datacenter power supply etc.) and its market trends. In-depth knowledge in power topologies, such as LLC resonant converter, phase shift full bridge, three-phase PFC. Skillful in using numerical design related software for parasitic extraction and loss calculation of the whole system. Understand and optimize the high frequency magnetic design, such as power transformer and integrating magnetics. Skillful in power device and power semiconductor characterization, such as SiC MOSFET and IGBT. Experience in digital power design with DSP firmware programing is a big plus. Understand power device reliability and knowledge in power module design is a plus. Fluent in English, good written and oral communication skills. Strong team spirit and interpersonal skills; Independent, responsible, aggressive and outgoing character. Appointment will be on renewable contract terms with a competitive salary and performance-linked variable pay. Fringe benefits include paid leave, medical and dental benefits, insurance
 coverage and contribution to MPF. The incumbent will normally work under a five-day week schedule. Interested candidates should send application (quoting Ref. No.) with detailed resume and, current and expected salary to the HR Department by clicking Apply Now.
 Only short-listed candidates will be notified. Personal data provided by applicants will be used for consideration of an application only. ASTRI reserves the right not to
 fill the position. Additional Information Career Level Not Specified Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience Not Specified Employment Type Contract, Full Time Benefits Dental insurance, Five-day work week, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus Company Website Company details Hong Kong Applied Science and Technology Research Institute Company Limited (ASTRI) 
 was set up by the Hong Kong SAR Government in 2000 with the mission of enhancing Hong Kong’s competitiveness in technology-based industries through applied research. Our R&D strategic focus covers five areas of applications: Financial Technologies, Intelligent
 Manufacturing, Health Technologies, Smart City, and Application Specific Integrated Circuits through our mandate as the Hong Kong branch of the Chinese National Engineering Research Centre (CNERC).
 ASTRI’s core R&D competence in various areas is organised under seven Technology Divisions: Mixed Signal Systems IC, Advanced Digital Systems, Electronics
 Components, Intelligent Sensing Technology System, Intelligent Software and Systems, Security and Data Sciences, and Communications Technologies.

description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Senior Engineer / Engineer, Firmware Design Hong Kong Applied Science and Technology Research Institute Company Limited (ASTRI) Shatin Area Salary provided Posted on 26 Mar 2019 Senior Engineer / Engineer, Firmware Design Hong Kong Applied Science and Technology Research Institute Company Limited (ASTRI) Job Highlights Job Description Perform digital firmware design for power system, and meet existing or future power system project requirements. Propose and achieve algorithm and control loop of power system. Improve system performance and reliability by using firmware design methodology. Provide cross-functional co-ordination among hardware, thermo-mechanical, materials and process, test and reliability groups for product implementation. Participate and contribute to project proposal writing process and develop key IPs/patents of power electronics technology. Bachelor degree or above in Electric/Electronic Engineering or related disciplines with 6 years of experience in electric circuit design, or Master’s degree with 3 years of experience,
 or PhD in related area. Candidates with less experience will be considered as Engineer. In-depth understanding of the complete project’s developments of power systems ( solar inverter, energy storage system, charger, UPS, datacenter power supply etc.) and its market trends. In-depth knowledge in power topologies, such as LLC resonant converter, phase shift full bridge, three-phase PFC. Skillful in using numerical design related software for parasitic extraction and loss calculation of the whole system. Understand and optimize the high frequency magnetic design, such as power transformer and integrating magnetics. Skillful in power device and power semiconductor characterization, such as SiC MOSFET and IGBT. Experience in digital power design with DSP firmware programing is a big plus. Understand power device reliability and knowledge in power module design is a plus. Fluent in English, good written and oral communication skills. Strong team spirit and interpersonal skills; Independent, responsible, aggressive and outgoing character. Appointment will be on renewable contract terms with a competitive salary and performance-linked variable pay. Fringe benefits include paid leave, medical and dental benefits, insurance
 coverage and contribution to MPF. The incumbent will normally work under a five-day week schedule. Interested candidates should send application (quoting Ref. No.) with detailed resume and, current and expected salary to the HR Department by clicking Apply Now.
 Only short-listed candidates will be notified. Personal data provided by applicants will be used for consideration of an application only. ASTRI reserves the right not to
 fill the position. has successfully managed complex projects /  program with a set of deliverables with many interdependencies Experience with business planning, ROI tracking, budgets management- Strong ability to  perform individually as well as in a team Excellent English skills essential, and Cantonese + Mandarin a big advantage Able to travel within and outside Asia up to around 30% Candidates with 8+ years of experience may be considered as Senior Project Manager Additional Information Career Level Middle Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience 8 years Employment Type Full Time Benefits Dental insurance, Double pay, Five-day work week, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus Company Website Company details Fossil Group, Inc. is a global design, marketing and distribution company that specializes in consumer lifestyle and fashion accessories.  The Company's principal offerings include an extensive line of men's and women's fashion watches and jewelry sold under a diverse portfolio of proprietary and licensed brands, handbags, small leather goods, accessories and clothing.  The Company's products are sold to department stores, specialty retail stores and specialty watch and jewelry stores in the U.S. and in approximately 150 countries worldwide through approximately 25 Company-owned foreign sales subsidiaries and a network of over 60 independent distributors.  The Company also distributes its products in over 550 Company-owned and operated retail stores, through its international e-commerce websites and through the Company's U.S. e-commerce website at  www.fossil.com . Certain press release and SEC filing information concerning the Company is also available at  www.fossilgroup.com . title: Assistant Merchandiser
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Assistant Merchandiser Hop Lun Brands Limited Lai Chi Kok Salary negotiable Posted on 26 Mar 2019 Assistant Merchandiser Hop Lun Brands Limited Job Highlights Job Description Role Purpose   DORINA  Assistant Merchandiser will support the Merchandising Manager to achieve KPI’s
 as well as develop & implement business strategies for the growth of  
DORINA.   Job Responsibilities Price negotiation with suppliers for both raw materials and garment production Work closely with Controllers to follow up budget, mark up, price and article plan Maintain Product & Colour Master, update as needed Prepare and issue PO for salesman samples Record receipt of salesman sample and check details are correct before factory releases to Global offices Handle customer sample requests to suppliers and arrange for dispatch to relevant sales offices Responsible for securing and protecting the companies profit margin Work closely with Design team on raw material sourcing negotiating the price, MOQ, MCQ and lead-times Work with Sales team and Merchandising team on customer quality complaints and negotiate settlement for both parties Maintain seasonal shipment samples in orderly manner Work with Manager and suppliers on projections by article and delivery dates. Rework the styles with the production teams should the required
 DORINA  GP% not be achievable Job Requirements Higher Diploma  or above
 in Merchandising, Fashion, Textiles or related discipline 1+ years
 relevant experience in a multinational fashion environment with an understanding of Global markets.
 Strong business acumen with
 strategic yet practical mindset Strong organizational skills Excellent computer knowledge especially in excel Must be a fire-starter with and entreprenurial spirit Enjoys working in a fast growing business environment and has a competitive and result driven mindset Used to working in a matrix organization with strong cross functional collaboration, flat organizational structure and where people are empowered to take own decisions and initiatives Self-driven with ability to take initiatives and push through decisions, driven, positive with a can-do attitude Self motivated, strong team player with excellent communication & presentation skills, verbally and in writing Open, flexible and receptive towards changes Fluent in English. Cantonese and/or Mandarin will be an advantage DORINA Competencies
   BE A "FIRE STARTER" ENTREPRENEUR                                            always come up with ideas to generate leads, to create opportunities, and essentially own the overall pipeline of business         be bothered by inefficiency, always consider whether there are places you could implement solutions or improvements         try to solve, and be energized by any challenge that stands in the way        be immensely passionate about your work, and know what it's like to dive deep into a subject and completely understand it         able to work autonomously and be decisive, make calculated moves by taking calculated risks         keep assuming positive intent in the workplace         able to catch the ball and willing to run the extra miles   ADAPT TO CHANGE & EXECUTE IT FASTER         quickly modifies behavior to deal effectively with changes in the work environment.         does not persist with ineffective behaviors and old routing         consistently remains open to ideas offered by others, supports and uses good ideas to solve problems or address issues         help others to develop a clear understanding of what they will need to do differently, as a result of changes in the company    DELIVER COMMITMENT         demonstrate personal commitment to team   and
 company         exhibits a sense of responsibility towards company goals     DEMONSTRATE EQ INTELLIGENCE                      able to recognize and regulate emotions and behaviors in the workplace         able to recognize others’ emotions and perspectives and take them into account         welcome perpetual feedbacks         interact with teammates with respect and empathy   DEMONSTRATE DATA INTELLIGENCE                      able to find patterns, evaluate data and reach conclusions which is essential for the business to gain insight         able to identify inconsistencies in data and information         able to effectively use data and research to reach informed and effective decisions   EMBRACE INNOVATION & TECHNOLOGY                1 .         be
 receptive to change occurring within the workplace         develop, sponsor, or support the introduction of new and improved method, products, procedures, or technologies.         always challenge on boundaries and status quo,   not
 being constrained by current thoughts or approaches         Be innovative, people can make the difference, a small difference can lead to a big change. Additional Information Career Level Entry Level Qualification Non-Degree Tertiary Industry Job Function Years of Experience 1 year Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Dental insurance, Five-day work week, Flexible working hours, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Overtime pay, Performance bonus Company details Hop Lun is an international leading fashion service company. We engage in design development, manufacture, distribution and retail business of fashion lingerie,
 swimwear, casual wear and night wear. Other than providing one-on-one ODM service to global retailer we also have two brands for our global wholesale and retail business which are Dorina and 6IXTY8IGHT. Hop Lun was founded in Hong Kong in 1992. We today have
 11 fully owned factories in Bangladesh, China and Indonesia and 8 sales offices in Austria, Benelux, Hong Kong, France, Germany, Sweden, UK and USA. Nearly 130 retail stores in Greater China, including HK & Macau, Korea and Taiwan operating under the name
 of “6IXTY8IGHT”.  Opus are currently recruiting on behalf of a best-in-class technology platform that focuses on delivering relevant engagement with consumers. Due to expansion they have a new headcount for an Application
 Support Coordinator to help reduce resolution time. This client handles trillions of requests every month and growing. If you are interested in working with big data and want to push the limits, this is a great opportunity for you. This opportunity would suit someone who is enthusiastic about new technology. Someone comfortable being a mediator between account and technology teams. You will have the ability to communicate technical
 scenarios in real world terms so non-technical teams are able to understand.  Role Responsibilities: -Support for technical issues: ensuring that incidents are handled with adherence to SLAs -Multi-task, manage and resolve transactional application support requests -Puzzle-solving, problem-solving and issue troubleshooting -Executing Stored Procedures in SQL -Maintain the company’s ticketing system; answer, troubleshoot and resolve various technical issues
 -Take initiative on tickets that can be completed without Development Team assistance Required Experience: -0-3 years relevant work experience as a support representative in a small or medium sized business -Outstanding troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving abilities, along with an ability to collaborate cross-functionally in a fast-paced environment -Basic to mid-level SQL and HTML experience -Knowledge of Excel and MS Office, including pivot tables, chart-making, and manipulation of large data sets is a plus -Fluent spoken and written multi-lingual skills at a technical level -An Ability to explain complex subjects to a non-technical audience. title: Senior Engineer, Data Analytics
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Senior Engineer, Data Analytics Hong Kong Applied Science and Technology Research Institute Company Limited (ASTRI) Shatin Area Salary provided Posted on 27 Mar 2019 Senior Engineer, Data Analytics Hong Kong Applied Science and Technology Research Institute Company Limited (ASTRI) Job Highlights Job Description Reference #: CTO/SNDS/DATA/2436a-b/181121 Develop compelling PoC’s and solutions using emerging technologies for real-time and big data analytics. Apply machine learning, deep learning techniques for a variety of modeling and relevance problems. Meet customers to understand their requirements and translate them into mathematic modelling. Closely collaborate with other developers and architects in developing client solutions. Requirements Bachelor’s degree or above in Computer Science/Electronic Engineering/Information Engineering/Mathematics with 6+ years of experience, or Master’s degree with 3+ years’ experience, or PhD holder in related area. Candidates with less experience will be considered as Engineer. Programming experience in one or more of the following: Java, C++, Python, R or equivalent. Hands-on experience on developing and training machine learning models or deep neural networks. Experience/knowledge in machine learning packages (e.g., scikit-learn, Tensorflow, caffe, PyTorch) is a plus. Computer Science fundamentals in algorithm design, complexity analysis, problem solving and diagnosis. Passion in learning new technologies. Self-motivated and well organized with can-do attitude. Strong communication and data presentation skills. Excellent command of English, fluency in Cantonese and Mandarin is a plus. Application Appointment will be on renewable contract terms with a competitive salary and performance-linked variable pay. Fringe benefits include paid leave, medical and dental benefits, insurance coverage and contribution to MPF. The incumbent will normally work under a five-day week schedule. Interested candidates should send application (quoting Ref. No.) with detailed resume and, current and expected salary to the HR Department by clicking Apply Now.  Only short-listed candidates will be notified. Personal data provided by applicants will be used for consideration of an application only. ASTRI reserves the right not to fill the position. Additional Information Career Level Not Specified Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience Not Specified Employment Type Contract, Full Time Benefits Dental insurance, Five-day work week, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus Company Website Company details Hong Kong Applied Science and Technology Research Institute Company Limited (ASTRI)  was set up by the Hong Kong SAR Government in 2000 with the mission of enhancing Hong Kong’s competitiveness in technology-based industries through applied research. Our R&D strategic focus covers five areas of applications: Financial Technologies, Intelligent Manufacturing, Health Technologies, Smart City, and Application Specific Integrated Circuits through our mandate as the Hong Kong branch of the Chinese National Engineering Research Centre (CNERC).  ASTRI’s core R&D competence in various areas is organised under seven Technology Divisions: Mixed Signal Systems IC, Advanced Digital Systems, Electronics Components, Intelligent Sensing Technology System, Intelligent Software and Systems, Security and Data Sciences, and Communications Technologies.  Owing to the continuous expansion in our R&D activities, we are seeking qualified professionals to fill the following position(s): (The requirements and responsibilities of the vacancies are posted on our  website : www.astri.or g ). title: ‧ Finance Manager ‧
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs ‧ Finance Manager ‧ Future Growth Limited Central Posted on 27 Mar 2019 ‧ Finance Manager ‧ Future Growth Limited Job Highlights Job Description International Entertainment Corporation is a listed company in the Stock Exchange of Hong Kong Limited and looking for a high caliber candidate
 to fill the following  post:  
   - Finance Manager - 
 Job Role: Responsible for financial reporting and accounting operations of the business, ensuring compliance to group and statutory requirements; Execute financial analyses, consolidation and cash flow projections, providing commentary and recommendation to senior management; Liaise with bankers and handle external/internal audits, tax compliance and planning; Set business targets for each financial year through the annual budget and play a control role to meet the targets, and monitor the budgeted amount
 for maintenance of financial position; Take initiative in delivering finance and accounting support to special projects such as accounting system upgrade/implementation, M&A, due-diligence,
 other new business initiatives and investment related projects Handle ad hoc assignment when required. 
 
 Job Requirement: Degree holder in Finance / Accounting or equivalent; Finalist HKICPA or equivalent; Independent, self-motivated, analytical, responsible, good communication and inter-personal skills; 4-5 years relevant experience in Accounting and Finance, preferably gained from a Hong Kong listed company or Big 4 trained is a plus; Familiar with Hong Kong financial reporting requirements; Knowledge in SFO/Hong Kong Listing Rules and Regulations is an advantage; Good command in written and spoken English and Mandarin Immediate available is preferred

title: Head of Supply Chain Analytics (Global Director level)
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Head of Supply Chain Analytics (Global Director level) Philips Electronics Hong Kong Limited Shatin Area Salary provided Posted on 27 Mar 2019 Head of Supply Chain Analytics (Global Director level) Philips Electronics Hong Kong Limited Job Highlights Job Description Be the lead and inspiration in our transformation journey for the products Supply Chain, act as global head role to manage & execute end-to-end data analysis aims for operational excellence of
 global Supply Chain Management for Philips Personal Health business.   Determines the policy for the logistics department of the Business Unit.
 Manages an integral logistics department via a large number of department managers.
 Formulates the long-term logistics policy, taking into account all the relevant factors for integrated management Initiates changes to logistics management concepts in accordance with the requirements
 of the business leading to improvements across the entire supply chain. Organize & develop analytics towards the defined Supply Chain metrics. Expertize in translating business requirements in to solutions and vice versa. Strong execution and drive for results, focus on customers and change management to force E2E operational excellence for Supply Chain
 functions            Applies advanced analytic techniques such as optimization, simulation, data mining and statistics to design, implement, validate, and refine mathematical models and algorithms to understand, evaluate and optimize supply chain
 products. Balances analytics with sufficient business acumen to translate complex business challenges into tractable mathematical models and IT requirements for
 automation                                                                                            Develops insightful data driven recommendations and actions. Act as a business owner for Supply Chain Analytics investments, partner with HR, IT and the business to ensure all aspects of capability building, including rollout in the markets.   Our collaborative global team of international professionals, helping us to develop, build for operational excellence and process enhancement of Supply Chain in Philips global. As we value diversity,
 we have a diverse and multifunctional team and a lot of resources to support you.   Bachelor Degree or above, MBA preferred Minimum 15 years of professional experience in supply chain and operations
 management.    Knowledge of statistical programs (i.e. eViews, Mathlab) is necessary. A PhD in mathematics, physics or statistics is a preferred. Strong experience in managing multinational / multi-cultural teams in complex business environments and dealing with customers. In depth knowledge of Inventory and Delivery Performance
 Management                                                                                           Excellent communications skills with strong problem solving and analytical skills Experience in managing communication at all levels in the organization, and ability to interact at the highest level of the
 organization.      A path towards your most rewarding career. Philips is one of the best in-class organization which offers you big exposure and long-term career development such as internal transfer and international
 mobility opportunities.   Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across
 the  . Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways.   To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the
  on our career website, where you can read stories from our
 . Once there, you can also learn about our  , or find answers to some of the  .     Additional Information Career Level Top Qualification Postgraduate Industry Job Function Years of Experience 15 years Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Benefits Dental insurance, Double pay, Five-day work week, Free shuttle bus, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus Company Website Company details About Royal Philips  Royal Philips (NYSE: PHG, AEX: PHIA) is a leading health
 technology company focused on improving people’s health and enabling better outcomes across the health continuum from healthy living and prevention, to diagnosis, treatment and home care. Philips leverages advanced technology and deep clinical and consumer
 insights to deliver integrated solutions. The company is a leader in diagnostic imaging, image-guided therapy, patient monitoring and health informatics, as well as in consumer health and home care. Philips’ wholly owned subsidiary Philips Lighting is the
 global leader in lighting products, systems and services. Headquartered in the Netherlands, Philips posted 2015 sales of EUR 24.2 billion and employs approximately 104,000 employees with sales and services in more than 100 countries. News about Philips can
 be found at  www.philips.com/newscenter . title: Senior Manager, Data Engineering
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Senior Manager, Data Engineering Cigna International Corporation Wan Chai Salary provided Posted on 27 Mar 2019 Senior Manager, Data Engineering Cigna International Corporation Job Highlights Job Description Job Objective:   
   This person will be responsible for building distributed components, systems, and tools that will power the data and analytics capabilities within Cigna
 Hong Kong. This role will be at the intersection of health and analytics and will be focused on helping the teams evolve from a data and analytics perspective. As a member of the team you will spend your time designing and growing the current data infrastructure
 and enhancing the velocity at which the organization leverages and gets value out of the data.     Job Description:   Manage and implement the technical roadmap of the analytics function within Cigna Hong Kong Deliver the Hong Kong data lake, set up infrastructure to support ingestion of data from multiple data sources, and ensure the data science and analytics teams have the infrastructure they
 need to be able to move at a rapid pace Build ETL pipeline and manage the ETL development process including but not limited to requirement gathering from business units, data mapping, quality testing and programming code development Design and implement data warehouse architecture Collaborate with multiple teams to identify opportunities to manage data and provide solutions for complex data feeds within organization Implement strategies for data warehouse additions and enhancement Manage and lead a small to medium sized data projects Act as an internal expert in each of the data sources to own overall data quality     Requirement:   At least 3-6 years of relevant experience in high data volume environments, degree holder in Information Technology/ Computer Science/ Engineering or a related discipline MS/PhD in Computer Science or a related field is ideal Hands on experience in gathering technical and business requirements, data mapping, ETL development and Data Warehousing Strong experience in the setup and implementation of cloud infrastructure Strong  system analytical skill and architectural design ability of robust distributed systems Demonstrated superior performance in prior roles with increasing levels of responsibility and independence; demonstrated ability to handle multiple projects and solve complex problems Strong multi-tasking abilities, flexibility and good team player Passion for data and business intelligence and an interest in moving towards big data, cloud and advanced analytics projects Strong communication skills with fluency in English a must Proficiency with Python, noSQL and SQL environments Experience with Java or API integrations is a plus Experience with open sourced technologies – Kafka, Hadoop, Hive Experience with BI tools such as Tableau and Looker is a plus Prior project management experience will be highly preferred **Only candidates' direct applications will be considered** Additional Information Career Level Not Specified Qualification Not Specified Industry Job Function Years of Experience Not Specified Employment Type Full Time Benefits Dental insurance, Education allowance, Five-day work week, Life insurance, Medical insurance, Performance bonus Company details We’re a global health service company dedicated to helping people improve their health, well-being and sense of security. We offer an integrated suite of health services, such as medical, dental, behavioral health, pharmacy, vision, supplemental
 benefits, and other related products that serve over 95 million customers around the world.  When you work with us, you’ll enjoy a different kind of career - you’ll make a difference, learn a ton, and change the way people think about health insurance. To
 see our culture in action, search #TeamCigna on Twitter or Instagram. title: Corporate Planning Assistant Manager (Japanese speaking)
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Corporate Planning Assistant Manager (Japanese speaking) Hitachi Capital (Hong Kong) Limited Mong Kok Salary provided Posted on 28 Mar 2019 Corporate Planning Assistant Manager (Japanese speaking) Hitachi Capital (Hong Kong) Limited Job Highlights Job Description -              To support and coordinate new business Strategic initiatives and activities -              To set up strategic plan for business promotion -              To develop new dealers and explore new business products -              To perform and monitor marketing activities and business promotion -              To support head of department on corporate planning to ensure the operations in line with the pre-set strategic direction -              To perform on site or office visit for credit underwriting and credit investigation -              To provide supervision and motivate team members -              To submit big ticket application to Head Office -              To cooperate with other departments an any business and company issue -              To report market information and business movement to Department Head -               
 Degree Holder or above (Degree in Accounting / Finance is preferable) -               
 At least 3-4 relevant working experience in finance field -               
 Mature and pleasant personality with good communication skill, good presentation skill and strong management skill -               
 Proficient in spoken and written Japanese (JPLT N1 is preferred), English & Cantonese; fluent in Mandarin would be an advantage -               
 Good credit underwriting skill and negotiation skill -

title: (Senior) Compliance Auditor (12mth Contract)
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs (Senior) Compliance Auditor (12mth Contract) Hasbro Far East Limited Tsim Sha Tsui Salary provided Posted on 28 Mar 2019 (Senior) Compliance Auditor (12mth Contract) Hasbro Far East Limited Job Highlights Job Description Primary focus will be to develop and execute, on behalf of management, testing routines that will provide senior management with assurance as to the adequacy of existing systems and controls to manage risks effectively and to achieve key objectives, in terms of Corporate Governance and the Business Control Environment.    Specific emphasis will be placed on controls in place to support compliance with the requirements of the Sarbanes Oxley Act (SOX) and the adequacy of existing processes in place to ensure compliance with the trading structure in all relevant locations globally.   Responsi bilities: Perform the audit in a professional manner in accordance with the approved audit program. Prepare or revise appropriate audit programs to accomplish audit objectives. Demonstrate the ability to obtain, analyze, and evaluate evidence obtained during a review and express an informed, objective opinion on the control system ’ s adequacy and effectiveness and the efficient performance of the activities being reviewed. Review transactions, documents, records, reports, and methods for accuracy and effectiveness. Prepare working papers to record and summarize data on the assigned audit section. Demonstrate the ability to discuss audit findings. Prepare written audit findings and draft audit reports. Evaluate responses to reports to determine reasonableness and determine appropriate follow-up actions. Appraise the adequacy of corrective action taken to improve deficient conditions. University degree in Accounting, Finance or International Business with a professional qualification i.e. CPA, CIA, CISA or other  Min. 3 years of Internal or External Audit experience gained from Big 4 and/or a sizable organization Sound knowledge of internal audit methodologies  S trong written and oral communication skills  Flexible, able to take initiatives, self-motivated, organized and be able to meet strict deadlines Excellent analytical skill and attentive to details Fluent in English, Cantonese and Mandarin Willing to travel up to 20% of the year.    (Each overseas project generally requires 1-2 week travel.) Candidate with less experience will be considered as Compliance Auditor.   Additional Information Career Level Not Specified Qualification Not Specified Industry Job Function Years of Experience Not Specified Employment Type Contract, Full Time Benefits Flexible working hours, Gratuity, Medical insurance, Work from home Company Website Company details More Jobs from this employer Analyst Costing, Product (12-month Contract) Posted on  16-Apr-19 VP Legal, Asia Pacific Posted on  28-Mar-19 Director Manufacturing Engineering Posted on  28-Mar-19 View all jobs from this employer About JobsDB About jobsDB FAQ Career @ jobsDB Contact us Contact us International partners Bdjobs (Bandladesh) Brighter Monday (East Africa) Catho (Brazil) Jobberman (West Africa) JobStreet (S.E. Content: You will assist the team in regularly developing content for Fiducia’s presentations, publications, and flyers, focusing on current China business strategies and
 trends. Events: From big scale seminars to in-house presentations, we participate in over 70 events a year. You will help to organise events, liaising with strategic partners and

 as John Hancock in the United States and Manulife elsewhere. We provide financial advice, insurance, as well as wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2018, we had more than 34,000 employees, over 82,000

title: Associate Director,  Finance Systems, Financial Management
description: jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Associate Director,  Finance Systems, Financial Management KPMG Central Salary provided Posted on 29 Mar 2019 Associate Director,  Finance Systems, Financial Management KPMG Job Highlights Job Description In Management Consulting, you’ll join a large and rapidly growing team, contributing to a range of projects that help clients address some of the biggest issues they’re facing in the boardroom. By helping them to add lasting value to the bottom line and make huge improvements in their performance, you’ll support them in transforming the way they do business.  Our approach involves both strategy and implementation, which means we’re not just thinkers, but practical doers, creating client strategies that are designed to work in the real world.   In Financial Management, we improve the effectiveness and efficiency of the finance function and generate real insights to help deliver value to the business.  As digital disruption affects more industry sectors, Chief Financial Officers (CFOs) find it increasingly challenging to deliver sustainable growth in profits and dividends, whilst managing costs. Join this team and we can ensure you’re equipped to support and advise CFOs in this constantly changing world by training you in at least one of these capabilities: - How to develop a company’s finance strategy - Process improvement, including what good looks like for each of the key finance processes - Implementing systems changes specifically in cloud-based technology solutions, using our powered solution - Implementing process enhancement through digital and robotic technologies  - Organisational change and specifically designing and implementing a shared service centre - Regulatory changes  Armed with these skills and supported to continue developing your expertise, you’ll help our Finance Transformation teams in these areas: -   – enabling finance to add more value to the business by improving processes such as business planning, forecasting and the provision of regular management information.  -   – enabling finance to deliver these services quicker, cheaper and with better controls.  -  – Facilitate the strategy, vendor selection, implementation and post implementation in areas of business process, security and data  We are looking for an   with prior experience as Project Manager / Senior Project Team Members in the area of   (e.g. Oracle, SAP, Tagetik or similar solutions).  Candidates with either experience in the commercial sector or a professional service firm will be considered.  - Extensive experience working in a Big 4 professional firm or a large corporation - Excellent knowledge of finance systems, emerging technologies and digital solutions - Experience in delivering implementation projects and working as part of a development team - Strong people manager, able to lead large teams and develop others  - Self-starting, pro-active team player that is experienced in working in challenging environments and within a multi-disciplined team  - Ability to liaise with senior Finance stakeholders  - Ability to create and deliver high level presentations and output reviews to senior executives / stakeholders and business managers  - Experience in performing business development  - Ability to review and challenge information that has been provided by other team members, ensuring the information is ‘fit for purpose’ and at the right level of granularity  - Ability to perform structured analysis on business models to provide best practice knowledge  - Strong written and verbal communication skills in English - Cantonese speaking candidates are preferred  We offer successful candidates an attractive remuneration package and the opportunity to work in a dynamic and exciting environment.  Personal data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only.  © 2019 KPMG, a Hong Kong partnership and a member firm of the KPMG network of independent member firms affiliated with KPMG International Cooperative ("KPMG International"), a Swiss entity. All rights reserved. Additional Information Career Level Senior Qualification Degree Industry Job Function Years of Experience Not Specified Employment Type Full Time, Permanent Company Website Company details KPMG China operates in 19 cities across China, with around 12,000 partners and staff in Beijing, Beijing Zhongguancun, Changsha, Chengdu, Chongqing, Foshan, Fuzhou, Guangzhou, Hangzhou, Nanjing, Qingdao, Shanghai, Shenyang, Shenzhen, Tianjin, Wuhan, Xiamen, Xi'an, Hong Kong SAR and Macau SAR.   KPMG is a global network of professional services firms providing Audit, Tax and Advisory services. We operate in 154 countries and territories, and have 200,000 people working in member firms around the world. title: Senior Cloud Infrastructure Architect, Global Financial Services
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Senior Cloud Infrastructure Architect, Global Financial Services Amazon Web Services Hong Kong Limited Not Specified Salary provided Posted on 29 Mar 2019 Senior Cloud Infrastructure Architect, Global Financial Services Amazon Web Services Hong Kong Limited Job Highlights Job Description Description At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we’re hiring highly technical cloud computing architects to help our partners develop technical expertise and capacity, while also collaborating with our customers
 and partners on key engagements. Our consultants will deliver proof-of-concept projects, topical workshops, and lead implementation projects. These professional services engagements will focus on key customer solutions such as, web applications, enterprise
 applications, HPC, batch processing and big data, archiving and disaster recovery, education and government. Professional Services engage in a wide variety of projects for customers and partners, providing collective experience from across the AWS customer base and are obsessed about strong success
 for the Customer. Our team collaborates across the entire AWS organization to bring access to product and service teams, to get the right solution delivered and drive feature innovation based upon customer needs. · Expertise - Collaborate with AWS field sales, pre-sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use AWS services in key market verticals & regulated industries
 such as financial services, healthcare, life sciences, and energy · Delivery - Engagements will include migration of existing applications and development of new applications using AWS cloud services. This will be done via onsite customer projects. · Insights - Work with AWS engineering, support and business teams to convey partner and customer feedback as input to AWS technology roadmaps. Basic Qualifications: · 5+ or more years of IT implementation experience · Implementing experience with primary AWS services (EC2, ELB, RDS, Route53 & S3). · Leading highly-available and fault-tolerant enterprise and web-scale software deployments. · Infrastructure automation through DevOps scripting (E.g. shell, Python, Ruby, Powershell). · Configuration management using CloudFormation, Chef & Puppet. · Extended travel to customer locations may be required to sell and deliver professional services as needed 
 · AWS Experience · Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations. · Strong practical Linux and Windows-based systems administration skills in a Cloud or Virtualized environment. · Experience managing data center operations, including data assurance, monitoring, alerting and notifications. · Customer facing skills to represent AWS well within the customer’s environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, best practices, project management and
 risk mitigation · Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges · Deep hands-on experience leading the design, development and deployment of business software at scale or current hands on technology infrastructure, network, compute, storage, and virtualization
 experience · Proven experience with software development life cycle (SDLC) and agile/iterative methodologies required · Integration of AWS cloud services with on-premise technologies from Microsoft, IBM, Oracle, HP, SAP etc. · Experience with IT compliance and risk management requirements (eg. security, privacy, SOX, HIPAA etc.) Additional Information Career Level Not Specified Qualification Not Specified Industry Job Function Years of Experience Not Specified Employment Type Full Time Company details Please visit our website to know more:

title: Application Developer / Programmer (5 Days Work)
description:
jobsDB.com My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App or   JOB SEEKER My jobsDB Resources Career Insights Download Our App For Employers SETTINGS Country & Language Hong Kong (English) Log in Sign up Back to menu Hong Kong (English) Indonesia (English) Indonesia (Bahasa) Singapore (English) Thailand (English) ไทย (ภาษาไทย) Search Jobs Application Developer / Programmer (5 Days Work) SmartRetail Kowloon Bay Salary provided Posted on 29 Mar 2019 Application Developer / Programmer (5 Days Work) SmartRetail Job Highlights Job Description The Application Developer contributes to the development of software, web, and multi-media applications that facilitates the achievement of business outcomes and improves business
 efficiencies and processes through leveraging technology. Prepare specialised code as required by the product definition to enable application development Contribute technical expertise to requirements analysis to enhance the quality of the solution design Complete testing and gather feedback to improve the quality and reduce operational risk of the developed application Undertake post-release activities to develop a base of knowledge to be incorporated in future build and release cycles Provide 3rd tier application support and problem resolution to minimise the impact of application related service outages Balance competing demands to ensure project objectives are achieved Next Generation Retail Solutions AI and Machine Learning Big Data Mobile Technologies UI and UX Experience using GoLang, C++ or Java Experience using NodeJS/PHP, ReactJS Framework, Javascript Strong knowledge of building complex layouts using HTML and CSS Combination of experience with MySQL, Redis, MongoDB or MySQL solutions Familiar with Linux (Ubuntu, CentOS), Android and iOS Higher Diploma or BSc or above, Major in Computer Science / Information Technology / Electronic and Computer Engineering / Enterprise Information Systems / Mathematics / Physics
 or related disciplines  Fresh graduates are welcome Designs, codes, verifies, tests, documents, amends and refactors moderately complex programs/scripts. Applies agreed standards and tools, to achieve a well-engineered result. Collaborates in reviews of work with others as appropriate. Creates and documents detailed designs for simple software applications or components applying agreed modelling techniques, standards, patterns and tools. Contributes to the design of components of larger software systems. Reviews own work. Defines test conditions for given requirements. Designs test cases and creates test scripts and supporting data, working to the specifications provided. Interprets, executes and records test cases in accordance with project test plans. Analyses and
 reports test activities and results. Identifies and reports issues and risks. Benefits 5-day workweek Birthday Leave 
 12 Days Annual Leave Medical Insurance Free snack and drinks Additional Information Career Level Entry Level Qualification Non-Degree Tertiary Industry Job Function Years of Experience 1 year Employment Type Full Time Benefits Five-day work week, Life insurance, Medical insurance Company Website Company details [email protected] About JobsDB About jobsDB FAQ Career @ jobsDB Contact us Contact us International partners Bdjobs (Bandladesh) Brighter Monday (East Africa) Catho (Brazil) Jobberman (West Africa) JobStreet (S.E.
